Issue.Title: Log4net not working with NUnit
Issue.Description: Problem: Using log4net with newer versions of nunit means that nolog file is created.Demonstration follows.I created the solution in VS 2008.The OS is Windows XP.I tested using both the nunit GUI and console.I compared Nunit 2.2.5 with 2.5.5 (I suspect 2.5.0 will fail as well.)The solution is created as a console app.When the app is run as a console application a Log file is produced.When the app is run using 2.2.5 a Log file is produced.When the app is run using 2.5.5 no Log file is produced.Repro details and other info at

Issue.Title: SimpleTestRunner miss handles point of exception
Issue.Description: The SimpleTestRunner performs a an odd skip of Exception processing when faced with a fully un-implemented EventListener. What happens is that my RunStarted throws an Exception and this gets caught end then RunFinished is called which then throws an exception -- the stack trace makes it look like the RunFinished was the culprit when in fact the RunStart began the exceptional behavior. This occurs mainly because the catch( Exception exception ) catches everything. Perhaps what it should do is catch NUnit exceptions and throw all other exceptions -- I'm not familiar enough with the architecture around Exception testing, Assert Exceptions, etc.So here is the culprit code in SimpleTestRunner, Line 141, of release 2.5.5.101112.public virtual TestResult Run( EventListener listener, ITestFilter filter ){ try { log.Debug("Starting test run"); // Take note of the fact that we are running this.runThread = Thread.CurrentThread; listener.RunStarted( this.Test.TestName.FullName, test.CountTestCases( filter ) ); testResult = test.Run( listener, filter ); // Signal that we are done listener.RunFinished( testResult ); log.Debug("Test run complete"); // Return result array return testResult; } catch( Exception exception ) { // RunStart actually threw the exception. so RunFinish doesn't make sense.`` // Signal that we finished with an exception listener.RunFinished( exception ); // Rethrow - should we do this? throw; } finally { runThread = null; }}Cheers,L

Issue.Title: Data Driven TestFixture
Issue.Description: I have hierarchy like data-driven test cases thats 3 levels deep.Currently the TestFixture can only be instantiated only a constantnumber of times. How can I parameterize the TestFixture based onsource input, same like the TestCaseSource attribute?More info at

Issue.Description: #### GoalNot crash Look like crash happened at the jni It's a little hard to debug for me#### Steps & Code to Reproduce``#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 7.0.6Realm Sync feature enabled: NoAndroid Studio version: AS 4.0Android Build Tools version: 29.0.0Which Android version and device(s): Android 10, Huawei Mate20 Pro

Issue.Title: Login not working with email-credentials (token contains an invalid number of segments)
Issue.Description: #### GoalLogin user with with email and password -> val credentials = Credentials.emailPassword(email, password)app.loginAsync(credentials)#### Actual ResultsFailing with result: SERVICE_UNKNOWN(realm::app::ServiceError:-1): token contains an invalid number of segments, false#### Steps & Code to ReproduceLogin with email and password is not working anymore in Beta 7. With Beta 6 the login is working without a problem.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): io.realm:realm-gradle-plugin:10.0.0-BETA.7Realm Sync feature enabled: Yes

Issue.Title: Reset password always responds with invalid token data
Issue.Description: #### GoalReset Password with App.emailPassword.resetPasswordAsync(token, tokenId, newPassword)#### Actual ResultsFails with the response "invalid token data". The HTTP Request show,HTTP Request = POST \*\*\*\*/auth/providers/local-userpass/reset Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json;charset=utf-8 Accept: application/json Content-Type: application/json;charset=utf-8 {"password":"***(my_token)","token":"my_tokenId","token_id":"my_password"}BAD_REQUEST(realm::app::ServiceError:48): invalid token data#### Steps & Code to ReproduceBy resetting the password the server response is alway " invalid token data". The console also shows, that the data gets mixed up. The function is declared as resetPasswordAsync(token, tokenId, newPassword) but the HTTP Request is showing, that the newPassword is set as tokenId, the token is set as password and the tokenId is the new password.Even trying on shuffling the function values to --- App.resetPasswordAsync(**newPassword, token, tokenId**) --- the result ist the same. Except that the HTTP Request is correct.Request is:{"password":"***(my_token)","token":"my_tokenId","token_id":"my_password"}should be:{"password":"***(my_password)","token":"my_token","token_id":"my_tokenId"}#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): io.realm:realm-gradle-plugin:10.0.0-BETA.7Realm Sync feature enabled: Yes

Issue.Title: Fix parallel build problems with Kotlin Extensions
Issue.Code: Caused by: org.gradle.api.resources.MissingResourceException: Could not read '/tmp/realm-java@2/realm/kotlin-extensions/build/outputs/aar/realm-kotlin-extensions-objectServer-release.aar' as it does not exist. `
Issue.Description: ``From I think the problem is that we re-enabled parallel Gradle builds, but it hasn't been 100% confirmed as the issue doesn't reproduce consistently.

Issue.Description: for example, group data by mouth, according to the time of data

Issue.Description: #### GoalNo Crash#### Actual Resultsthrow NPE using nullable field. NPEcaused by this changed ``log: Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to get length of null arrayat : io.realm.com_sundayfun_daycam_data_ShotRealmProxy.toString()#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 7.0.3Realm Sync feature enabled: NOlanguage: Kotiln, kapt.

PullRequest.Title: Add support for RealmProxy#toString() to print length information for binary field
PullRequest.Description: Fixes #1650

Issue.Title: Failure when converting to UTF-8 (WITH SAMPLE REPO)
Issue.Code: Fatal Exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal Argument: Failure when converting to UTF-8; error_code = 6; 0x0050 0x0061 0x0070 0x0061 0x0020 0x0047 0x0020 0xd83c Exception backtrace: <backtrace not supported on this platform> in /Users/cm/Realm/realm-java/realm/realm-library/src/main/cpp/io_realm_internal_Table.cpp line 798 at io.realm.internal.Table.nativeFindFirstString(Table.java) at io.realm.internal.Table.findFirstString(Table.java:583) at io.realm.com_coolapp_CoolObjectRealmProxy.copyOrUpdate(com_coolapp_CoolObjectRealmProxy.java:507) at io.realm.LibraryModuleMediator.copyOrUpdate(LibraryModuleMediator.java:105) at io.realm.Realm.copyOrUpdate(Realm.java:1700) at io.realm.Realm.copyToRealmOrUpdate(Realm.java:1296) `
Issue.Description: ### We received a crash report with the following truncated stack trace:``#### Steps & Code to ReproduceWe were able to reproduce this by attempting to insert the following string into realm:`val problemString = "\uD83D"`This is the workaround we are using at present:`String(badText.toByteArray(Charsets.UTF_8))`#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 7.0.2#### Repo demonstrating crash

Issue.Title: Realm access from incorrect thread.
Issue.Description: Getting this below error in some of the devices and in some devices it's working fine.Error: Realm access from incorrect thread. Realm objects can only be accessed on the thread they were created.getSuccessDataFromDb() calling from background thread, not main thread.``

Issue.Title: How to migrate moving RealmObject to another module
Issue.Description: I have been developing a monolith app for a while already, but recently I have decided to create a separate data layer module where I would keep all the realm classes. However, I didn't really find an example how to deal with the migration.Could maybe somebody share such experience?

Issue.Title: Hide ClientResync API's
Issue.Description: We should hide the Client Resync API's from the public API until they are ready for use again.No reason to delete them, just make the builder parameters package protected.

Issue.Title: Fix and reenable examples for MongoDB Realm
Issue.Description: `unitTestExample` needs to be re-enabled and updated to work with 10.0.0`secureUserStore` should be deleted. We no longer support custom user stores.Part of[

PullRequest.Title: MongoDB Realm: Merging Realm and Stitch
PullRequest.Description:
DO NOT PUSH DIRECTLY TO THIS PR. All changes should be through other PR's. This PR replaces
Closes #6726
This PR is an umbrella PR for all things related to the SDK merge between Stitch and Realm. Currently, it is expected to be released after the Core 6 upgrade that is labeled `7.0`. After discussion alternatives, this release is tentatively labeled as `10.0`
See
## Goals * Local database users should see no changes (ideally). * Existing sync users using fully synchronized Realms should be able to upgrade with relatively little changes. * Remove all references and API's to Query-based Sync * Remove all references and API's to Permissions and Roles * Add functionality required for the merge (purposely left vague for now)
## TODO (Incomplete) - [x] Figure out what happens to ROS error codes when using Stitch for Auth - [x] Remove all Object Level permission API's. They are now handled on Stitch (Realm Cloud) - [x] Remove Query-based-sync. Support will look different when backed by Atlas. - [ ] Consider adding support for `androidx.startup` as a mean to remove `Realm.init(context)`. This could align us with how SDK's are going to initialize the RealmApp class. - [x] Fix - [ ] Reenable PMD and Checkstyle - [x] Reenable `unitTestExample` - [x] Rethink how `secureUserStore` example works - [x] Fix `objectServerExample` and rename to `mongoDbRealmExample` - [x] Reenable Dokka for Kotlin Extensions - [x] Test all transport methods: get, post, patch, delete, put - [x] Fix transport leak in RealmApp.nativeCreate - [x] Move support for proxies and custom headers - [x] Move support for custom certificates - [ ] Add support for JSONErrorCode from ObjectStore - [ ] Reenable JavaDoc generation - [x] Store Stitch logs as CI artifacts - [x] Don't use images on AWS, but from Github Docker Registry instead - [x] Move old `SyncManager.AuthenticationListener` to `RealmApp` - [ ] Define what is the default log level. INFO or WARN? - [x] Disable Client Resync modes - [x] Review JavaDoc for `RealmApp.logOut` and RealmUser.logOut` - [x] Cleanup RealmApp/RealmUser responsibility. - [x] Remove Client Resync from the public API - [x] LinkUser still having issues in ObjectStore - [x] User-Agent Strings should also be sent when making HTTP Requests (OS) - [x] Re-enable ClientReset tests - [ ] ProgressListeners appears to have bugs. These tests have been disabled. - [x] Proxy support is currently broken.
### Missing Stitch functionality - [x] RealmApp super class (most of old SyncUser methods) - [x] AppCredentials + tests (except third-party auth) - [x] ApiKey credentials - [x] CustomFunction credentials - [x] RealmUser and tests - [x] Finalize RealmAppConfiguration + JavaDoc - [x] RealmApp.Login() - [x] RealmApp.Logout() / RealmUser.logout() - [x] RealmApp.currentUser() - [x] RealmApp.allUsers() - [x] RealmApp.switchUser() - [x] RealmApp.removeUser() - [x] RealmFCMPushNotifications - [x] EmailPasswordProviderClient - [x] ApiKeyProviderClient - [x] RealmApp.linkUser() - [x] CustomData(where)? - [x] Remote mongodb client - [x] RealmFunctions - [x] Add `partionKey` to `SyncConfiguration` (initial support for QBS in the new Realm Cloud) - [x] Open a synced Realm

Issue.Title: Does the IntentService check for RealmChangeListeners still make sense?
Issue.Description: #### Describe your problem or use case1. I have an `IntentService` where I perform some transactions in `Realm`1. I want to set a `RealmChangeListener` in the beginning of `onHandleIntent(Intent)`, perform all transactions, and remove the listener before returning1. the listener should be called, if any relevant changes are made1. I get the following error when I try to add the listener: `Realm cannot be automatically updated on an IntentService thread.`#### Describe the solution you'd likeI understand why this happens, since `onHandleIntent(Intent)` calls `stopSelf()` before returning, it could potentially cause a problem, since the `IntentService` and its `HandlerThread` could be terminated, preventing the listener to be called.However, I have created a replica of `IntentService` (changing its name avoid Realm's [detection]( and I haven't had any issues with my listener being called.My listener's `onChange()` method is consistently called before `stopSelf()`.So, my question would be if [this check]( is still needed, since it was updated 3 years ago and Realm has changed a lot during that time.#### Additional contextIf you think the check is still needed, I was wondering if there were any patterns you recommend as an alternative. I'm trying to simplify this workflow, since I could have a different `Service` listening for changes, but that could create some race conditions, since I wouldn't want to have `Realm` always open.Thanks!

Issue.Title: add object listener on null object
Issue.Description: Hello,i have a relam DB,here is the thing : i want to call a transaction in Realm for a null Obj (write it),and get notified right after the transaction state has changed(put on db successfully)i know realm has a listener that get notified for any transaction result change for list obj,what i want is to have the same result for one obj and not an array list obj

Issue.Title: Hide SSL configuration options in SyncConfiguration
Issue.Description: When we launch the MongoDB Realm Beta, there is no option for self-hosted, so our SSL controls for e.g. custom certificates do not make sense.They are on the roadmap though, so the easiest seems to just move the methods to be package-protected just like `clientResyncMode`. Then it becomes trivial to re-enable them again at a later date, while keeping them out of the public API for now.

Issue.Title: Date time day light saving issue in java 8 for time zone Australia/Melbourne
Issue.Description: I am getting different results for day light saving start and end.ZoneId zone = ZoneId.of("Australia/Melbourne");System.out.println(ZonedDateTime.of(2019, 04, 07, 3, 0, 0, 0, zone)); // statement-1System.out.println(ZonedDateTime.of(2019, 10, 06, 2, 0, 0, 0, zone)); // statement-2For the first half of day light saving for the year 2019, I am getting result as (2019-04-07T03:00**+10:00**[Australia/Melbourne]). Java is reducing 1 hour to offset value. But for second half of day light saving (statement-2=> 2019-10-06T03:00+11:00[Australia/Melbourne]) , java is adding 1 hour to time and +1 to offset value.As per my understanding java should increase 1 hour to time and +1 to offset value (end of DST) and while start of DST then java should decrease 1 hour from time and 1 from offset value.Please help me to get clarification regarding the differences. Is it java 8 issue or my understanding is incorrect ?

Issue.Title: Query heavily slows down other Realm operations
Issue.Description: #### GoalI have an Android application that, after some time, may work with thousands of objects. I have noticed that the application was getting slower and I was able to pinpoint the cause.#### Actual ResultsThere is a query that, once run, slows down everything else: other queries and transactions.The query itself completes very quickly, but then everything else becomes very slow.#### Steps & Code to ReproduceI have created a simplified Android project to reproduce the issue:The test project works with 100_000 `Item` objects:``How to test:- if you click on an item, it will toggle its `isBookmarked` flag quickly- if you click on the FAB (bottom right button), it will run the query 10 times on separate thread and, each time, it will complete quickly (check logcat)- however, after that, if you click again on the items, they will take a lot longer to perform their transactions --> **this is the issue**- also, the more you run the query, the slower everything else seems to become#### NoteThis might be related to If you remove `@Index` from all `Item` properties, the query takes a lot longer to complete, but it doesn't seem to slow down all other operations.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version: 6.1.0Android version: 9

Issue.Title: Singleton Class for Abstraction. realm access from incorrect thread.
Issue.Description: #### GoalI am trying to abstract the usage of Realm by creating a Singleton (which i think what the realm instances are) Class.#### Actual ResultsI am unable to access the data from the created Singleton Class.#### Steps & Code to Reproduce`Context.java```I am using RN btw. Though it works perfectly fine in a very straight forward approach in the app layer but since it is a `Singleton` it should still be accessible right?If i'm not mistaken this should be running in a single thread but it throws an error: `realm access from incorrect thread. realm objects can only be accessed on the thread they were created`

And the file no longer opens. App has to delete the realm file and re-create it. And so every time this error occurs.**Error stack:**`Caused by: io.realm.exceptions.RealmFileException: Unable to open a realm at path '($path)': Realm file decryption failed Path:. (Realm file decryption failed Path: ($path)) (($path)) in /Users/jasonflax/Development/realm-java/realm/realm-library/src/main/cpp/io_realm_internal_OsSharedRealm.cpp line 101 at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.nativeGetSharedRealm(Native Method) at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.<init>(OsSharedRealm.java:171) at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.getInstance(OsSharedRealm.java:241) at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.getInstance(OsSharedRealm.java:231) at io.realm.RealmCache.doCreateRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:332) at io.realm.RealmCache.createRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:285) at io.realm.Realm.getInstance(Realm.java:428)`**RealmConfiguration builder**`new RealmConfiguration.Builder() .encryptionKey(realmEncryptionKeyProvider.getEncryptionKey()) .name(REALM_NAME) .schemaVersion(REALM_SCHEMA_VERSION) .migration(new RemoveUserGenderAndEmailMigration()).build();`#### Steps & Code to ReproduceI can not reproduce this error on my phone.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 6.0.1Realm Sync feature enabled: NoAndroid Studio version: 3.5.3Android Build Tools version: 29.0.0Gradle version: 3.5.0Which Android version and device(s): **Huawei:** YAL-L21, v 9P10, v 9POT-LX1, v 9Honor 10, 9P20 Pro, 9P20 Pro, 10**Vivo**vivo 1806, 9**Samsung**Galaxy S7 Edge, 8.0.0SM-G970F, 9**Google**Pixel 2, 8.1.0

Issue.Title: Tests: Flaky RxJava tests?
Issue.Description: With the upgrade to Core 6, they appear to have become more unstable.This is a bit anecdotal, so this issue is trying to track the cases where it happens:findFirstAsync_emittedOnUpdate io.realm.RxJavaTests findFirstAsync_emittedOnDelete io.realm.RxJavaTests

Issue.Title: Realm crash signal 11 (SIGSEGV) , code 1 (SEGV_MAPERR), fault addr 0x0 - Cause: null pointer dereference
Issue.Description: #### GoalRealm runs without crashing#### Actual ResultsRealm crash with following trace:``#### Steps & Code to Reproducerealm.executeTransaction(realm -> realm.insertOrUpdate(result));This happens only generating an .apkAll works fine running from AndroidStudio with _debuggable = true_.I can reproduce from AndroidStudio setting _debuggable = false_#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 6.0.2Realm Sync feature enabled: NoAndroid Studio version: 3.5.3Android Build Tools version: 29.0.2Gradle version: 3.5.3Which Android version and device(s): Samsung Galaxy A8 (2018) SM-A530F - Android 8.0.0

Issue.Title: NDK21: Find a way to use JavaGlobalRef in progress listeners
Issue.Description: See

Issue.Title: NDK21: Fix ProgressListeners + Client Resync
Issue.Description: With #6460 merge there are two outstanding issues.1) ProgressListeners sometimes do not report the correct result: 2) Mixed type does not work with Client Resync: Both of these issues needs to be fixed before making a proper release from `next-major` branch.

Issue.Title: errorHandler(new FooHandler()) cause java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Configurations cannot be different if used to open the same file
Issue.Description: #### GoalAdd a custom ErrorHandler to a SyncConfiguration#### Actual ResultsI am receiving this exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Configurations cannot be different if used to open the same file#### Steps & Code to ReproduceJust creates a SyncConfiguration adding an ErrorHandler;#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 6.0.2Realm Sync feature enabled: YesAndroid Studio version: 3.5.1Android Build Tools version: 28.0.3Gradle version: 3.5.2Which Android version and device(s): 9

Issue.Description: #### GoalFix crash and use LinkedObjectsModel is defined like:``#### Steps & Code to Reproduceplease see: #### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 6.0.2Realm Sync feature enabled: NoAndroid Studio version: 3.6Android Build Tools version: 3.4.2Gradle version: 5.1.1Which Android version and device(s): any

Issue.Title: After updating from realm 6.0.0 to 6.0.1 or 6.0.2, or 6.1.0, application becomes much slower.
Issue.Description: For some reason after updating the realm version from 6.0.0 to 6.0.1 or 6.0.2 or 6.0.1, application becomes much slower.What's the reason?

Issue.Title: Can't compile project after targeting latest Android version and latest build tools
Issue.Description: Hi, after migrating my app to androidx i'm not able to compile the app, getting the following error:MyCelllRealmProxy.java:713: error: cannot find symbol @TargetApi(Build.VERSION_CODES.HONEYCOMB) ^ symbol: variable HONEYCOMB location: class VERSION_CODESThis is the generated file by Realm// Top-level build file where you can add configuration options common to all sub-projects/modules.``

Issue.Title: RealmMigration only called once despite having 2 schemas
Issue.Description: I have 2 different configuration files with different modules and I want to do migration on the 2 schemas. However, only one RealmMigration is called.I called the code below twice, for each different module``Am I doing something wrong here? Realm should call the migration twice right?src:

Issue.Title: Field 'id' cannot be set as primary key since there are duplicated values for field
Issue.Description: I have a Class,but does't has primary key, in old version;In new version, I add a field 'id' as primary key value;``but I dont have add Primary key,it point to itself.Who could give me some help.

Issue.Description: #### GoalPrevent my app from crashing#### Actual ResultsApp crashes --> Java_io_realm_internal_objectstore_OsObjectBuilder_nativeCreateOrUpdate#### Steps & Code to Reproduce``#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 6.0.2Realm Sync feature enabled: NoAndroid Studio version: 3.5Android Build Tools version: 3.5.3Gradle version: 5.6.4Which Android version and device(s): Google Pixel 3 (Android 9, 10)

Issue.Title: Unrecoverable error. Decryption failed Exception backtrace: () in /Users/cm/Realm/realm-java-release/realm/realm-library/src/main/cpp/io_realm_internal_OsSharedRealm.cpp line 144
Issue.Description: #### GoalNo Crash#### Actual ResultsAfter upgrade from 5.13.x to 6.0.0, App Crashed when launch due to Decryption failure.#### Errorio.realm.exceptions.RealmError: Unrecoverable error. Decryption failedException backtrace: () in /Users/cm/Realm/realm-java-release/realm/realm-library/src/main/cpp/io_realm_internal_OsSharedRealm.cpp line 144 at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.nativeCommitTransaction(Native Method) at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.commitTransaction(OsSharedRealm.java:273) at io.realm.BaseRealm.commitTransaction(BaseRealm.java:416) at io.realm.Realm.commitTransaction(Realm.java:145) at io.realm.Realm.executeTransaction(Realm.java:1494)#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 6.0.0Realm Sync feature enabled: No

Issue.Title: `IllegalStateException` thrown when deleting Realm, but no instances open.
Issue.Description: #### GoalDelete Realm (via `Realm#deleteRealm()`) when decryption fails.#### Actual Results> java.lang.IllegalStateException: It's not allowed to delete the file associated with an open Realm.Realm throws an `IllegalStateException` when attempting to delete. No Realm instances are opened in any other part of our application.Additionally, `Realm#getGlobalInstanceCount()` and `Realm#getLocalInstanceCount()` return `0` right before the `IllegalStateException` is thrown, verifying that no instances are actually open and contradicting the exception. Finally, note our call to `Realm#deleteRealm()` only occurs in a `catch` block invoked when _opening Realm fails_. Due to these reasons, we suspect this is a valid bug in Realm.#### Steps & Code to ReproduceFirst, the code in question:``Reproduced on a Samsung Galaxy S10+. The steps we are using to reproduce this are:1. Install an older version of application with a set `encryptionKey` and ensure Realm initializes.2. With the application running and in the foreground, update the application via `adb install -r <path to apk>`. The `-r` flag is important as it simulates an app update instead of a fresh install. This new version of the app should have the same Realm setup, but utilize a different `encryptionKey`.3. The system will close the application when the install completes. Immediately open the now updated app. With the above code in place, `Realm#deleteRealm` will throw an `IllegalStateException`, even though Realms `Realm#get*InstanceCount()` functions will return `0`.As of now, this does _not_ appear to be reproducible on anything but a physical Samsung device. This issue is causing a considerable number of crashes for affected users, and is considered critical.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm: `io.realm:realm-gradle-plugin:6.0.1`Realm Extensions: `com.github.vicpinm:krealmextensions:2.5.0` (should be irrelevant, but including just in case)Android Studio version: 3.5.3Which Android version and device(s): Samsung Galaxy S10+ running Android 10

Issue.Title: Specific callback for ClientReset
Issue.Description: While ClientResync can be handled automatically by Realm now, it is still possible to enable an automatic mode where the user has to handle it automatically. In that case, it results in the user having to write a bunch of annoying code.We should consider exposing a specific callback explicitly for that, which will also make it much easier to expose the correct information and types to users.```// Current APISyncConfiguration config = user.createConfiguration(url) .errorHandler((session, error) -> { if (error.getErrorCode() == ErrorCode.CLIENT_RESET) { ClientResetRequiredError clientResetRequiredError = (ClientResetRequiredError) error; // Handle client reset } else { // Handle other errors } .build()// Suggest APISyncConfiguration config = user.createConfiguration(url) .clientResyncMode(ClientResyncMode.MANUAL) .errorHandler((session, error) -> { // Handle other errors }) .clientResyncHandler((session, error) -> { // Setting this will fail unless the mode is MANUAL // error is already of type ClientResetRequeriedError }) .build()

Issue.Title: Including asset file in Realm configuration assumes asset file will use default realm file name
Issue.Code:
RealmConfiguration.Builder() .assetFile("asset-file-name.realm") .... .build()
#### Actual Results This doesn't work unless the assets Realm file name matches the name in the Realm configuration.
`RealmCache.copyAssetFileIfNeeded` seems to assume that the asset file path from the configuration will match the realm file name. When a realm file name isn't provided to the configuration, the default name is used (`default.realm`), and the asset file copy doesn't work properly because the names don't match. This causes a misleading error message to be thrown:
RealmFileException: Could not resolve the path to the asset file: asset-file-name.realm Kind: ACCESS_ERROR .... Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: asset-file-name.realm
When in reality, the file _is_ present in the assets folder, Realm is just expecting it to have a different name.
This is fixed by providing a custom name to the configuration builder that matches the asset file name:
RealmConfiguration.Builder() .assetFile("asset-file-name.realm") .name("asset-file-name.realm") .... .build()
Additionally, this behavior doesn't seem to be in the docs around the section that details the `assetFile` builder option, so the behavior is a bit misleading/confusing
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce - Add a realm file in the assets folder with a non-default name - Call `Realm.init(applicationContext)` - Create a custom `RealmConfiguration`: - RealmConfiguration.Builder() .schemaVersion(mySchemaVersion) .assetFile({custom name here}) .build() `
Issue.Description: #### GoalI want to provide a Realm file from my assets folder via:``- Set that configuration as the default: - `Realm.setDefaultConfiguration(realmConfiguration)`- Fetch a Realm instance via `Realm.getDefaultInstance` -> see error#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 5.3.0Realm Sync feature enabled: NoAndroid Studio version: 3.5.2Android Build Tools version: Whatever is automatically set by Android StudioGradle version: 5.4.1Which Android version and device(s): Latest Android 10 Pixel 3 emulator

Issue.Title: Handling realm in multiple thread
Issue.Description: In our project for several operations, we create different threads and do realm transaction in each one of them. But in the mean time we got several crash reports regarding the "out of memory" problem. we believe that the source of problem is having multiple instances of realm in each of the threads and the queue for transactions.Do you have any recommendation for solving this problem?

Issue.Title: Potential memory leak: Passing Realm instance as a parameter in RealmRecyclerViewAdapter
Issue.Description: Hi, lately I have been experiencing some app performance issue and am wondering if there is there any correlation in passing realm instance into a realm recyclerview adapter which will may impact app performance? My adapter constructor looks like this: private Realm realm; private Context context; public MyAdapter(Context context, Realm realm) { super(articles, true); this.context = context; this.realm = realm; }and my Adapter class extends `RealmRecyclerViewAdapter`. Assuming I'm passing in an open instance of realm into this adapter, will it cause a memory leak? Assuming of course, within this adapter itself, some realm operation/queries are in operation. Curious. Thanks in advance for any advice!

Issue.Title: Help diagnose slow transaction commit
Issue.Description: Please advise on how I could debug an apparently slow commit. I'm looking at a 500-1000ms delay between the finishing of my 25ms transaction using `realm.executeTransactionAsync` and the execution of the `OnSuccess` callback.There isn't a lot of data in the commit, just 2 objects, but we're talking about objects with 50+ fields and other linked objects of similar complexity, but no large lists or anything like that, as far as I can judge. As I can't easily provide a minimal example, I am asking for advice on how I could pinpoint the source of the delay. As I feel that question would not be suitable for StackOverflow, I hope it is acceptable to submit this here. What I have tried now is finding whether this delay is caused by ChangeListeners that are triggered before the OnSuccess callback. I placed a breakpoint in `RealmNotifier.didChange`, there no callbacks other than the `OnSuccess` callback is executed, didChange itself is executed after the delay already. I also tried `OsResults.notifyChangeListeners` and only found change listeners firing after the OnSuccess callback. At this point I tend to think there might be something about the few linked objects that cause this commit to be slow, rather than change listeners blocking. Is there anything that comes to mind that could help me find out whether some change listeners, other transactions or something like that is causing the delay or the actual insert being slow despite the transaction block executing quickly?

Issue.Title: slower build in intranet
Issue.Description: #### Describe your problem or use casetask app:transformClassesWithRealmTransformerForDebug will add 6 sec build time in intranet environmentby analytic the network traffic found out it wait for dns query api.mixpanel.com until timeout. (due to unable connect on internet)#### Describe the solution you'd likeafter add api.mixpanel.com to hosts the execute time of task app:transformClassesWithRealmTransformerForDebug will less than 1000ms.solution:how to disable realm analytics in my project?or not try to access internet while gradle offline flag is on.#### Additional contextI already set --offline flag on in gradlerealm-java:6.0.0 and 6.0.2

PullRequest.Title: Better support for Gradle offline mode
PullRequest.Description:
Closes #6691
This PR disables anonymous analytics when Gradle is invoked with the `--offline` parameter. This will speed the build up by 6 seconds, since we are currently waiting for the network layer to throw a timeout exception (timeouts configured by us in `RealmAnalytics.java`).
Tested manually.

Issue.Title: Obfuscation causes crashes on REALM
Issue.Code: java.lang.AbstractMethodError: abstract method "java.util.Map io.realm.internal.RealmProxyMediator.getExpectedObjectSchemaInfoMap()" at io.realm.Realm.createExpectedSchemaInfo(Realm.java:192) at io.realm.Realm.<init>(Realm.java:163) at io.realm.Realm.createInstance(Realm.java:499) at io.realm.RealmCache.doCreateRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:355) at io.realm.RealmCache.createRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:285) at io.realm.Realm.getInstance(Realm.java:428) at com.gemalto.mbi.common.internal.realm.c.open(MbiRealmPersistingFacility.java:149) at util.n.ad.open(MbiPersisterImpl.java:91) at util.n.X.b(MbiBioOperationManagerImpl.java:738) at util.n.X.load(MbiBioOperationManagerImpl.java:728) at controller.init.ControllerContextImpl.load(ControllerContextImpl.java:400) at controller.di.manager.operations.command.RefreshOperations.execute(RefreshOperations.java:45) at controller.di.manager.common.AbstractCommand.run(AbstractCommand.java:59) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1167) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:641) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:764) `
Issue.Description: #### GoalDeliver AAR which internally uses RELM. Hide the realm usage evidences by obfuscation as much as possible.#### Actual ResultsThe final app using the AAR (which in turns embeds REALM) is crashing if the AAR is obfuscated and repackaged (we are using DexGuard, as ProGuard is not considered secure enough in our case).If I just disable the obfuscation using `-dontobfuscate` then things start working like a charm...This is the exception I have:``Note: We do not obfuscate code yet, only class/method/field names.#### Steps & Code to Reproduce- Generate AAR which embeds REALM and enable obfuscation- Use the AAR in the target App- App crashes (see the stack trace above)I tried to add a rule to keep the class from the stack trace `-keep class io.realm.internal.RealmProxyMediator { *; }`. Unfortunately it did not help, things are not so easy...#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 6.0.1Realm Sync feature enabled: NoAndroid Studio version: 3.5.2Android Build Tools version: Implied by the latest Gradle pluginGradle version: Latest implied by the Android Gradle pluginWhich Android version and device(s): Many different (the issue seems to be independent)

Issue.Title: Realm in fat AAR
Issue.Description: #### GoalHave an AAR which embeds realm (also known as a FAT AAR, everything is inside, no external dependencies at all).Additionally, and this is crucial, the final AAR obfuscation with the DexGuard (enhanced obfuscation, not just a ProGuard/R8 minification) is a must. Ideally, by the reverse engineering, it is NOT possible to easily identify there even is any REALM inside (but I doubt so).To make things even more complicated, the final "fat" AAR is actually put together from multiple (many) other AARs, only one of them contains REALM (I came to the bigger project which already runs for long time and my task is to change the internal persisting facility from files to REALM).#### Actual ResultsCrash:java.lang.ClassCastException: com.gemalto.mbi.common.internal.realm.A cannot be cast to io.realm.com_gemalto_mbi_common_internal_realm_ARealmProxyInterface at io.realm.com_gemalto_mbi_common_internal_realm_ARealmProxy.insert(com_gemalto_mbi_common_internal_realm_ARealmProxy.java:337) at io.realm.MbiRealmModuleMediator.insert(MbiRealmModuleMediator.java:117) at io.realm.Realm.insert(Realm.java:1195) at com.gemalto.mbi.common.internal.realm.MbiRealmPersistingFacility.writeBytes(MbiRealmPersistingFacility.java:227) at com.gemalto.mbi.common.internal.MbiPersisterImpl.writeString(MbiPersisterImpl.java:240) at com.gemalto.mbi.finland.di.ObjectFactory.lambda$getControllerComponent$0(ObjectFactory.java:107) at com.gemalto.mbi.finland.di.-$$Lambda$ObjectFactory$KfoXk-Ysdy-dcwVrfJEeEs3az1k.run(Unknown Source:0) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:764)#### Steps & Code to ReproduceThere is this code generated by Realm tooling:``Particularly, there is this cast`((com_gemalto_mbi_common_internal_realm_ARealmProxyInterface) object)`I studied the code: This cast is INVALID.I do not understand how come that this cast works when I build the standalone APP based on REALM???I do understand that the cast does NOT work (crash above) when I repackage the REALM into the fat AAR - as described above).There must be some trickery behind, which I am missing...How exactly does REALM build work?Why there are NO dependencies (only gradle plugin doing some magic behind scenes)?I tried to find some documentation on this but nothing (an tried to understand it from code but that is long run)...And, I have not even started with the obfuscation - I am a bit afraid that it will introduce a lot of issues - exactly thanks to the magic behind scenes instead of the straightforward dependency system...#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 6.0.1Realm Sync feature enabled: NoAndroid Studio version: 3.5.3Android Build Tools version: LatestGradle version: LatestWhich Android version and device(s): Android 9, Samsung A60 (and others), but that does NOT matter

Issue.Title: io.realm.exceptions.RealmMigrationNeededException Migration is required due to the following errors: - Class 'RemotePubServie' has been added.
Issue.Description: io.realm.exceptions.RealmMigrationNeededException:Migration is required due to the following errors: - Class 'RemotePubServie' has been added. RealmConfiguration config = new RealmConfiguration.Builder() .name(userEntry.getMId() + ".realm")// .schemaVersion(1) .schemaVersion(2).migration(new CustomMigration()) .build(); Realm.setDefaultConfiguration(config);public class CustomMigration implements RealmMigration { @Override public void migrate(DynamicRealm realm, long oldVersion, long newVersion) { RealmSchema schema = realm.getSchema(); if (oldVersion == 1 && newVersion == 2) { if (!schema.contains("RemotePubServie")) { RealmObjectSchema remotePubService = schema.create("RemotePubServie"); remotePubService.addField("messageId", int.class,FieldAttribute.PRIMARY_KEY); remotePubService.addField("uid", String.class); remotePubService.addField("msg_schedule_type", String.class); remotePubService.addField("msg_schedule", String.class); remotePubService.addField("service_no_id",String.class); remotePubService.addField("service_no_name",String.class); remotePubService.addField("extra", String.class); } //++Realm oldVersion++; } } @Override public boolean equals(Object other) { if (other == null) { return false; } return getClass() == other.getClass(); } @Override public int hashCode() { return getClass().hashCode(); }} nickname = TextUtils.isEmpty(nickname) ? ChatRealmUtil.getUserName(targetId, Realm.getDefaultInstance()) : nickname;

Issue.Title: Enhance io.realm:android-adapters to use or be compatible with AndroidX
Issue.Description: This is an enhancement request.We use RealmRecyclerViewAdapter from io.realm:android-adapters:2.1.1It is a great resource, but is now one of the things preventing us from upgrading to AndroidX. Would it be possible to provide a newer version of io.realm:android-adapters that uses or is compatible with AndroidX? refers to the android.support.v7 namespace.The RealmRecyclerViewAdapter class extends `android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<S>`, and it's S type extends `android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder`. The AndroidX migration guide at seems to indicate that `android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView` could be replaced by `androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView`In either case, thanks for providing the RealmRecyclerViewAdapter class. It has been a great tool.

Issue.Title: Bump min API and remove mips in preparation for NDK21 support
Issue.Description: Set min API = 16Remove Mips support.

Issue.Title: Create first beta version of core6 release
How to use two realm DB files from assets folder inside the app?
Issue.Description: I have two realm DB files inside assets file. These files were working fine inside the Device File Explorer, however I can not access any data from the files, it returns null.Note: I deleted the files from the Device File ExplorerBelow is my code to access the files from assets folder.``Based on the documentations, I guess this is the right way to access these files from assets folder. I am sure they are not empty files, they have data. My question is how to fetch data from them. Also, when I executed the command for creating configursation for the first file, I noticed it created a file in Device Explorer with the name `default.realm` and it could access the data from this file but not from the second one. So, my questions, why is it creating a `default.realm` file having the same size as the first file? And if that will always happen when the app is being run on the Android phone then will not it take twice the storage space and also how to set the `schema_version` automatically? Please help. Thank you!

Issue.Title: Better error message when loading native code
Issue.Description: With App Bundle and APK splits, it has become more common that people are sideloading the wrong APK for their device which results in a mismatch of the native code. Right now this results in a rather unfriendly error message like here: `MissingLibraryException librealm-jni.so` If this happens we should try to detect which architecture the device is running and which binaries are available in the APK so we can provide the developer with better diagnostics (and reduce our support load on the matter).

Issue.Title: Java Build with Core does NOT work
Issue.Code:
CMake Error: CMake was unable to find a build program corresponding to "Ninja". CMAKE_MAKE_PROGRAM is not set. You probably need to select a different build tool.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
I followed the guide here: https://github.com/realm/realm-java
If I execute this (after all the required setup, for/on MacOS):
./gradlew assemble
then my build succeeds (after 43 minutes of running ).
But it downloads the pre-built core archives. Which is not trusted. Plus, as I wrote above, the Realm Core contains vulnerabilities, which I have to fix.
I was also able to build the Realm-Core separately (I have the TAR file).
Therefore I need to do the full build by executing this:
./gradlew assembleBase -PcoreSourcePath=../../../realm-core
then my build fails with this error:
CMake Error: CMake was unable to find a build program corresponding to "Ninja". CMAKE_MAKE_PROGRAM is not set. You probably need to select a different build tool.
I also tried this (no success):
./gradlew assembleBase -PcoreSourcePath=../../../realm-core -PbuildTargetABIs=armeabi-v7a
I was digging around and inside a lot and found that the
realm-java/realm/realm-library/build.gradle
references this cmake file:
src/main/cpp/android.toolchain.cmake
And that file contains this:

Issue.Title: Add tests to detect concurrency issues
Issue.Description: We need some additional tests that can validate or detect concurrency issues. This task needs more detailing but below are some initial thoughts.Initially, we can start using the random tests that detected the recent encryption bug. That could either just be extended or below ideas could be explored.AFL cannot run on Android (instrumenting Java code, it can run for binaries though), and the current Javascript Fuzz tester does not correspond to the type of tests we want to exercise.An initial idea could be to use the new frozen API developed as a new feature shipping with Core6 to develop a state machine that could orchestrate various (valid) API calls involving Threads. This could be for example:* Start a background Looper Thread & do some update/queries* Start a non-Looper Thread to create & handover objects (frozen)* Start a process to open the same Realm but in encryption and/or in-memory modeThe idea of a state machine is to be able to run this program for days to observe the variation of the size of the Realm as well as testing the robustness of the API. We should also use an input Fuzzer which generates random UTF16 (strings/emoji?) as historically the String validation in Java unravelled some corruption state in Core.Debugging concurrency/race condition issues are difficult, we need to log all states: operations, context (Threads) to be able to reproduce any issue encountered easily

Issue.Title: Access related object by its ID
Issue.Description: #### Describe your problem or use caseI'm looking for a way to access related objects (`Bar`) directly from `Foo` by their ID (primary key). Basically just like I can access relations via the included Many-to-one / Many-to-many functionality but via an ID.This would help persisting fetched data from a server which does not embed relations as whole objects but a list of the IDs of related objects.Currently, we need a workaround by adding an additional field to `Foo` which queries related `Bars` in its getter.``#### Describe the solution you'd likeIt would be great if realm includes this workaround directly. Maybe via an annotation (`@ObjectsById`) which would map `Foo.bars` (the list of IDs) to an list of actual `Bar`-objects? Something magically like `@LinkingObjects` which adds the relation without the need of an migration etc..#### Additional contextSee

I want to use both of these in my Android App. I faced some Migration error, so what I understood was that I have to merge these two schemas into one i.e., one of the classes have to be extended into either of the files and then this new file alone will provide the DB. kotlin schema.get("Foo")?.apply { addField("aaa", String::class.java)
transform { dro -> dro.linkingObjects("Bar", "foo") ?.firstOrNull() ?.apply { dro.setString("aaa", getString("bbb")) } ?: dro.deleteFromRealm() } }

and

Issue.Description: #### GoalRun transformation in a migration for all elements. If a linking object (`Bar`) is found, I want to set a the string from `Bar.bbb` on the `DynamicRealmObject` (`Foo.aaa`) and if not, I want to remove the `Foo`-object.``#### Steps & Code to ReproduceThis seems to happen everytime the user opens the app (and a migration is needed). As said, I cannot reproduce it myself because it's working on my devices.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 6.0.0Realm Sync feature enabled: NoAndroid Studio version: 3.6 Beta 3Android Build Tools version: 29.0.2Gradle version: 5.6.4Which Android version and device(s): 8.0.0 (Galaxy S7) crashes on the user; I've tested an S7 with 8.0.0 as well which worked. Also tested Android 10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 5 - all working.

Issue.Title: signal 11 (SIGSEGV), code 1 (SEGV_MAPERR) when opening Realm
Issue.Code:
RealmConfiguration.Builder() .schemaVersion(3) .encryptionKey(XXX) .deleteRealmIfMigrationNeeded() .build()
We open Realm instance from configuration to perform transaction and immediately close it after, for observable queries we use RX and open Realm instance `onSubscribe` and closing it when subscription disposed.
Some of the issue discussions were suggesting that there strangely might be several application processes running at the same time. Added check for that and haven't detected any.
Human readable stack trace:
Java_io_realm_internal_OsSharedRealm_nativeGetSharedRealm+480 io.realm.internal.OsObjectSchemaInfo.nativeGetProperty [DEDUPED]+180 io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.<init>+98 io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.getInstance+18 io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.getInstance+10 io.realm.RealmCache.doCreateRealmOrGetFromCache+114 io.realm.RealmCache.createRealmOrGetFromCache+18 io.realm.Realm.getInstance+8 com.stab.extensions.realm.RealmConfigurationExtKt.executeTransaction+28

Issue.Description: In Google Play console I can see a lot of crashes in native code when application creates Realm instance. Issue affects different Android versions and different devices. Once appears on a device, happens many times (persists). Wasn't able to reproduce it locally.We use Realm Gradle plugin 5.15.1Configuration:``

Issue.Title: RealmConfiguration error
Issue.Description: - - here i am making a realm object and configuring it- //this method simply add my data to realm- private void addAction() {- - String what = mInputWhat.getText().toString(); // to get input from user- long now = System.currentTimeMillis(); // to get current date- - - RealmConfiguration configuration = new RealmConfiguration.Builder().build();- Realm.setDefaultConfiguration(configuration);- - Realm realm = Realm.getDefaultInstance();- - Drop drop = new Drop(what, now, 0, false);- - realm.beginTransaction();- realm.copyFromRealm(drop);- realm.commitTransaction();- realm.close();- - - }- - The error is: "Call `Realm.init(Context)` before creating a RealmConfiguration"- - Actually I am making todo list app . In this app i am using Realm database for storing goal and date from the user.- When i am using Realm.init() method and passing getActivity() as a context then my "Add it" button doesn't work- When I am not using this method then my app is getting crashed.- What should i do now??- -

Issue.Title: findAllAsync().addChangeListener within a change listener
Issue.Description:
#### Goal Subscribe to queries in a serially chained manner.
#### Actual Results The block for `findAllAsync().addChangeListener` is never called.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce The first listener: `` When `updateRecordsObservation()` is called on the next cycle by making an async call, the listener works fine.
#### Version of Realm and tooling
Realm version(s): 5.14.0
Realm Sync feature enabled: No
Android Studio version: 3.5.1
Android Build Tools version: 29.0.2
Gradle version: 3.5.1
Which Android version and device(s): Tested on Lollipop real device and API 28 Nexus 5 emulator.

Issue.Title: realm get instance as thread
Reproducible mmap() failed (size: 0, offset is 0) crash
Issue.Description:
#### Goal While attempting some experiments on realm I found the following (undefined?) behavior which perhaps can be classified as a bug. I'm not sure...maybe it makes sense? If it does just close the issue of course.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce Anywhere in my code if I call:
`` It results in `mmap() failed (size: 0, offset is 0)` directly after I attempt to perform an insert transaction on realm objects.
On an perhaps unrelated note, if I deliberately corrupt the realm file (for example overriding the first bytes using `fileOutputStream.write(42)` this code can also cause java `OutOfMemory` crashes (but also a more expected decryption failed error).
I have not attempted to reproduce this in the example project yet but it's easily reproducible in our own code.
#### Version of Realm and tooling
Encryption enabled: Yes
Realm version(s): 5.14.0
Realm Sync feature enabled: No
Android Studio version: 3.5
Which Android version and device(s): Any device including emulators

Issue.Title: Database corrupted after update on some devices.
Issue.Description: #### GoalRealm must work well after app update.#### Actual ResultsOn some devices the database is corrupted and user can't use it after an update of the app. Must delete the folder where the database is stored to recreate the database and the app return to work well , but the users missing their data. #### Steps & Code to ReproduceUser update the app#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 5.0.0Realm Sync feature enabled: NoAndroid Studio version: 3.5Android Build Tools version: 28.0.3Gradle version: 4.9Which Android version and device(s): different os version and devices , high percentage huawei.Hi , after a normal update where the db layer has not been modified, the app it's not work properly due to realm error in the database layer. Is it a bug in realm? For us it's a very bad problem , for now happens on a few number of users, but this users are very unhappy because they lost data of the app. Do you know if i will update the realm to last version this will be fixed?

Issue.Title: Android updated realm-gradle-plugin from 5.12 to 5.15 throws exception
Issue.Description:
#### Goal I updated realm from 5.12 to 5.15 and without any changes on the models I got this exception when updating the app, but if I install as a fresh apk it will work.
java.lang.IllegalStateException: The following changes cannot be made in additive-only schema mode: - Property '__ResultSets.created_at' has been made required. - Property '__ResultSets.updated_at' has been made required. at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.nativeGetSharedRealm(Native Method) at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.<init>(OsSharedRealm.java:171) at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.getInstance(OsSharedRealm.java:241)
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce Calling like this: Realm.setDefaultConfiguration(SyncConfiguration.automatic()) mRealm = Realm.getDefaultInstance()
#### Version of Realm and tooling
Realm version(s): 5.12 <-> 5.15.1
Realm Sync feature enabled: Yes
Android Studio version: 3.5
Android Build Tools version: 29
Gradle version: 3.5.0
Which Android version and device(s): All versions

Issue.Title: distinct ignore null field
Issue.Description:
#### Describe your problem or use case my field(let's call it "displayName") is Nullable. Now I just want to distinct not null displayNames, and left the nulls. But realm does not support this.
#### Describe the solution you'd like <!-- A clear and concise description of how you think a solution could look like. -->
#### Additional context <!-- Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. -->

Issue.Title: DynamicRealmObject.setList documentation is misleading
Issue.Description:
#### Goal Setting a list-field of a DynamicRealmObject by reference and adding values to that list afterwards should result in the DynamicRealmObject's list to contain the added value.
#### Actual Results The list is not set by reference, although the documention implies so. It only copies the values of the list.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce `` The handle is created in the DB, the token is also created in the DB, but the token is not included in the handle's token-list. According to the documention, I would expect that it is included.
#### Version of Realm and tooling
Realm version(s): 5.13.1

Issue.Title: RealmList Contains
Issue.Description:
We only use Github issues for bugs or new feature ideas. Please use one of the following options instead:
* [Stack Overflow]( is good to get specific help about how to do use Realm.
* [Realm Forums]( is great for general Realm questions that are now allowed on StackOverflow like best practices etc.
* [Realm Support]( can be used if you are a paying Realm Cloud user or have a support contract with Realm. If you would like a support contract you can contact [Sales](sales@realm.io).

Issue.Title: Update Encryption Docs
Issue.Description:
#### Describe your problem or use case The encryption docs only states that AES-256 is used and a 512-bit key is required. This is confusing to some of us not too familiar with encryption. It looks like a 512-bit key is required because 256-bits are used by AES and the rest by HMAC.
#### Describe the solution you'd like This [solution]( was beneficial to figuring out how Realm actually uses the key. It would be nice for the encryption docs to be a little more clear on how Realm handles encryption for the different projects that require more info on security and encryption.
From contributor: `We use AES-256 which takes a 256 bit key, not bytes ... Since a byte is 8 bit, we thus take a 512 (64x8) bit key. The first 256 bits used used by AES, the last 256 bits by the HMAC.`
#### Additional context [Source]( `The Realm file can be encrypted on disk by passing a 512-bit encryption key (64 bytes) ` `Realm transparently encrypts and decrypts data with standard AES-256 encryption`

Issue.Title: Don't enforce jCenter repository
Issue.Description:
#### Describe your problem or use case
My project is building on a Jenkins instance, which does not have access to the external network. All our dependencies are downloaded through our local repository:
``
In [Realm.groovy#L75]( I can see that you are explicitly adding the `jCenter` repository. This causes my build to take way longer than necessary, because Gradle is trying to connect to an unreachable repository for each of the declared dependency.
#### Describe the solution you'd like
Don't enforce the `jCenter` repository if it is not necessary.
#### Additional context
In @lacasseio provided some tips on how this issue could be addressed: only adding `jCenter` if no other repositories are defined.

PullRequest.Title: Add support for Weak/Strong links aka. Cascading Deletes
PullRequest.Description:
Closes #1104
This PR adds support for the Core concepts of Weak/Strong links or effectively Cascading deletes.
The semantics are: - Default relationship are "weak" - If A has a strong relationship with B, then B is automatically deleted if A removes it's reference or is deleted itself. - Multiple A's can hold a strong reference to B. B is only deleted when the final A is.
In particular, this solves the most common cascading delete problems we have seen:
- Nested hierarchies of objects where parents own their children. - Updating list problem: I.e. how to delete objects no longer part of a list after the list has been modified due to a network request.
The public API is a new annotation:
`` Should we add a `@WeakRelationship`? Nice for symmetry ala `@Nullable/@NonNull` but our own API does not have the precedence.
TODO: - [ ] Flesh out annotation processor unit tests - [ ] Add DynamicRealm API + tests - [ ] Add Migration API + tests - [ ] Merge Sync upgrade from `master`

Issue.Title: Realm isn't set value to the fields of the objects on reflection
Issue.Description:
I'm trying to implement an abstraction to realm so that I could save some time when using the CURD operation on the db.
the abstraction that I build is controller to the database operation so that I could use this controller which do the CURD operation with any table.
i.e. the controller I'm talking about is just a Java class has four methods create update read delete.
this is the create which using reflection to create the db objects and bind the fields of the passed data object to that db object
``
the problem is as follow:
when I'm trying to query the database to get the object after the finish of the process the database return the objects that I create using this function but those objects has no data actually the returned data is set to default value to each type i.e. string to null boolean to false etc...
my question is:
is there any problem in my code or the realm database doesn't support setting values to the objects on reflection?

Issue.Title: Why my custom Noticataton objects are increment?
Issue.Description:
Android application. Use Reaml
Here my `Merchant `pojo: ``
As result `Merchant `object was success updated. Nice. But in Realm the `Notification `objects are increment. E.g. If I has **9** `Merchant `then `Notifications `objects are **27** objects - it's correct. But after method `updateNotification` the count of `Notification `objects are **30**. But it must be **27**.

Issue.Title: **Bug** In release with Realm
Issue.Description:
I am building a library and I am using Realm as the database. After Realm version 5.3.0 (i.e. 5.5.0) I cannot build a release version of my library and I receive the error:
FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.
* What went wrong: Execution failed for task ':osevensdk:transformClassesWithRealmTransformerForRelease'. > com.android.build.gradle.BaseExtension.getDefaultConfig()Lcom/android/build/gradle/internal/dsl/DefaultConfig;
* Try: Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
BUILD FAILED
Total time: 16.135 secs Cause: com.android.build.gradle.BaseExtension.getDefaultConfig()Lcom/android/build/gradle/internal/dsl/DefaultConfig; 1:16:53 PM: Task execution finished 'uploadArchives'.
When I use Realm 5.3.0 everything works fine. Also obfuscation is enabled.
Please tell me a possible solution, because I cannot upgrade the Realm version.
Thanks in advance!

Issue.Title: isNull not working on annotated linked objects
Issue.Description:
<!---
**Questions**: If you have questions about how to use Realm, ask on [StackOverflow]( We monitor the `realm` tag.
**Feature Request**: Just fill in the first two sections below.
**Bugs**: To help you as fast as possible with an issue please describe your issue and the steps you have taken to reproduce it in as many details as possible.
-->
#### Goal
Make query with a backlinked object (annotated with `@LinkingObjects`)
#### Expected Results
> Query should work
#### Actual Results
Crash with the following exception: > java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal Argument: LinkingObject from field dog is not nullable. at io.realm.internal.TableQuery.nativeIsNull(Native Method)
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
Make a query to a linked object: `RealmQuery<Dog> query = realm.where(Dog.class).isNull("linkedPerson");`
Tried on 3.5.0 and 5.5.0, check [detailed comment](
The same works with a forward linking object (non-annotated) linking object, but crashes for backlinked object (one with annotation in the model and object type `RealmResults`).
Similar issue was pointed out in #4996 but was marked closed with a link to #4856, but #4856 was for forward link (direct nested link) which was fixed in 3.5.0 but not #4996.
#### Code Sample
Model: ``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 3.5.0 and 5.5.0
Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 3.1.3
Which Android version and device: Nexus 6P, stock, 8.1.0, ARMv8x64

Issue.Title: Android outOfMemoryException
Issue.Description: Hello everyone. I have a problem with inserting a lot of objects into realm file. I have default realm file with >70k objects (450 mb - size of file). When I download new realm file via firebase, I must copy 140k objects (150 mb - size of new file), I catch OutOfMemoryException. I tried all methods - copyToRealm, insert. And this error catches only for devices with heap size < 128 mb

Issue.Title: @RealmClass, @RealmField value name
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
I would like to be able to write `@RealmClass("name_of_the_class")` or `@RealmField("name_of_field")` instead of `@RealmClass(name="name_of_the_class")` or `@RealmField(name="name_of_field")` which is unnecesarilly verbose I think.
#### Expected Results
The annotations classes should use `value()` for specifying name of the class/field. The same concept use e.g. libraries parsing from JSON (e.g. GSON's `@SerializedName`)
#### Actual Results
Annotation classes use method `name()` and therefore it must be specified when using the annotations.
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version: 5.5.0
Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 3.1.4

Issue.Title: Maximum number of fields for a realm model?
Issue.Description:
Is there a maximum number of fields allowed in a Real model?
I have a model with around 250 fields (most are Ints and some Strings) and the app crashes. If I comment out some of the fields, everything is OK. This is an Android app.
`java.lang.VerifyError: some/package/MemberQuestionsRealm at io.realm.DefaultRealmModuleMediator.getExpectedObjectSchemaInfoMap(DefaultRealmModuleMediator.java:48) at io.realm.Realm.createExpectedSchemaInfo(Realm.java:193) at io.realm.Realm.<init>(Realm.java:164) at io.realm.Realm.createInstance(Realm.java:449) at io.realm.RealmCache.doCreateRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:342) at io.realm.RealmCache.createRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:282) at io.realm.Realm.getDefaultInstance(Realm.java:357) `

Issue.Title: Unable to open a realm at path '/data/data/com.android.android/files/e_android.realm.lock': open() failed: Too many open files
AuthTests are broken when running all integration tests
Issue.Description:
Some of the tests in AuthTests are not working correctly, but only when running the full integration test suite. Running just the class makes all test parse. This indicates a failure in the setup somewhere.
Due to #6137 it is currently hard to debug. The class is currently` @Ignore`d. We need to fix them.

Issue.Title: Logs from integration test server is broken
Issue.Description:
Logs from ROS is no longer correctly piped back to the parent process, which makes debugging test failures a lot harder. We need to fix that.
Current output: ``
The logs should have been outputted with the `ros` prefix.

Issue.Title: Core6: Changing nullability invalidate lists
Issue.Description:
Use case: ``
I suspect the problem is that changing nullability actually creates a new column, which break any existing objects that point to the old one. It is unclear why this is happening or if we can do much about this, expect throwing a nicer warning.
Maybe the issue is that we cache the old list instead of looking it up on each API call. Looking up the list on each access seems a bit expensive though. I wonder if we can just catch this error and try to lookup the list again if it happens.

Issue.Title: Determine how to handle file format upgrades in Core
Issue.Description: Core 6 only support file upgrades from the file format introduced in Realm Java 2.0.We have a few tests checking bugs in the primary key definitions before that as well as a number of other tests that just happen to use pre 2.0 files.Ref: - [ ] Figure out what to do with tests covering bugs in Primary Key support pre Realm Java 2.0- [ ] Figure out what to do with tests covering the added support for Nullability in Realm Java 0.83.- [ ] Upgrade other asset files to 2.0 so they are compatible.- [x] All tests being ignored because of this have a reference to this issue.

Issue.Title: Realm returning data only when every-time project is cleaned prior to build manually?
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
> What do you want to achieve?
#### Realm should return data if data persists in realm db.
> Data is present in the db but realm is not returning data every-time. Sometimes it returns and sometimes it doesn't. I have to clean the project every-time before build or running project on device. If I make any changes in the java which contains realm code then I have to clean the project in order to make realm return data. If I make changes and don't clean the project and run the project on device then no realm returns null data from db even if data persist in db.
#### Actual Results
> Realm is not returning data every-time even if data persists in db. My production build is not working. Because of which users are frustrated and negative impact on the product. It's been like hell in getting it resolved.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
> Clean and then build the project.
#### Any realm code to retrieve data from db will help in debugging.
#### Project level build.gradle ``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): ? 5.3.0

Issue.Title: Method with invalid locals information from RealmTransformer for Non-Realm Class
Issue.Description:
The past month or so (which may have correlated with us starting to use D8), I've been noticing this log entry every time I built my app (package name changed):
> AGPBI: {"kind":"warning","text":"Methods with invalid locals information:\n com.myapp.RenderOutput com.myapp.ClusterIconGenerator.render(com.myapp.AnimationState, com.myapp.RenderOutput)\n Attempt to define local of type float as $i$f$using","sources":[{"file":"<path to my app>/app/build/intermediates/transforms/RealmTransformer/debug/0/com/myapp/ClusterIconGenerator.class"}],"tool":"D8"}
This happens in the `:app:transformClassesWithRealmTransformerForDebug` task.
This is the references `render` method. Neither the method, nor the class it's in, reference anything to do with Realm.
``

Issue.Title: Feature Request: RealmQuery.getRealm()

This should be possible
#### Actual Results
`fun <T: RealmModel> RealmQuery<T>.findAllCopied(realm: Realm, depth: Int = 4) = realm.copyFromRealm(this, depth)`
which results in
realm.where<Dog>().findAllCopied(realm)
Instead of
realm.where<Dog>().findAllCopied()

Issue.Title: Unable to open a realm at path
Issue.Description:
Hi! Fabric is reporting a crash on one of our apps which is affecting a pretty high number of users and I have not been able to reproduce it or find a fix online. Has one got any tips on how I could go about fixing this issuse?
I have disabled automatic backup on the realm files but that didn't happen to fix things.
#### Actual Results
`Fatal Exception: io.realm.exceptions.RealmFileException: Unable to open a realm at path '/data/data/com.pitchero.ph/files/default.realm': Incompatible histories. Expected a Realm with no or in-realm history. (Incompatible histories. Expected a Realm with no or in-realm history) (/data/data/com.pitchero.ph/files/default.realm) in /Users/Nabil/Dev/realm/master/realm-java/realm/realm-library/src/main/cpp/io_realm_internal_OsSharedRealm.cpp line 101 at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.nativeGetSharedRealm(OsSharedRealm.java) at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.<init>(OsSharedRealm.java:171) at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.getInstance(OsSharedRealm.java:241) at io.realm.internal.OsSharedRealm.getInstance(OsSharedRealm.java:231) at io.realm.RealmCache.doCreateRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:319) at io.realm.RealmCache.createRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:282) at io.realm.Realm.getDefaultInstance(Realm.java:343) at com.pitchero.ph.utils.AppUtils.logout(AppUtils.java:29) at com.pitchero.ph.MainActivity$4.run(MainActivity.java:365) at android.app.Activity.runOnUiThread(Activity.java:5907) at com.pitchero.ph.MainActivity.goBackToIntroActivity(MainActivity.java:362) at com.pitchero.ph.MainActivity.access$300(MainActivity.java:73) at com.pitchero.ph.MainActivity$1.run(MainActivity.java:242) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:751) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:241) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6274) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:886) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:776)`
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
I have not been able to reproduce the error, it's something that is picked up by Fabric. I have recently disabled automatic back up for the realm files and I was hoping this will fix this error as well but it seems to still come up.
#### Code Sample
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 5.0.1
Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 3.1.2

*** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** pid: 0, tid: 0 >>> com.xxx <<<
backtrace: #00 pc 00000000000a3ffe /data/app/com.xxx-1/lib/arm/librealm-jni.so #01 pc 0000000000146271 /data/app/com.xxx-1/lib/arm/librealm-jni.so #02 pc 00000000001464c9 /data/app/com.xxx-1/lib/arm/librealm-jni.so #03 pc 00000000001486a1 /data/app/com.xxx-1/lib/arm/librealm-jni.so #04 pc 00000000000f17c9 /data/app/com.xxx-1/lib/arm/librealm-jni.so #05 pc 0000000000149f79 /data/app/com.xxx-1/lib/arm/librealm-jni.so #06 pc 0000000000137bed /data/app/com.xxx-1/lib/arm/librealm-jni.so #07 pc 000000000003de19 /data/app/com.xxx-1/lib/arm/librealm-jni.so (Java_io_realm_internal_Table_nativeSetString+176) #08 pc 0000000000b67899 /data/app/com.xxx-1/oat/arm/base.odex

Issue.Title: realm 1.1.0 with gradle plugin 3.x.x
Issue.Description:
I need to build an old project that uses realm 1.1.0 with gradle plugin 3.x.x.
Unfortunately the project code can't be updated to align with the breaking changes of the new realm versions
The issue is related to removal of `apt` and the introduction of the new `annotationProcessor`.
Is there a way to use a plugin version compatible the gradle plugin 3.x.x and at the same time have a dependency on the realm library 1.1.0?

Issue.Title: Testing findAllAsync asChangesetObservable queries with RunTestInLooperThread
Issue.Description:
<!---
**Questions**: If you have questions about how to use Realm, ask on [StackOverflow]( We monitor the `realm` tag.
**Feature Request**: Just fill in the first two sections below.
**Bugs**: To help you as fast as possible with an issue please describe your issue and the steps you have taken to reproduce it in as many details as possible.
--> Hi, guys! Thank you for your product. I am trying to write unit-tests for my DAO classes, that uses Realm. I use RunInLooperThread rule like in your RealmAsyncQueryTests class to test methods with findAllAsync calls. And i got the problem with RealmResults returned during the test.
#### Goal I would like to get loaded RealmResults after results.addChangeListener(listener); is called under the hood of asChangesetObservable. #### Expected Results First emit contains not loaded RealmResults, according to emitter.onNext(new CollectionChange<>(results, null)); in changesetsFrom implementation. But second emit should contain loaded RealmResults according to documentation
#### Actual Results I got RealmResults with isLoaded = false and it contains my data. RealmResults with isLoaded = true will never be returned from Observable. > E.g. full stack trace with exception java.lang.AssertionError: Expected: [com.wayray.element.core.data.CarData@0] (class: SingletonList), Actual: [] (latch = 1, values = 0, errors = 0, completions = 0, timeout!) at io.reactivex.observers.BaseTestConsumer.fail(BaseTestConsumer.java:191) at io.reactivex.observers.BaseTestConsumer.assertValue(BaseTestConsumer.java:356) at com.wayray.element.core.dao.CharacteristicDaoTest.test_getUserCharacteristicsByName(CharacteristicDaoTest.java:44) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method) at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod$1.runReflectiveCall(FrameworkMethod.java:50) at org.junit.internal.runners.model.ReflectiveCallable.run(ReflectiveCallable.java:12) at org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod.invokeExplosively(FrameworkMethod.java:47) at org.junit.internal.runners.statements.InvokeMethod.evaluate(InvokeMethod.java:17) at io.realm.rule.RunInLooperThread$TestThread.run(RunInLooperThread.java:509) #### Steps & Code to Reproduce
> Describe your current debugging efforts.
#### Code Sample
`` #### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): ? 5.1.0 Realm sync feature enabled: yes/no no Android Studio version: ? 3.1.2 Which Android version and device: ? Emulator with Android P
Could you possibly explain why this test fails, however this code works in the project?

Issue.Title: Null configuration returned on first application launch Android P
Issue.Description:
Android version: 28
Device: Emulator with android P api 28
Realm version: 4.1.0
GOAL: create and get a realm configuration
I'm testing an application with realm on android P, in first launch of the application after i set the permission of write_external_storage to true every time a want get the realm configuration with method below the configuration returned is always null.
If I kill the application and relaunch all works well , but is broken the first UX for the user whe the application is downloaded and first started. This happens only on android P.
What can i do? Is it a problem of the emulator?
``

Issue.Title: realmQuery.distinct().count() might return incorrect value
Issue.Description:
A mapping of a Stack Overflow question that is most likely a bug.
#### Goal
> What do you want to achieve?
Evaluate number of distinct items without having to use `findAll().size()`
#### Expected Results
`realm.where(Blah.class).distinct("birthday").count()` should work
#### Actual Results
Count returns the size of the full table data set.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
See
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 5.1.0
Realm sync feature enabled: no

#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
> Describe your current debugging efforts.
#### Code Sample
java
int size = answers.size();
for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) { Answer answer = answers.get(i); String questionId = answer.getQuestionId(); Question question = formDataOperation.getQuestionByIdIfActive(questionId); // For all removed questions, remove the answer if (question == null) { realm.executeTransaction(realm1 -> answer.deleteFromRealm()); } }
`
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
> What do you want to achieve? Iterate over `RealmResults<Answer>` [ `Answer` is a `RealmModel`]
#### Expected Results
> Iterate over complete list
#### Actual Results
> Application crashes because it reaches out of bounds. Does `RealmResults` update size once its objects are deleted? This did not happen in realm 2.x. If this is the new behaviour of `RealmResults`, then how does one go abut iterating over a list whose size keeps updating? Will it be safe to use an Iterator over this list?
Note: This never happened on a personal or test device. This stacktrace is from fabric crashlytics.
Stack Trace: ``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 5.0.1
Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 3.1
Which Android version and device: 7.1.1

Issue.Title: Native Realm Crashes on 4.2.0
Issue.Description:
**Questions**: Can someone decrypt and let me know if updating library will resolve these native crashes? I see the phrase `OsSharedRealm_native` in some of these logs, could it just be linked to a shared instance that has encryption? We have tried to reduce the amount of times realm could be open when not running in main instance.
**Bugs**: Native crashes reported in google play console. No steps to repro
### Expected Results
Reduce/Remove crashes
### Actual Results
#### 1st trace Motorola Moto Z (griffin), 3072MB RAM, Android 7.1 ``
### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 4.2.0
Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 3.1
Which Android version and device: Several marked in trace
Encryption is definitely used.
