Issue.Title: This Realm instance has already been closed, making it unusable.
Issue.Description:
Hi, This crash doesnt happen on my test mobile but has been reportedly very frequently on my client's devices. So the use case is 1. I have page which display feeds of any particular group 2. I click on the list of groups and it crashes with the above error, when i try to load the groups in recycler view.
I open my realm instance at the application level and close it only when the user logs out of the app.
Crash location: @Override public void bindViewHolder(FlexibleAdapter adapter, final GroupViewHolder holder, int position, List payloads) { *holder.binding.groupName.setText(networkGroupCache.getGroupName());* if (networkGroupCache.getMemberCount() != null) { holder.binding.totalAgents.setText("5 Agent"); } holder.binding.unreadCount.setTag(networkGroupCache.getId()); setAgentImages(holder); NetworkGroupCache is a ream object. Issue.Title: "Delete Realm if migration needed" always needed if version goes up
Issue.Description:

#### Goal

#### Expected Results
> No Data Loss since no RealmObject has been changed, only the realm schema version number has increased
#### Actual Results
> Every time a Realm schema version is updated, even without realm object changes, a migration or a deleteRealmIfMigrationNeeded() is called. (My RealmSchemaVersion follows the versionCode of my application), which i think it's not the best behavior, since all realm tables /properties are the same.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce

``

Issue.Title: Sync data local to remote - Android
Issue.Description:
<!---

**Questions**: If you have questions about how to use Realm, ask on
[StackOverflow](
We monitor the `realm` tag.

**Feature Request**: Just fill in the first two sections below.

**Bugs**: To help you as fast as possible with an issue please describe your issue
and the steps you have taken to reproduce it in as many details as possible.

-->

#### Goal

> Synchronize local data to a remote server

#### Expected Results

> I need to synchronize my local data to my Realm server, only the classes are created, what is the optimal way to send data to the server?

#### Actual Results

>  Only classes are created

#### Steps & Code to Reproduce

> Describe your current debugging efforts.
![image](


#### Code Sample

 private void onLoginSuccess(SyncUser user) {
        // Building syncing configuration using received authorized user
        SyncConfiguration syncConfiguration = new SyncConfiguration.Builder(user, REALM_URL)
                .errorHandler(new SyncSession.ErrorHandler() {
                    @Override
                    public void onError(SyncSession session, ObjectServerError error) {
                        Log.d(TAG, "onSyncSessionError: " + error.toString());
                    }
                })
                // waiting for until remote data arrives
                .waitForInitialRemoteData()
                .build();

        Realm.getInstanceAsync(syncConfiguration, new Realm.Callback() {
            @Override
            public void onSuccess(Realm realm) {
                onRealmInstanceReceived(realm);
            }
        });
    }

    private void onRealmInstanceReceived(Realm realm) {
        this.database = realm;
        queryRealmData();
        setChangeListeners();
    }

    private RealmResults<Usuario> usuarioList;
    // Change Listeners
    private GlobalChangeListener globalChangeListener = new GlobalChangeListener();
    private OrderedRealmChangeListener<Usuario> usuariosChangeListener = new OrderedRealmChangeListener<>("Usuario");

    private void queryRealmData() {
        this.usuarioList = this.database.where(Usuario.class).findAllAsync();
        //this.usuarioList = usuarioDao.findAllContainingSugarAsync();
    }

    private void setChangeListeners() {
        this.database.addChangeListener(globalChangeListener);
        this.usuarioList.addChangeListener(usuariosChangeListener);
    }

    private static class GlobalChangeListener implements RealmChangeListener<Realm> {
        @Override
        public void onChange(Realm realm) {
            Log.d(TAG, "onGlobalChange: ");
        }
    }

    private static class OrderedRealmChangeListener<T extends RealmModel> implements OrderedRealmCollectionChangeListener<RealmResults<T>> {

        private final String name;

        private OrderedRealmChangeListener(String name) {
            this.name = name;
        }

        @Override
        public void onChange(RealmResults<T> realmResults, OrderedCollectionChangeSet changeSet) {
            Log.d(TAG, "EEEEHHHH: ");
            if (changeSet != null) {
                for (OrderedCollectionChangeSet.Range range : changeSet.getChangeRanges()) {
                    Log.d(TAG, name + " onChange. Range startIndex = " + range.startIndex + ". Range length = " + range.length);
                }

                for (OrderedCollectionChangeSet.Range range : changeSet.getDeletionRanges()) {
                    Log.d(TAG, name + " onDelete. Range startIndex = " + range.startIndex + ". Range length = " + range.length);
                }

                for (OrderedCollectionChangeSet.Range range : changeSet.getInsertionRanges()) {
                    Log.d(TAG, name + " onInsert. Range startIndex = " + range.startIndex + ". Range length = " + range.length);
                }
            }
        }
    }

> Your code here. Bigger samples should ideally be as separate Android Studio project, 
> in gists/repositories or privately at help@realm.io)

```

Realm version(s): 5.1.0

Realm sync feature enabled: yes

Android Studio version: 3.1.2

Which Android version and device: 6.0.1

Issue.Title: Big risk of loosing data on ClientResetRequiredError
Issue.Description:
The documentation says it is my responsibility to close realms finished using them. However, in practice, it turns out it is not so easy. When doing a client reset and a realm instance is open, the app will crash and you will loose any unsynced data, so it is very important to be able to close it. This is super tricky to get right!
The documentation says a good practice is to close the realm when the activity is destroyed. But onDestroy is not always called immediately. This makes it almost impossible to guarantee that all realm instances have been closed.
In my case a realm instance from my main activity remains even after calling finish on that activity and starting another responsible for handling Client Resets. In the end I had to put in a thread sleep in my client reset activity in order to give android time to destroy the previous activity before I could execute the reset. Is this really the way to go?
The swift documentation says the following
>It is extremely important that your application listen for client reset errors and, at the very least, make provisions to save user data created or modified after a client reset is triggered so it can later be written back to the re-downloaded copy of the Realm.
In the Android Docs, client resets aren't even mentioned. And as it turns out, they are extremely hard to get right. If there is a recommended way to execute a client reset properly, please provide documentation for it.
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 5.1.0
Realm sync feature enabled: yes
Android Studio version: 3.1
Which Android version and device: Android 8.1, Nexus 5X

Issue.Title: Re-enable compact for Synced Realms
Issue.Description:
Core 5.6.0 and Sync 3.3.0 now have support for compacting Synced Realms.
We need to re-enable `compactOnLaunch` for synced Realms and remove the restriction on `Realm.compact()`. Note that `Realm.compact()` probably needs to be called before the Realm is opened as the background Sync thread might keep the Realm open after it is closed making compaction impossible.

Issue.Title: Make it easy to delete serverside Realm during development
Issue.Description: From > 8 ) Make it easy to delete server Realm on schema changesThe rapid development cycle is extremely annoying on a partial synced Realm. For every change you need A) Goto the instance and delete the reference + partial Realm B) delete the app on the device to avoid client resets. It would be nice if deleteRealmIfMigrationRequired was also available for synced Realms and it would also delete the server Realm (or some other easy-to-use option).Suggesed API:``This API will probably be a bit difficult to implement as deleting a Realm requires a REST API call, but since this option should only be used in development, blocking the UI thread until it completes is probably acceptable. We should most likely put very strict checks into it so the option can never be used in a release build.

Issue.Title: Realm Migration Crashing on some devices
Issue.Description:
<!---
**Questions**: If you have questions about how to use Realm, ask on [StackOverflow]( We monitor the `realm` tag.

#### Goal
> Add a column to a Realm Object and update the Realm with a Migration accordingly.
#### Expected Results
> The app does not crash.
#### Actual Results
> The app crashes only sometimes. Of 2k users, 200 of them have experienced a crash with migrating the Realm. The versions it occurs on spans all supported versions, 4.4 - 8.1 and across a variety of devices. The crash does not happen on any locally tested devices. Between the releases some plugins, Android Studio, and gradle has been updated but Realm has not been. It is v 4.3.0 on both versions of the app.
> Caused by io.realm.exceptions.RealmMigrationNeededException Migration is required due to the following errors: - Property 'Container.date' has been added.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
> Describe your current debugging efforts.
I have been trying to update that app in a variety of states. Open up a copy of the old version, and update it to the new version. Before updating try not having saved data, having data saved in a variety of combinations, updating at different points in the app, etc. I cannot make it crash on my devices, the migration seems to be working, but the crash reports I am receiving say otherwise.
#### Code Sample
I have one realm that is a login realm where user credentials are stored, and then each user has his own realm for their respective data. The field added is only relevant to the user realm, not the login realm.
There was no explicitly defined schema or migration before this. I added one once the migration was needed. I did not update the login realm, as it does not access or use the property.
``

Android Studio version: 3.1.2

Issue.Description:
**Bugs**: I am using REALM on both iOS and Android - The realm read queries on android take significantly longer than on iOS.
The query that I have traced is taking 200-300 ms ++
_public class Field extends RealmObject { @PrimaryKey private String id; (uuid) _
_public class Option extends RealmObject { @PrimaryKey private String id; (uuid) private Field field;_
This is the structure of the schema that I have .. I have about 4500+ options in the database and about 1500+ fields in the database.
This is the query I have -> RealmResults<Option> optRes = mRealm.where(Option.class).isNotNull("field"). in("field.id",fieldArray).isNull("deleted_at").findAll();
the fieldArray probably has 75-100 fields with about 300+ options which should be part of the result when querying.
**This query is taking between 250-350 ms - which is probably about 10 times what it takes on the iOS platform.**

Issue.Title: [Android 8] Realm instance is not updated
Issue.Description:
Hi guys, maybe is an issue you guys didn t notice but it was happening on Android 8 devices. I could fix the problem using refresh() method to avoid inconsistent instances.
Well, let me describe my problem.
As we have to open and close realm instances, we add for all activities a method to control opening and closing actions avoiding huge databases files on device. For services, as a message service for push notifications, we had to use the default realm instance which has access to live objects that are been handled on view.
The problem is when we have to manipulate this data on Android 8 devices. The data has been not updated when we get a push notification. the solution for that was call .refresh() method to force update.
I realize that some information was missing on this service when the data is not updated, so maybe there is something I missed or maybe it is, in fact, a gap for Android 8 devices.
Note: This only happens on Android 8 devices, other devices have a regular behavior.
Java: 8 Realm version(s): 4.3.1 Realm sync feature enabled: yes Android Studio version: 3.0 Android version: 8.0 / Any device

Issue.Title: RealmObject is not a part of the schema of this realm
Issue.Description:
Hi, I have gone through most the issues under the same title, but my use case is bit different and hence wanted to clarify few things on the ways to use realm. I am moving from MVC architecture to the MVP and for so long we had dependency on a separate application(**Dependent**) which defined realm in its gradle and was providing the realm classes to the parent application(**Parent**) depending on it. But I am looking to remove this dependency and slowly converge both the projects into one.
Steps: 1. Have moved realm classpath to project level 2. apply plugin: realm-android is given on both the application level gradle. 3. Singleton realm instance is created on the dependent application **Dependent**. 4. have defined classes extending from realm in both the projects(as I said gradually we ll merge) 5. classes defined in application **Parent** extends from realm which gives error that this model is not part of the schema for this realm.
Am i right in using realm in two applications under same project using same singleton instance.

Realm sync feature enabled: yes
Android Studio version: 3.1.1

Issue.Title: realm.executeTransactionAsync() is NOT always executed in Realm 5.0/5.0.1
Issue.Code:
kotlin println("activity.realm closed = ${activity.realm.isClosed}") // always printed "false"
activity.realm.executeTransactionAsync { realmAsync -> println("loadOffline inAsync tickers INSIDE") // printed sometimes
val tickers = realm.where(CoinTickerList::class.java).equalTo("uuid", "MY_ID").findFirst()!!
println("loadOffline inAsync tickers.size = ${tickers.size}") // printed sometimes } `
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
I am trying to load an object in a background thread using realm.executeTransactionAsync()
#### Expected Results
realm.executeTransactionAsync() should always execute, thus loading the object from realm to UI
#### Actual Results
realm.executeTransactionAsync() is executed only sometimes, and other times, it is not executed
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
#### Code Sample
``
Sometimes, I see the "loadOffline inAsync tickers INSIDE" in the output and sometimes I do not see this output. This function is called when app is opened to load the data from realm to UI. I am checking by opening the app multiple times, but in sometimes, I do not see this output in logcat.
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 5.0.1 at present [It was working fine before when my earlier objects were compiled using 4.3.3 with Android Gradle plugin 3.0.1. Then I updated Realm to 5.0.0, later updated Android Gradle plugin to 3.1, then created a new class of RealmObject and getting problem after that.]
Realm sync feature enabled: No
Android Studio version: 3.1.1 (latest)
Which Android version and device: Android 8.1 (Oreo) on One Plus 3T

Issue.Title: Primary key migration from optional to required deleting rows
Issue.Code:
java
> Your code here. Bigger samples should ideally be as separate Android Studio project, > in gists/repositories or privately at help@realm.io)
`
Issue.Description:
<!---
**Questions**: If you have questions about how to use Realm, ask on [StackOverflow]( We monitor the `realm` tag.
**Feature Request**: Just fill in the first two sections below.
**Bugs**: To help you as fast as possible with an issue please describe your issue and the steps you have taken to reproduce it in as many details as possible.
-->
Hi guys, i just encountered a weird problem and don't know if is a bug or i just don't know how to migrate things. I found a workaround for that, create new field with required attribute, transform to get the value of the old primary key, remove old primary key and set primary key to the newly created field.
#### Goal Change primary key name and required to true (Kotlin non-null but not @Required)
#### Expected Results The primary key with the new name and the field to be required
#### Actual Results Migration removing 4 of 5 rows in the table after seting setRequired(Y, true) I checked the operation before and all the rows have the primary key with a value and are not null
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce Didn't check with another project but in my case was: Have a realm object schema with nullable primary key. Multiple objects of that type with values in the primary key. Make a migration changing the name and required to true The new table contains only one row and not the 5 before the migration
#### Code Sample
``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): ? 4.3.3 Realm sync feature enabled: yes/no No Android Studio version: ? 3.1.1 Which Android version and device: ? 7.0

Issue.Title: Poor behavior of Realm with transient keyword
Issue.Description:
#### Goal I am having few cases where I needed to exclude fields from Gson serialization, but I need them in my Realm database.
#### Expected Results Previously I used `transient` keyword for such cases and it worked fine.
#### Actual Results Right now I'm having `java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Field does not exist` exception when trying to do a query by using field marked as `transient`.
I found out that this is happening because of behavior implemented in this issue #4279
Fields marked as `transient` are ignored even if I put `@Required` on them.
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 5.0.0

Issue.Title: Can't view realm database file
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
I would like to be able to view an exported .realm file.
#### Expected Results
Realm Browser: should be able to open an exported .realm file
Realm Studio: should be able to open an exported .realm file
#### Actual Results
Realm Browser: asks me to enter an encryption key (i'm not using encryption, that I know of)
Realm Studio: can't open the .realm file due to "bad file size"
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
Export the .realm file from the device using ADB. Try opening the exported .realm file with Realm Browser or Realm Studio. Will not open.
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 5.0.0
Realm sync feature enabled: Not sure.
Android Studio version: 3.0.1
Which Android version and device: Android 8.1 on Pixel 2
(I'm happy to ask this somewhere else if there is a more appropriate place.)

Issue.Description:
Hi the migration of optional kotlin objects in realm generates the following error.
> java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to create application com.merqueo.app.AppController: io.realm.exceptions.RealmMigrationNeededException: Migration is required due to the following errors: - Property 'ProductTracker.departmentId' has been made optional. - Property 'ProductTracker.shelfId' has been made optional. - Property 'ProductTracker.price' has been made optional. - Property 'ProductTracker.specialPrice' has been made optional. - Property 'ProductTracker.bestPriceGuaranteed' has been made optional. - Property 'ProductTracker.position' has been made optional.

Issue.Title: [Sync] Schema validation failed

Issue.Title: Issue on my all Android devices

Issue.Title: RealmObject.isValid(...) will return true on a `null` object
Issue.Description:
Hey folks,
I used the RealmObject.isValid() method recently and I noticed the implementation was returning true for `null` objects: ``
As `object instanceof RealmObjectProxy` will be false for a `null` object, the `return true` block is reached.
Is it the expected behavior? I'm resolving this by doing `(object != null && RealmObject.isValid(object))`, so there are a lot of repeats, and if I forget to add the null check we could end up with NPEs.
What do you think?
Thank you in advance.
Cheers,
Olivier

Issue.Title: Combining Timeout & RunTestInLooperThread could fails
Issue.Description: Combining `Timeout` rule``with `RunInLooperThread` could fail since `Timeout` will use its own thread to run the test which is different from the looper thread. This will break thread confined operation like closing a Realm, so using `looperThread.closeAfterTest(realm);` will break since the Realm was opened from "Time-limited test" thread and attempt to be closed from "RunInLooperThread" (`RunInLooperThread#closeResources`)For now, avoid using `looperThread.closeAfterTest` or `Timeout` rule with `RunInLooperThread`

Issue.Title: Partial Sync canonicalPath is wrong
Issue.Description: Currently, using a global or partial sync will end up using the same path locally, which may cause some problems when we try to connect to a partially sync Realm after a connection to a global (reference) Realm. This is due to the nature of `SyncConfiguration#getCanonicalPath` which is used to set the path of the C++ `conf` to open the Realm, this method doesn't build a different path for global/partial sync, as it should be (see A quick fix could be to set the correct path when building the native configuration ex:``

Issue.Title: Realm Migration -Painful tasks upon non-uniform upgrade
Issue.Description:
I would like to explore can the Realm Migration for the intended RealmObject() be restrict to all the essential parameters be written once only in the application or main activity only incorporating the required version number also stated as singularity ?
Current Migration Practice for the upgrade for just one Realm Objects must ensure all the following be complete
val version_no=1 --> propose defined just once in the application class where Realm.init(this) is executed val rec_config = RealmConfiguration.Builder() .name("Grocery_Rec.realm") .schemaVersion(version_no) .migration(Grocery_Realm_Migration()) .build()
Currently I noticed that whatever fragment or sub-activity having realm instance called must also include .migration(Grocery_Realm_Migration()) line in addition to the .schemaVersion(xx) defined.
Can't this "version_no" be simplified and coded as an Global integer with just the latest version number be defined as .schemaVersion(version_no) without the ever confusing .migration(xx) line .
I currently solved this daunting version_no keep track as one the POJO object return field integer having the latest number. Any new schema upgrade , I just alter the number to latest version once only. This would be good if this could just be defined once in the Application class only ??
It would also be very tedious to search around every line in all the fragments and activities to hunt for that unique particular realm instance called to make sure the .migration(xx) is added to avoid the App from Crashing .
Real Painful task whenever an upgrade is required as not all the " tables" or RealmObject() in the complex App need to upgraded uniformly per se.

Issue.Title: Add wrappers for new password provider methods
Issue.Description:
Weve added a few additional methods in ROS that allow people to implement password reset and email confirmation flows. While these are simple HTTP API, itd be nice to create wrappers for them. All of these rely on the idea that the username/password provider is actually used as email/password (which we probably have to highlight in the method docs).
The url for all actions is: `POST
The body looks like:
``
All return an empty response and will not provide indication if the user doesn't exist, but will return errors if some of the parameters are invalid.
1. Request password reset: a reset password email is sent to the user's email with some opaque token. - `provider_id` is **required** - `action` is `reset_password` - **No** other fields in `data` 2. Confirm password reset: after obtaining the token from the email, the user can complete the password reset flow. By default, ROS will send an email that will redirect to ` where a generic UI will be shown to complete the password reset. However, it's possible to override this URL and e.g. change it to `myapp://reset-password/%TOKEN%` so that it's handled by the app itself. It's the developer's responsibility to obtain the token if they want to complete the reset flow within the app. - `provider_id` should not be provided - `action` is `complete_reset` - `data` contains the following additional fields: - `token`: the token sent to the user's email address. - `new_password`: the new password of the user. 3. Initiate email confirmation: for a lot of use cases, people may want to know that the user has confirmed their email before allowing them to take certain actions in the app. An email will be sent to the user's email address with an opaque token. - `provider_id` is **required** - `action` is `request_email_confirmation` - **No** other fields in `data` 4. Confirm email: similarly to the password reset flow, the user obtains the token from the email somehow any must pass it to the server. By default, we'll redirect to a generic page hosted in ROS. - `provider_id` should not be provided - `action` is `confirm_email` - `data` contains the following additional fields: - `token`: the token sent to the user's email address. - **Note**: After the email is confirmed, the json response after logging in with username/password will contain `isEmailConfirmed` field set to `true`. We should probably surface that on the `User` object.
Implementation/testing notes: This depends on being merged and released.

Issue.Title: [Sync] Add API to create a schemaless Realm
Issue.Description: There are use cases in Sync where we need to wait for the schema to be synchronised by the server before opening the Realm:- Read-only scenario (since we can't create an empty Readonly Realm with a schema), it needs first to exist with the corresponding schema- In case of the new permission system, we may choose to start with an empty Realm to synchronise the permission schema from the server before start modifying it (to avoid working on a duplicate permission offline that might be corrected/removed by sync later)

Issue.Title: Problems in advanced tutorial
Issue.Description:
A couple of problems were identified when trying to follow
Under "Creating a partial sync configuration": - In the first code snippet, `REALM_URL` should be `REALM_BASE_URL` - Saying that the rest of the code is unchanged is not true. There are changes in the import section and you have to replace `this.goToItemsActivity` with `setUpRealmAndGoToListTaskActivity`
You will have to add `title_select_projects` to strings.xml
The `ProjectsActivity` has to be added to the manifest

Issue.Title: Default Sync Realm API
Issue.Description:
As part of the upcoming release of partial sync, Realm Platform Self-Hosted and Cloud will offer the concept of a default synced Realm. This is designed to simplify how developers start working with synced data. Specifically it will fix or improve the following:
1. Simplify how developers think about their data model. Previously developers needed to split their data into multiple Realms to control data access. Now with partial sync and the new permission system this is not necessary. 2. Mirror the ease of use of Realm Database which offers a similar default Realm convenience API 3. Limit the code needed to open a synced Realm - now the user simply needs to login with just the auth URL instead of needing to worry about Realm URLs and paths 4. The default synced Realm will include the master User list of the application allowing developers to incorporate relationships to users simplifying how to think about user metadata.
API Proposal:
``

Issue.Title: Realm crash samsung s8+
Android ToDo App usability is bad
Issue.Description:
This issue relates to `
The prerequisites paragraph should come first. You should install Android Studio also when you select the quick start.
## Quick Start: Downloading and building the app goes relatively easy. The problems start when you run the app and is presented with the nickname prompt. What to do? I tried to enter a name and an error occurred. It turned out that the problem was that I included " in the URL of the cloud instance. Separate issue created.
## The not so quick start
I find that this approach to construct the application is way too complicated. I gave up half way through. I felt I had lost the overview of where I was in the process, I was not sure if I had done it correctly and I did not know how long time it would take me to complete the task.
A specific problem is that when it in step 5 says "Now compile and run the application ", the application cannot run.
Another problem is that if you copy the code from the web page, you will get some illegal characters into the source code. They appear when you have a blank line.
## Conclusion Overall result: no success experience after 2 hours work. If you want to have a step-by-step instruction, then you should develop the application in a way that you have a running example after each step. And you should learn something about how to use Realm is each step.

Issue.Title: Objects which belong to Realm instances in other threads cannot be copied into this Realm instance.
Use Transformer to remove unsupported methods from non-sync builds
Issue.Description:
Currently in `5.0.0-BETA` we have a number of methods and classes annotated with the `@ObjectServer`
These methods are kinda like extension methods only relevant for sync builds and should not be there when using non-sync Realm.
I attempted to use Proguard to remove these, but all attempts at doing so have failed so far, so plan B it is.
We should be able to copy our current RealmTransformer and only run it when building release builds. Then we can use JavaAssist to remove any code with a given annotation.

Issue.Title: "The Realm is already in a write transaction" with unrelated `executeTransaction` calls
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
To report a potential issue between transactions and listener notifications.
#### Expected Results
To have multiple, unrelated, `executeTransaction` calls in one thread (like the UI thread), without the risk of crashing due to Realm already being writing a transaction.
#### Actual Results
I have 2 unrelated `executeTransaction` calls in the same thread and, due to a third transaction running in the background, they crash.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
I created a simplified Android project to reproduce the issue (please disregard the concepts behind the objects in the project):
The idea of the test project: - the objects: 1x`App`, 1x`Session`, and 10x`Item` - `App` and `Session` are related to one another, but unrelated to `Item` - when `App` is updated, it updates `Session` - `App` is being updated in the background, every 100ms, which triggers a listener to update `Session` - you can click on items in a list, to toggle their `isBookmarked` property - if you click a few times, eventually the application will crash, because it will try to update `Session` after starting a transaction to update an item. It will call `notifyChangeListeners` after `beginTransaction` -> this is the issue
#### Version of Realm Realm version(s): 4.3.4

Issue.Title: Better error when calling where with RealmModel
Issue.Description:
In Kotlin I sometimes end up in a situation where a type that I pass to `where` is treated as a `RealmModel` instead of a `RealmModel` subclass, but it's not always obvious from looking at the code. The problem is `where` eventually calls `Util.getOriginalModelClass` which get a superclass of null, causing a runtime NPE exception (`superclass.equals` because superclass is null).
It would be nice if there was a more informative message so that I could tell what was happening right away.

Issue.Title: copyToRealmOrUpdate does not trigger findFirstAsync
Issue.Description:
<!---
**Questions**: If you have questions about how to use Realm, ask on [StackOverflow]( We monitor the `realm` tag.
**Feature Request**: Just fill in the first two sections below.
**Bugs**: To help you as fast as possible with an issue please describe your issue and the steps you have taken to reproduce it in as many details as possible.
-->
#### Goal

Issue.Title: clearTable is not supported on Partial Sync
Issue.Description:
`table.clear()` is not supported for Partial Sync, so we should change any internal implementation that uses this.
APIs:
* `Realm.delete(Class)` -> Replace with `findAll().deleteAllFromRealm()`.
For efficiency we should probably only do this if Partial Sync is enabled as deleting the query result is slower.

This time the following code will return that the user does not exist because the returned realm is empty. Issue.Title: Help with frequently updated realm objects (specifying the listener more precisely?)
Issue.Description:
Hi, I have this case, where I have a Library screen with list of realm objects, diffed via asChangesetObservable.
``
**My problem is that sometimes updates happen very quickly, for example in case of downloading a file, I update "download progress" field realm. This in turn triggers my observable and redraws my list.**
**The problem is that in that Library screen list I dont care about progress value, only progress status changing started / success / error, etc. also a realm field.**
Is there a way to tell that changed or somehow specify the listener or black list some fields? Without this I am redrawing recyclerview (even tho only 1 item via notifyItemChanged, but still) on the background for no reason.
I also tried pausing on onPause/onResume, via proxying the CollectionChange to BehaviourSubject and unsubscribing from it in onPause, and then when view comesback in onResume, it will get that last emit. However this also is buggy as I get diff against the last realm state, not the state when I paused at, which leaves my recyclerview messed up with multiple duplicate items etc.
So either I keep all the changesets, which is not really cool in terms of memory, and then apply some compacting logic (I would get n-times notifyItemChanged(0), or somehow add logic to notifyDataSetChanged in onResume, or force possible detach the objects and do diffing my self)
_Not getting notified in the cases I dont care about would be the best, then Id be cool with being updated on the background aswell because its not very infrequent_
Thanks

final RealmResults<Post> results = realm.where(Post.class).findAll(); if (response.getPostList() != null && response.getPostList().size() > 0) { realm.beginTransaction(); results.deleteAllFromRealm(); //response has post list with correct parsed objects //results is empty realm.copyToRealm(response.getPostList()); //results has the values returned from the server but with null values realm.commitTransaction(); > Describe your current debugging efforts.

Issue.Title: ExponentialBackoffTask reduce waiting time when connection is back
Issue.Description: The current `ExponentialBackoffTask` perform an indefinite retry (except for the `logout` query) when there's a network issue. This is suboptimal since we do have a network listener that we rely on internally to hint to Sync client that the connection might be re-established to resume sync, we can use this event to retry immediately rather than waiting for the wait the `ExponentialBackoffTask` is undergoing

Issue.Title: Error converting bytecode to data gradle 2.3.3
Kotlin extensions from oneOf group don't support arrays with not-nulls
Issue.Description:
<!---
**Questions**: If you have questions about how to use Realm, ask on [StackOverflow]( We monitor the `realm` tag.
**Feature Request**: Just fill in the first two sections below.
**Bugs**: To help you as fast as possible with an issue please describe your issue and the steps you have taken to reproduce it in as many details as possible.
-->
#### Goal
> I want to pass `Array<Long>` as query parameter to `oneOf` function from Kotlin extensions
#### Actual Results
> `Array<Long>` can't be passed to `oneOf` function, because Kotlin extensions for this function can consume only arrays of nullable types (for example `Array<Long?>` in my case) while with old `in` function everything works as expected. Perhaps you should add `out` variance to generics in these extensions like this:
``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 4.3.3
Android Studio version: 3.0.1

#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
I do not have these devices. They are in the wild. But technically it just opens a Realm in `Application.onCreate()`, **or** in `BroadcastReceiver.onReceive()`.
#### Code Sample
It really is just opening a Realm configuration. Properties:
- No encryption - `deleteIfMigrationNeeded()`
The tricky thing here is that
1.) these devices already had permission troubles with 1.2.0 (?!) 2.) it only happens on two specific Huawei devices, but it seems to be a popular device, because it affects quite a few users... :| 3.) the access of Realm file is **multi-process** (broadcast receiver + app itself)

Issue.Description:
Edit by @cmelchior See for the most plausible reason for this.
---

> What do you want to achieve?
Open Realm file on Huawei P8 and Huawei P8 Lite
#### Expected Results
Realm should work on all devices
#### Actual Results
Apparently there are 2 very specific Huawei devices (Android 6.0) where Realm files cannot be opened.
There is also possibility that this only occurs in multi-process access, but it *is* happening in production.

Issue.Title: findFirst() not working with sort()
Issue.Description:
Using DynamicRealm 4.3.3
A) `DynamicRealmObject lastTrack = realm.where(Model.TRACK).sort("timeStart", Sort.DESCENDING).findAll().first(null);` and B) `DynamicRealmObject lastTrack = realm.where(Model.TRACK).sort("timeStart", Sort.DESCENDING).findFirst();`
A) and B) have different results. A) is correct working, B) not working

Issue.Title: Rewrite annotation processor in Kotlin
Issue.Description: With the latest changes introduced in the annotation processor through #5280 the annotation processor is now an (even bigger) mess of internal data structures with a lot `String`s being parsed around and stored. Just to name a few:- QualifiedJavaClassName- SimpleJavaClassName- InternalClassName- JavaFieldName- InternalFieldNameWith Kotlin we can [typealias]( all of these, massively increasing the readability and type safety.

Issue.Title: Random crashes, Huge instabilities with latest 5 version(s) (double free, RealmFinalizing..etc.)
Issue.Description:
We're developing an application that heavily relies on Realm. We moved out from SQLite/SnappyDB since after benchmarking we found Realm outperform them all.
For the past period we've tried everything and every design/execution/transaction pattern possible to avoid random crashes allover our application, practically we rewrote everything related to DB around 3 or 4 times allover without any luck trying to avoid humongous amount of crashs.
The crashes are not consistent, happens everywhere, however we've narrowed them down to a sorted list and %95 of them happen when a GC is triggered. They're all related to RealmFinalizing attempting to free an already freed object or memory location, no idea!
We've got similar issues when were developing a JNI library where we were attempting to free an already freed pointer or freeing it before its attempted to be used.
I'll be pasting you here snippets from the crash.
Our crashes occurs more commonly on ART running devices, however they occur on Dalvik ones too (since both of them handles GCing differently).
Android versions tried on (4.4, 5.0, 6.0, 7.0) both arm-v7 and arm-v8a.
The reason we waited months before reporting this issue is from what we can get reading over the issues we see you always demand a source code or an apk and providing any of these is extremely hard, nearly impossible however we can provide any help possible trying to reproduce this issue.

Have no crashes using Realm. We currently run 4.3.3

Issue.Title: Failing to open synced realm after problems with internet.
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
Open synced realm using Realm.getInstanceAsync.
#### Expected Results
onSuccess called in provided callback
#### Actual Results
onError called with Throwable where message is set to "UNKNOWN(-1) It was not possible to download all remote changes. Has the SyncClient been started?"
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
1) call Realm.getInstanceAsync with waitForInitialRemoteData() set in configuration. 2) if something happened while data is downloading (internet connection lost, or user disable wifi or enter airplane mode) onError called with proper message. This works as expected. 3) Restore connection to internet 4) Try to connect again with same configuration. 5) onError called with message that downloading is not possible.
If you restart application - all works fine.
#### Code Sample
``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 4.3.1 Realm sync feature enabled: yes Android Studio version: 3.0.1 Which Android version and device: any

``

Is it a bug in my code? Can i prevent this crash?

Issue.Title: Object Server migration required after sync failed.
Issue.Description:
Hi, I have an issue on ROS-Android sync. it hard to reproduce but i got it few times. i have few(1-3) schema that i need to sync, and do sync in queue (waiting for first completed than starts second) each schema contains 3-5 tables, each table 3-7 columns and 10-500 rows The issue appears in case user is new (he is just install the application), than app connects to the ROS and try to sync data, but in case app got time-out exception (by some reason) there is a chance that schema will be "corrupted". And in this case on next try to sync data i got "migration needed" exception. but as i understand there is no chance to do delete-On-Migration-Needed for SyncUser. How can i handle this? Thank you
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 4.3.1
Realm sync feature enabled: yes
Android Studio version: 3.0.1
Which Android version and device: 7.1.0, google pixel xl

Issue.Title: Stale data (Race condition ?) when using Realm with Rx Java `concatMap` and Retrofit
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
I want to use Rx Java's `concatMap` operator to control the order of network requests. I update some objects in step_1 and reload them in step_2.
#### Expected Results
Unless I am wrong, accessing objects from (potentially) another thread requires just a new query. I do not get any exception, BUT I get back stale data.
#### Actual Results
I get back **stale data**. This means, the field I updated in step1 still has the **old value** when I read it in step2.
Unless I add this code:
Thread.sleep(300) realm.refresh()
Of course this `Thread.sleep(XXX)` is a huge issue for me.
Here is a sample run: ``

Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 3.0.1

Issue.Title: OrderedRealmCollectionChangeListener receives multiple notifications of insertions when inserting only one record
Issue.Description:
We do a search for all results that meet a condition and ask for only unique results (distinctValues).
We added a changeListener in the RealmResults.
When we add a single record on another activity an return to the previews one, we often receive 2 or more records to add in the OrderedRealmCollectionChangeListener.
Realm version: 4.3.1

Issue.Title: The library need to decrease in size
Realm.getInstance(String key) method?
Issue.Description: #### Goal Will Realm add `Realm.getInstance(String key)` method, instead of `Realm.getInstance(RealmConfiguration configuration)`? #### Expected Results Using `Realm.getInstance(RealmConfiguration configuration)` is hard to maintain the memory leak. We need to set `RealmConfiguration` instance to `null` when app is closed to prevent the leak. But sometimes, recreating a new instance of this configuration causes Realm configuration cannot be initiated twice. So, is there a safer method to replace it? I mean, can you add `Realm.getInstance(String key)` method? I hope we can get the instance easier: ``

On server I have length of time (in seconds) in which access tokens are valid to 600 and the length of time (in seconds) in which refresh tokens are valid to 3153600000 - as You can see default settings.

java public String getServerAuthUrl() { return "http://" + RealmConstants.REALM_SERVER_ENDPOINT + "/auth"; }
getting syncConfig: java private SyncConfiguration getConfig(SyncUser user, String realmUrl){ return new SyncConfiguration.Builder(user, realmUrl) .waitForInitialRemoteData() .build(); } `

Issue.Title: io.realm.DefaultRealmModuleMediator is not stable
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
If no source changes are made then the generated classes by Realm should be stable, otherwise building is slower due to incremental compilers, transforms and dexers doing extra work to process the changed outputs.
#### Expected Results
Given a simple project with 2 realm objects, `com.example.realm.MyRealmObject` and `com.example.realm.MyAnotherRealmObject` the generated class `io.realm.DefaultRealmModuleMediator` should always have the same contents.
#### Actual Results
The order of modelClasses in mediator varies randomly from build-to-build (code taken from the `static {}` initializer of `DefaultRealmModuleMediator`)
sometimes it is:
``
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
Any realm project with more than 1 realm object.
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 4.3.0 Realm sync feature enabled: no Android Studio version: 3.0.1 Which Android version and device: N/A
The problem seems to be the `HashSet<ClassMetaData>` sets used in the processor. It does not specify a hashcode so `Object#hashCode` is used which is not stable from run-to-run. Hence the ordering within the set is random. A quick fix would be to use `LinkedHashSet` instead, will send a PR shortly.

Issue.Title: Optimization: Realm doing regex string split and String[] allocation on every .equalTo()
Issue.Description:
For a simple query such as `r.where(My.class).equalTo("id", 1).findfirst() `there is a cost of a regex string split causing a String[] allocation even if the field in question doesn't contain any "." separators.
``
As it is there is no apparent issue but imagine if the small query is in a scrolling RecyclerView done on every onBindView() pass. Now, we have an unnecessary allocation problem in a tight loop. I would suggest:
1) avoid any parsing if we know ahead of time this field cannot contain ".". I believe the transformer can keep a mapped cache of ALL mapped fields that do contain a "." and any negative match against it will skip this parsing code.
2) Cache the parseFieldDescription in a map and only dynamically parse on first attempt for this Realm.class field.

Issue.Title: Suggestion: Bad encryption exception is too broad - IllegalArgumentException
Issue.Description:
#### Goal Can we have better encryption handling exception thrown from Realm? Currently when bad passphrase is used on configuration the `IllegalArgumentException: Wrong key used to decrypt Realm.` is thrown.
#### Expected Results
I would like to suggest to use `RealmFileException` with its own `RealmFileException.Kind.WRONG_ENCRYPTION_KEY` or something similar to better catch that specific issue and handle it.

Issue.Title: Realm migration needed without Realm changes
Issue.Description:
<!---
**Questions**: If you have questions about how to use Realm, ask on [StackOverflow]( We monitor the `realm` tag.
**Feature Request**: Just fill in the first two sections below.
**Bugs**: To help you as fast as possible with an issue please describe your issue and the steps you have taken to reproduce it in as many details as possible.
-->
#### Goal
> Update my application without need to migrate Realm, or provide a migration that works for all cases
#### Expected Results
> Application updated without RealmMigrationNeededException.
#### Actual Results
> Sometimes I'm getting a RealmMigrationNeededException, sometimes I don't. Reference: [ @cmelchior answered my there, but I still can't understand what's going on.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
> 1) Publish an android app with build version number 24. > 2) Realm schema version number is the same as build version number. Make no changes to Realm objects, update it to 25, ou 26, or 27.
No migration should be required but it does. And providing a simple code as listed below works for some cases but doesn't in other cases. I'm getting all kinds of migration exception messages, from
> Field count is more than expected - expected 4 but was 5
> The 'Table' class is missing from the schema for this Realm.
But it doesn't happen everytime, that's why it bugs me, I've tested with all app versions that I had on store. Installed, logged in, and then installed my newer version with my migration, it never breaks. But I'm getting fabric crashes like thoses listed above in some cases. I trying to understand a couple of things. Like why it happens sometimes only? And why Realm is asking for a migration since I didn't change anything in any RealmObject? I already made some changes, changed build version and Realm didn't ask for any migration, which I think it's the correct behavior. I'm avoiding to go to _deleteRealmIfMigrationNeeded_ because I don't know how many users will have their data erased. But it looks like it's the only way to workaround this issue.
#### Code Sample
``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 3.3.2
Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 3.0.0
Which Android version and device: Android versions 5, 6 and 7 Devices list: TCL 8050E LG K8 LTE ASUS_Z017DC Samgung Galaxy J7

Issue.Title: Unrecoverable error. msync() failed
Issue.Description:
Hello folks,
We have an android device running a custom build of Android 2.3.3. We recently pulled in realm to manage data in our app and we noticed that in few prod devices, we saw our app crash due to the following exceptions.
This exception was random and we could not reproduce it in our test environment. Also, this was reported by very few devices which we were working fine otherwise.
We store only limited data in realm and we checked to confirm that there are no space constraints. Also, we made sure that we do not write to realm on the main thread.
**Unrecoverable error. msync() failed: I/O error in /home/cc/repo/realm/release/realm/realm-library/src/main/cpp/io_realm_internal_SharedRealm.cpp line 295**
**Unrecoverable error. msync() failed: Read-only file system in /home/cc/repo/realm/release/realm/realm-library/src/main/cpp/io_realm_internal_SharedRealm.cpp line 295**
We would love to know if there is a deeper issue that we might have missed. This is the first time I am making a bug on Github. Let me know in case I missed anything. thanks for your time!
#### Expected Results
> Realm Save on background thread should work in all devices.
#### Actual Results
> io.realm.exceptions.RealmError io.realm.internal.SharedRealm.nativeCommitTransaction(Native Method) io.realm.internal.SharedRealm.commitTransaction(SharedRealm.java:262) io.realm.BaseRealm.commitTransaction(BaseRealm.java:359) io.realm.Realm.commitTransaction(Realm.java:132) io.realm.Realm.executeTransaction(Realm.java:1404)
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
> We have not been able to reproduce this issue in our test devices. we noticed this exception while analyzing crashes on production devices.
#### Code Sample
Unfortunately, I cannot share the complete code, but this is how we normally save a realm object.
``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): ? Realm gradle plugin 3.5
Android Studio version: 3.0
Which Android version and device: 2.3.3 Gingerbread | custom android device

Issue.Title: [Kotlin] annotation processor throws if the realm plugin is applied after kotlin
Issue.Description: #### Goal Use a RealmList in Kotlin #### Expected Results I'm able to use a (Kotlin) String in a RealmList #### Actual Results Realm can't use Kotlin strings, saying: Error:Element type of RealmList must be a class implementing 'RealmModel' or one of the 'java.lang.String', 'byte[]', 'java.lang.Boolean', 'java.lang.Long', 'java.lang.Integer', 'java.lang.Short', 'java.lang.Byte', 'java.lang.Double', 'java.lang.Float', 'java.util.Date'. Also, using `java.lang.String` in a Kotlin file doesn't fix the error. #### Steps & Code to Reproduce 1. Setup new project 2. Create realm object 3. Add `var list : RealmList = RealmList()` See the error shown above #### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 4.0.0 Realm sync feature enabled: no Android Studio version: 3.0.0RC1 Which Android version and device: n/a

Issue.Title: RealmFileException: Not a Realm file.
Issue.Description:
<!---
**Questions**: If you have questions about how to use Realm, ask on [StackOverflow]( We monitor the `realm` tag.
**Feature Request**: Just fill in the first two sections below.
**Bugs**: To help you as fast as possible with an issue please describe your issue and the steps you have taken to reproduce it in as many details as possible.
-->
#### Goal
Using realm.
#### Expected Results
No crash.
#### Actual Results
We see some very strange crash on some of our users devices (reported through fabric). We had this crash since ages (minimum since realm 3.1.3), but since we use 3.5.0 upwards the frequency increased drastically.
Closing the app and relaunching does not help - the database is corrupt forever.
We understand this is quite hard to debug with actual way to reproduce. We do not know how to handle a error like this. Deleting the database is a very frustrating experience for our users as they have to sign in again, sync their data, pair with our accessory again ....
How to further track this down or maybe even recover from this?
``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 3.1.3 - 3.7.2
Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 2.3.3
Which Android version and device: Multiple - see above.

Issue.Title: Missing Collection notifications
Issue.Description:
We have huge problems on CI with tests timing out with what looks like notifications being skipped. I was able to somewhat reproduce it locally, but it looks very timing dependant and @beeender has not been able to verify on his machine:
Reproduce 1) Install ROS locally `npm install -g realm-object-server@rc` 2) Disable `startSyncServer/stopSyncServer` in `StandardIntegrationTest` class 3) Run `PermissionManagerTests#getPermissions_updatedWithNewRealms` once from Android Studio to install test app on the device and see that it runs green 4) Goto commandline and run Im running this script: ``
I have narrowed it down to but I have no explanation as to why it is happening:
**Open questions:** * `after_advance` is called twice. It is unclear why. Probably because two `Results` exist, but it doesn't look like I create two. Conclussion: Doesn't look related * When failing, it looks like code inside the callback isn't triggered. Add more logging to verify how far it gets. Conclussion: Done, see * did not catch this

Issue.Title: Retrieve/copy recursive nested objects with fine-grained depth restriction
Issue.Code:
kotlin open class Module : RealmObject() { var data: Data var children: RealmList<Module>? = null }
Where's `data` is also a huge object with it's own dependencies. Obviously I don't want: - to retrieve/copy the entire hierarchy of these `modules` every time I need just one (and it's immediate children) - to break my domain objects apart - and I can't use `realm.copyFromRealm(obj, maxDepth = 10)`, because `maxDepth` is global restriction
I think this particular case isn't solved in any ORM as of today. Which is sad because being able to work with objects with natural and intuitive hierarchies is much easier than with tables...
I feel like `Realm` have an opportunity and huge potential to become trully object-oriented-db by supporting (amongst polymorphism and other helpful stuff) fine-grained depth restrictions kinda like this: kotlin realm.where(Module::class.java) .restrict('children', 'RECURSIVE_DEPTH', maxRecursiveDepth) .equalTo(...) .findAll() --- realm.copyFromRealm( obj, { restrictions -> restrictions .add('children', 'RECURSIVE_DEPTH', maxRecursiveDepth) .add(...) }, ) `
Issue.Description: I would like you to reconsider #4441 I have a data-driven application and the domain is composed with deeply nested objects like this: ``

Issue.Title: java.lang.AbstractMethodError while upgrading from Realm 1.2.0 to 3.7.2
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
> To upgrade from Realm 1.2.0 (legacy code) to 3.7.2
#### Expected Results
> Smooth upgrade of Realm library
#### Actual Results
>
`java.lang.AbstractMethodError: abstract method "java.util.Map io.realm.internal.RealmProxyMediator.getExpectedObjectSchemaInfoMap()" at io.realm.Realm.createExpectedSchemaInfo(Realm.java:179) at io.realm.Realm.<init>(Realm.java:150) at io.realm.Realm.createInstance(Realm.java:417) at io.realm.RealmCache.doCreateRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:348) at io.realm.RealmCache.createRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:281) at io.realm.Realm.getInstance(Realm.java:346) at com.company.Something.app.Something.getRealm(Something.java:380) at com.company.Something.app.HomeActivity.onResume(HomeActivity.java:440) at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnResume(Instrumentation.java:1364) at android.app.Activity.performResume(Activity.java:6847) at android.app.ActivityThread.performResumeActivity(ActivityThread.java:3542) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleResumeActivity(ActivityThread.java:3612) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2854) at android.app.ActivityThread.-wrap12(ActivityThread.java) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1552) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:154) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6334) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:886) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:776)`
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
> The legacy code has 5 tables and I simply upgraded the realm version to a new one. I barely understand the error, so i'm not sure how to begin debugging.
#### Code Sample
`public Realm getRealm() { RealmConfiguration realmConfiguration = new RealmConfiguration.Builder().name(DB_NAME).schemaVersion(2).migration(new RealmMigrations()).build(); Realm.setDefaultConfiguration(realmConfiguration); return Realm.getInstance(realmConfiguration); }`
This is how the code is configured to fetch the Realm instance. The only change i've made here is additional functions for DB name, schema version and a realm migration code (with basically nothing in it for now).
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 1.2.0
Realm sync feature enabled:no
Android Studio version: 2.3.3
Which Android version and device: All devices

Issue.Title: Breaking WishList for 5.0
Issue.Description: This ticket is for general discussion of the breaking changes in a future 5.0 release. Some items have been moved from #4785 Please edit the main post to add a topic with a sequence number, and we can discuss it in the comments. If the breaking change is decided to be worthy to add, then create a separate issue for it.1. Do not allow having both typed Realm instance and Dynamic Realm instance on the same thread. Throw an exception instead. This creates lots of troubles with Realm instance cache management. By disallowing it, the RealmCache implementation can be much simpler and give us an option to totally manage the Realm instance through Object Store.2. Remove the mips so file since there is NO mips device in the market. Perhaps consider having a parameter in the `realm` closure for including `mips/arm` but not have them be part of the standard library. We would need to modify our build system for that.

Issue.Description:
Split from
All our `realm.create*FromJSON()` methods should support arrays of primitives.

Issue.Title: When to provide a custom query structure
Issue.Description: When to provide a custom query structure We need to query to return a custom structure, and even a specific basic data type field

Issue.Title: Crashes when linking with debug version of Sync
Issue.Description:
Moving #5346 to a separate issue, so we can track it.
Observations so far: - Only crash on armeabi-v7a with `objectServerDebug` builds. x86 and 64 bit variants do not crash. - Debug builds with `baseDebug` do not crash. - Release builds for both base and ObjectServer do not crash. This only effect debug builds. - Using `-O0/01/02` instead of `-Og` does not make a difference.
The problematic method is:
``

Issue.Title: Facebook Authentication - INVALID_PARAMETERS(601) "Your request parameters did not validate"
Issue.Description:
<!---
**Questions**: If you have questions about how to use Realm, ask on [StackOverflow]( We monitor the `realm` tag.
**Feature Request**: Just fill in the first two sections below.
**Bugs**: To help you as fast as possible with an issue please describe your issue and the steps you have taken to reproduce it in as many details as possible.
-->
I get an error code even though I have edited the configuration.yml file.
#### Facebook Authentication Provider
>
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 3.5.0
Realm sync feature enabled: yes
Android Studio version: 2.3.3
Which Android version and device: API level 21 version 5 / LG-D855

Issue.Title: Annotations `@Ignore`, `@PrimaryKey`, `@Index` and `@Required` are not retained for RUNTIME
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
> What do you want to achieve?
I'm tinkering with auto-migration based on reflection.
#### Expected Results
I would hope to be able to access the `@Ignore`, `@PrimaryKey`, `@Index` and `@Required` annotations with `field.getAnnotation(annotationClass)`.
#### Actual Results
The annotations are not retained for runtime, only for class.
#### Code Sample
I'm experimenting with this [here]( and I was hoping I wouldn't need to write an annotation processor for it
Of course, this is nothing critical, considering Realm doesn't use it for reflection, only for annotation processing, so `RetentionPolicy.CLASS` makes perfect sense.
So it's like, totally up to you.
Technically I can just define my own annotations otherwise.
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 3.7.2
Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 2.3.3
Which Android version and device: irrelevant

Issue.Title: Duplicate files copied in APK
Realm Global file stop working with Realm 3.7.2
Issue.Description:
Hi there, I was having a global realm file that was shared among users. Users where able to shared content. However, since I updated to 3.7.2, I am not able to share content between users.
This is how user login `SyncUser.loginAsync(SyncCredentials.usernamePassword(eMail, password, true), AUTH_URL, new SyncUser.Callback() {`... where `AUTH_URL = " + BuildConfig.OBJECT_SERVER_IP + ":9080/auth";`
The global file is: `COMMON_REALM_URL = "realm://" + BuildConfig.OBJECT_SERVER_IP + ":9080/" + REALM_NAME;`
and the configuration is: `` There is not trace or error showing that something is going wrong. The problem is that when I query the file, only returns results for the logged user. I am doing something wrong?

Issue.Title: What i need to do if i want move to previous schema version ?
Duplicate objects when id is marked as PrimaryKey.
Issue.Description:
Inserting list of Offers with id property annotated as PrimaryKey still adds duplicate items in realm table. If I use copyToRealm method instead of copyToRealmOrUpdate then I get an exception regarding primary key constraint. I want to use copyToRealmOrUpdate/insertOrUpdate methods but primary key constraint is not being enforced as I see duplicates.
> Describe your current debugging efforts. I set breakpoints inside copyOrUpdate method in OfferRealmProxy.java. There I saw cache which is a Map uses Offer object as key. If the list I am inserting has 5 Offer objects out of which 3 are same with id="3" should not map key be Offer.id to keep items unique in the map? Keeping full object as key does not seem to work. I provided equals and hash methods in Offer class as well. I believe primary key should be the key in that Map
#### Code Sample
`` #### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 3.7.2
Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 2.3.3
Which Android version and device: OS 7.1 on Samsung Galaxy s7 Edge

Issue.Title: ava.lang.IllegalStateException: The Realm is already in a write transaction in /Users/zaki/fromgit/realm/realm-java/realm/realm-library/src/main/cpp/io_realm_internal_SharedRealm.cpp

Issue.Title: LIKE
Issue.Description:
Support for wildcard matches was just merged to master:
We should add support to `RealmQuery` as well when it is released as it seems to be pretty straightforward:
- `*`: [0, n] unicode chars - `?`: single unicode chars
``
Only String fields should be supported.
- [x] Add `RealmQuery.like(String field, String value)` - [x] Add `RealmQuery.like(String field, String value, Case casing)` - [x] Add unit test for ascii chars - [x] Add unit test for non-standard ascii chars, e.g , , - [x] Add unit test for emojii chars

Issue.Title: Primary key
Issue.Description: Primary key is auto increment if possible.

Issue.Title: Support Realm Models from pure Java module?
Issue.Description:
**Context** I have a core module in a large project, its Java only (no Android). The idea is to re-use most logic between Android and iOS by using J2ObjC, etc.
Im facing a quite huge limitation here though, since Realm cannot be used in a pure Java module -- I am forced to define the **actual** model classes in my Android module (and later on, iOS).
To streamline the models, and re-use as much logic as possible; I came up with the solution to use interfaces in the core module -- and just use the "pure model" implementations of those on the Android and iOS side of things.
## CORE (PURE JAVA) ``
## Core + Android + iOS all use the same class.
I would greatly appreciate support for this, and Im certain Im not alone. I hope you can consider it moving forward, and that its possible without too much hassle.
Much love, thanks for the great library!

How do i solve this error? NEED HELP!!

Issue.Title: Disable the default RealmModule generation if no realm model/module
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
Some developpers might want to create a library that will use Realm, but won't declare any model or module in it. The problem is that if we don't declare any of them, the compilation will failed because the generated Mediator will contains no classes and throw a `getMissingProxyClassException(clazz);` The same issue can happens (I think) if we have a Library that declare the model in Realm + a LibModule, and we use only the LibModule in the application, without declaring any more models.
#### Expected Results
A flag in build.gradle or a check that disable the generation of realm class or module for project that use Realm without declaring any of both.

Issue.Title: Migrate UserStore interface + implementations to ObjectStore
Issue.Description:
The ObjectStore has a default implementation for the UserStore. We should use that instead of the `SharedPrefsUserStore`, but at the same time we also still want to support encrypted User Stores.
- [ ] Implement a UserStore that uses the ObjectStores implementation. This might involve refactoring the UserStore interface - [ ] Consider deprecating/removing `SharedPrefsUserStore` - [ ] Figure out the impact on the current SecureUserStore implementation.

Issue.Title: Migrate SyncManager to ObjectStore
Issue.Description: SyncManager class should be migrated to the ObjectStore

Issue.Title: Migrate SyncUser to the ObjectStore
Issue.Description: SyncUser class should use the ObjectStore SyncUser.

Issue.Title: CompactOnLaunch
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
End users need to know the amount of dirty/recoverable space within the realm file to
- Improve scheduling of compaction() call on a realm - Debug run away concurrent read/writes from different threads causing explosion of the realm file due to the duplicate of space used in multi-versioning.
#### Expected Results
ReclaimableSpace() API which tells us in bytes, or approximate bytes if 100% accuracy cannot be achieved, of recoverable space in the realm file that can be trimmed in compaction.

Issue.Title: Realm file overwritten on run
Issue.Description: For some reason today when I ran my app using Android Studio (no instant run) my realm file gets overwritten and all the data is deleted. I checked it out and it isn't missing, or empty, it's just been reset to it's 'initial state'. There is no stacktrace, I'm certain I close all my instances and I don't delete on migrations. It's really starting to slow down development as I have to uninstall the app every time, and then login again. Just closing and restarting the app does not change the database, and no shared preferences get deleted. I'm really sorry I can't be more helpful (and I understand that what you don't just want to be tech support reps) but any help would be greatly appreciated. I can give you access to the repo if that would be of assistance.## Possible relevant bits of code:``Apart from this, Realm works properly. This is what is so infuriatingly annoying! ## To reproduce:1. Run application once to install on device. Login. Data downloads. Normal. Close, open, pause all works.2. Make a small change to the codebase so application will install again3. Application reinstalls, and everything in Realm has gone.## (Hopefully) helpful infoRealm versions: 1.2.0Realm sync feature enabled: noAndroid Studio version: 2.2.2 (no instant run)Android version and device: Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1Target SDK: 25Min SDK: 19

Issue.Title: Sync Integration Tests should also install the Auth Server
Issue.Description: Right now our integration tests: only installs the Object Server. This is fine for testing sync protocol interaction, but some recent features depend on the the Auth Server being installed as well (Permissions). We need to find a way to install both the Object Server and Auth Server for integration tests.

Issue.Title: Enforce TLS if it was used for authentication
Issue.Description: Right now it is possible to e.g login to ROS using ` while using `realm` as the sync protocol.While technical possible to use ` for auth and `realm` for sync, it is counter productive and against security best practises.We should enforce people using `realms` if using ` by throwing an `IllegalArgumentException` if it happens.

Issue.Title: Realm-Transformer crashes if you have a class that ends with `RealmProxy` but isn't an actual proxy generated by Realm
Issue.Description: The transformer attempts to access `superclass` but it is not guaranteed to exist if you yourself create a class that ends with the name `RealmProxy`.

Issue.Title: Credentials.usernamePassword with multiple options
Issue.Description: Pr. internal discussion on API alignment on Sync API's, we need to supply a `createAccountIfNeeded` or `createUser|useExistingAccount` option.``Thoughts @realm/java ?

Issue.Title: SyncUser.all() should return Map
Issue.Description: Pr. internal discussion on Sync API alignment. This method should now return a read only map with the User identifier as the key.The User identifier is currently used in the Object Store, but no the Java layer.``

Issue.Title: User.currentUser() should throw if multiple users are logged in.
Issue.Description: Pr. internal discussion on Sync API alignment. We decided to let this method throw if multiple users are logged in to avoid confusion.``

Issue.Title: Investigate how Google Play backup/store works
Issue.Description: While adding a section about `writeCopyTo` for the docs I started thinking about Google Play Services Backup/Restore. We should investigate how it actually works in detail. If it takes a backup of an open file or restore it overriding an existing file, it might explain some of the weird Illegal File errors we are seeing from time to time.Also having it documened how it actually works also be beneficial.

Issue.Title: Java examples don't compile due to version.txt mismatch
Issue.Description: The realm-examples gradle script references the root version.txt, which currently contains `2.2.0-SNAPSHOT`. It sets `classpath "io.realm:realm-gradle-plugin:${currentVersion}"`. jcenter does not have any such version of the plugin. This results in the error:``To compile, one must explicitly specify the 2.0.2 version of the plugin.

Issue.Title: [WARNING!] Obfuscation is not working with 2.1.0
Issue.Description: **Beware, don't release to Google Play with Realm 2.1.0** if you want your code to be obfuscated. Realm 2.1.0 won't allow any of your class names to be obfuscated, even on classes that are not RealmObjects.I'm using custom dictionaries for it, but it probably does not matter. I tested this multiple times and my code with 2.0.2 is always correctly obfuscated, code with 2.1.0 is not obfuscated at all. Luckily this happened to me once with another library and I'm checking the resulting apk with an apktool before releasing.

Issue.Title: Hi I am geeting this error java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{com.example.abl.myrealmapplication/com.example.abl.myrealmapplication.activity.MainActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException: No default RealmConfiguration was found. Call setDefaultConfiguration() first
Issue.Description: public class RealmController { private static RealmController instance; private final Realm realm; public RealmController(Application application) { realm = Realm.getDefaultInstance(); } public static RealmController with(Fragment fragment){ if(instance==null){ instance=new RealmController(fragment.getActivity().getApplication()); } return instance; } public static RealmController with(Activity activity){ if(instance==null){ instance=new RealmController(activity.getApplication()); } return instance; } public static RealmController with(Application application){ if(instance==null){ instance=new RealmController(application); } return instance; } public static RealmController getInstance(){ return instance; } public Realm getRealm(){ return realm; } public void refresh(){ realm.refresh(); } public void clearAll(){ realm.beginTransaction(); realm.clear(Book.class); realm.commitTransaction(); } public RealmResults<Book> getBook(){ return realm.where(Book.class).findAll(); } public Book getBook(String id){ return realm.where(Book.class).equalTo("id",id).findFirst(); } public boolean hasBook(){ return !realm.allObjects(Book.class).isEmpty(); } public RealmResults<Book>queryedBooks(){ return realm.where(Book.class).contains("author","Author 0").or().contains("title","Realm").findAll(); } }

Issue.Title: Requirements elicitation
Issue.Description: Good morning,We have already submited an issue with id #3613 about realm software processes, and now we would want to know how the team deals with requirements elicitation. So, regarding this:- How does the team decides on whether to implement a new feature?- Does someone is responsible to decide which functionality will be implemented?- What is the process to analyse and accept a pull request or an issue? - There are a Software Requirements Specification (SRS) document? We would be very pleased and thankfull if you could answer this questions.Thanks in advance.

Issue.Title: RealmObject with Retrofit 2
Issue.Description: Hi,I have one problem and I don't know how to fix this.I have got realmObject's that I need send to my server via Retrofit.If I send data to server all fields are null because RealmObject use RealmProxy.Is any way to get RealmObject fileds with data instead RealmProxy?

Issue.Title: APK is 1.5MB bigger on 2.0.2 than on 1.2.0
Issue.Description: #### GoalUsing the newest version of Realm without adding 1.5 MB to APK size. I'm comparing release builds with proguard enabled.#### Expected ResultsAn APK that is not 1.5 MB bigger#### Actual ResultsAn APK that is 1.5 MB bigger#### Steps & Code to ReproduceUpdate from Realm 1.2.0 to 2.0.2#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 2.0.2Realm sync feature enabled: noAndroid Studio version: 2.2.2Relates to #3506

Issue.Title: copyOrUpdate() throws Illegal Argument: This field is not nullable (String)
Issue.Description: #### GoalWe're using Realm in a library project. For synchronization, we're using a SyncAdapter. In the synchronization process, we update a list of Trips. The name of the start address may be `null` locally or it should be updated with `null`.#### Expected ResultsThe `String` field `start_address_name` is updated accordingly.#### Actual ResultsThe crash is pretty rare. We got 6 crashes in the last week with a few hundred synchronizations a day.The crash occurs only after we put everthing in a remote process.Stack Trace:``#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): `2.0.2`Realm sync feature enabled: noAndroid Studio version: `2.2.2`Which Android version and device: `6.0`, `6.0.1` (Samsung, Sony, Huawei)

Issue.Title: equalTo(String, boolean) -> Illegal Argument: ColumnType invalid
Issue.Description: #### GoalWe're using Realm in a library project. For synchronization, we're using a SyncAdapter. In the synchronization process, we got a simple query with a `equalTo(String, boolean)` selection to get all Persons whose flag `modified_offline` is true.#### Expected ResultsGetting every person which is marked as modified offline.#### Actual ResultsIn some rare cases, it crashes and throws an `IllegalArgumentException: Illegal Argument: ColumnType invalid`. We got 4 crashes in the last week with a few hundred synchronizations a day. The code is executed in every synchronization.Stack Trace:``#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version: `2.0.2`Android Studio version: `2.2.2`Which Android version and device: `6.0.1` (Samsung, Sony)

Issue.Title: Rx off thread loading memory leak
Issue.Description: Hello guys, I will be very grateful for any help in understanding this issue.I really enjoy the way I can async subscribe to data changes with Rx, but I have next situation - I need to convert RealmObjects to another objects from my project. Because the count of objects is huge, I want to do this conversion in off thread also and subscribe to all this stuff from Main thread.So I am trying to do something like this:``Here I am trying to subscribe to RealmResults from my own `HandlerThread` with looper, so that way I can manipulate with RealmObjects in off thread. I subscribe, unsubscribe, create and close Realm instance in this thread, `.doOnUnsubscribe` method fired.The code behaves exactly as I want, except all RealmResults are leaking.Full example project is here Realm version: 2.0.2
