Issue.Description: I have an app that never sleeps, with the screen always on. When I leave it on overnight I find it unresponsive in the morning, and when touching the screen it is eventually killed with an ANR. The only thing in traces.txt that points to my app also points to Realm, though I'm by know means certain that this is a Realm issue. #### Expected ResultsApp is responsive.#### Actual ResultsApp is unresponsive, and is eventually killed with ANR being the cause.In traces.txt I see this:``#### Steps & Code to ReproduceExact steps unknown. I've left the app open during the night, and find it unresponsive in the morning. Line 59 in StationAvailabilityRealmProxy.java is `this.proxyState = new ProxyState(no.urbaninfrastructure.bysykkel.supervisor.domain.StationAvailability.class, this);`#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version: 2.0.2Android Studio version: 2.2Which Android version and device: 5.1.1, Lenovo Yoga Tab 2 (YT3-X50L)

Issue.Title: RealmList attribute is not persisted correctly.
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
I'm retrieving a list of objects from server using Retrofit (version 2.1.0). My model consist of a Client that extends of RealmObject and has a primaryKey and a RealmList of Dpto.
When Retrofit give me the results the Client instances have all attributed filled, included the RealmList so I want to persist these results using Realm and I execute a realm transaction where I call:
realm.copyToRealmOrUpdate(clientList)
#### Expected Results
Save the Client list and its related Dptos.
#### Actual Results
Only are persisted the Client instances but its related Dptos aren't persisted. I deduce that is not the correct behaviour of RealmList attributes.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
-Retrieve results from Retrofit. -Execute Realm transaction block -Call to realm.copyToRealmOrUpdate(clientList)
#### Code Sample
``

Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 2.2.3

Issue.Title: findAllAsync() sometimes fails to return any results when using it in sync mode
Issue.Description:
Sometimes `findAllAsync()` does not call the change listener.
I created a sample project that demonstrates the issue. Actually, I just copied the _RealmTasks_ example, removed the Facebook SDK and then replaced `findAll()` with `findAllAsync()`. You can find it here:
This project lets you reproduce the issue consistently. To reproduce it I follow these steps: 1. Make sure Realm Object Server is running and connected 2. Register a new user in the app 3. Navigate back to get to the TaskListActivity 5. Observe that there is **no task list** 6. Rotating the phone or restarting the app will bring back the list called _My Task_
Also, deleting, adding, or editing list items can make task lists disappear.

``
I do point to `maven { url ' }` in my Gradle configuration.

I am very interested in getting Realm 2.2.2 and above because of the removal of final modifier on most classes which would allow using Mockito as I've tried writing UTs with Robolectric and PowerMock and it was a horrible and fragile thing.

Issue.Title: Crash at Realm.getDefaultInstance()
Issue.Description:
I'm using Realm in one of my projects. It works great on almost all the phones I tested except for **Samsung GT-I8200 (Android 4.2.2).**
The app crashes when requesting the default realm instance. Please note that I haven't encountered this crash on any other phones. My concern is that the same crash may exist on many other android devices that we haven't tested.
I'm using realm 2.2.1. I also tested this use case against realm 2.0.2. The same issue exist on both versions. Further, I ran a couple of Realm sample apps (introExample and gridViewExample) on the same device. Both apps crash at the same line (Realm.getDefaultInstance()).
While debugging, I found out that actual crash happens inside SharedRealm.java file - line 236 - nativeSetVersion(nativePtr, schemaVersion).
Can you please any solution for this?
Thanks, Iranga

Issue.Title: Issue in CreateAllFromJson
Realm query sometimes returning no data
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
> Query and load a list of objects in a RecyclerView.
#### Expected Results
> The database is already populated with data, so the expected result is the list with several objects in it when opening the Activity.
#### Actual Results
> We get no exceptions, what happens is that most of the times the query returns the list with the objects in it, but sometimes the query returns an empty list. We are not performing any write operation at that time, the data was saved in the database long time ago. When this strange error happens and the list is show as empty, going back to the previous activity and re opening the one of the list fixes the problem. We are wondering if the AsyncTask could have something to do with this.
Another important thing is that on my debugging I was able to log some data and noticed that when the error happens performing a count returns 0 instead of 1 for example. But when going back and opening the list again will return count 1 as expected.
This does not happen frequently, I mean I can for example open the list 20 times successfully and the 21 attempt loads and empty list.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
> What we do is simple, open a new Activity that should query the Realm database and populate a RecyclerView with data. The query is done by an Interactor class that is used by the Presenter (we are using an MVP structure), which task is only load the list of objects in background using an Android AsyncTask, as follows:
``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 2.2.0
Realm sync feature enabled: yes/no
Android Studio version: 2.2.2
Which Android version and device: Android 6, Galaxy S6 and others.

Issue.Title: When using Realm with RxJava's Schedulers.io(), the Realm instance is not updated
Issue.Description:
#### Goal Make calls to Realm from within a RxJava observable on the io scheduler thread
#### Expected Results Calling `Realm.getDefaultInstance();` and using said Realm instance should have the latest copy of data and operate properly.
#### Actual Results A old(?) copy of the Realm database is fetched (presumably the one created by the first use of the Scheduler IO thread) that is not up to date with more recent changes in the database.
*NOTE* Using `Schedulers.newThread()` over `Schedulers.io()` fixes the problem, presumably because this is a new thread and has a brand new instance of realm.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce 1. Make some change to the realm database on the UI thread 2. Try to access the changed data from a Observable subscribing on `Schedulers.io()`.
#### Code Sample Sample from the Gallery project I found this bug in. This observable is responsable for deleting entries from the database that are marked with a boolean. `` The realm instance provided should have the latest changes (changing the booleans of the items flagged for deletion to `true`) but this is not what happens.
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 2.2.0
Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 2.2.3
Which Android version and device: HTC10 - N & any emulator version

Issue.Title: Illegal Argument: Failure when converting to UTF-8; error_code = 5;
OOM crash with Realm 1.2.0
Issue.Description:
Hi!
I'm facing OOM crash issue with Realm. My app creates 3-4 instances (one per thread) of Realm during execution. Maybe each created instance ignoring its further close() and stays in RAM and thats why it ends up trying to allocate more than 50 megs of RAM. My whole DB is about 3 Mb (default.realm is 3.75Mb) how comes it want 50 if I'm not using all the data/tables simultaneously? Does every instance allocates RAM for whole DB (16mb in my case) while creates its own heap?
#### Goal
Use Realm from different threads simultaneously
#### Expected Results
No OOM
#### Actual Results
Fatal Exception: io.realm.exceptions.RealmError: Unrecoverable error. mmap() failed: Out of memory size: 50331648 offset: 0 in io_realm_internal_SharedGroup.cpp line 113 at io.realm.internal.SharedGroup.createNativeWithImplicitTransactions(SharedGroup.java) at io.realm.internal.SharedGroup.<init>(SharedGroup.java:64) at io.realm.internal.SharedGroupManager.<init>(SharedGroupManager.java:49) at io.realm.BaseRealm.<init>(BaseRealm.java:77) at io.realm.Realm.<init>(Realm.java:138) at io.realm.Realm.createAndValidate(Realm.java:269) at io.realm.Realm.createInstance(Realm.java:249) at io.realm.RealmCache.createRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:114) at io.realm.Realm.getInstance(Realm.java:213)

Issue.Title: Odd Issue - Data Disappearing
Issue.Description:
I've got a really strange issue.
This is using realm 2.2.1, Android Studio 2.2.3, android gradle plugin 2.2.3, build tools 25.0.1, compileSdkVersion 25
First, my realm configuration is a little unique. I don't initialize the realm until a user logs into the application, and then when I do initialize it, it has a file name unique to the username. It's also encrypted. This setup is performed from an IntentService, that has had it's process priority lowered.
``
This works just fine, or at least it seems to. In my activities, after this has run, Realm.getDefaultInstance() works just fine. I'm not creating any processes.
The problem is, after calling this service, and after waiting for this to complete, I launch an activity that gets the realm instance, which works. It does a realm.where(Profile.class).findAll(). The resulting RealmResults<Profile> comes back as empty, even though I've verified what was sent to realm in the transaction was valid and good, and no crashes or exceptions.
However, if I kick off another IntentService from the activity that gets the profile in the background, and stores it in the realm, and I register a change listener in the activity, *that* profile seems to stick around. But the one pulled in immediately after logging in and setting up the realm in the IntentService just... disappears. Any data gathered and committed to the realm immediately after logging and initializing the realm appears to disappear (I make 3 post-login rest calls, from the IntentService, and save them in realm - they appear to disappear as well).
And somehow this didn't used to be the case - but the code has undergone a major restructuring, and this wasn't caught until the last minute - so I don't know when it occurred, and trying to walk it back would be exceptionally painful.
It seems like the transaction is getting committed, but then rolled back silently?

#### Actual Results
I have seen it crash in an IntentService:
> FATAL EXCEPTION: IntentService[UpdateTestsService] Process: com.company.project, PID: 18026 io.realm.exceptions.RealmError: Unrecoverable error. mmap() failed: Out of memory in io_realm_internal_SharedGroup.cpp line 113 at io.realm.internal.SharedGroup.createNativeWithImplicitTransactions(Native Method) at io.realm.internal.SharedGroup.<init>(SharedGroup.java:67) at io.realm.internal.SharedGroupManager.<init>(SharedGroupManager.java:47) at io.realm.BaseRealm.<init>(BaseRealm.java:76) at io.realm.Realm.<init>(Realm.java:126) at io.realm.Realm.createAndValidate(Realm.java:246) at io.realm.Realm.createInstance(Realm.java:231) at io.realm.RealmCache.createRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:114) at io.realm.Realm.getDefaultInstance(Realm.java:181) at com.company.project.services.background.AbstractIntentService.beforeHandleIntent(AbstractIntentService.java:34) at com.company.project.services.background.AbstractIntentService.onHandleIntent(AbstractIntentService.java:28) at android.app.IntentService$ServiceHandler.handleMessage(IntentService.java:66) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:148) at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:61)
I have also seen it crash in the main thread. This stacktrace happened after I relaunched the app after a crash: > E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL EXCEPTION: main Process: com.company.project, PID: 19226 io.realm.exceptions.RealmError: Unrecoverable error. mmap() failed: Out of memory size: 1006632960 offset: 0 in /Users/cm/Realm/realm-java/realm/realm-library/src/main/cpp/io_realm_internal_SharedRealm.cpp line 92 at io.realm.internal.SharedRealm.nativeGetSharedRealm(Native Method) at io.realm.internal.SharedRealm.getInstance(SharedRealm.java:205) at io.realm.internal.SharedRealm.getInstance(SharedRealm.java:182) at io.realm.RealmCache.createRealmOrGetFromCache(RealmCache.java:124) at io.realm.Realm.getDefaultInstance(Realm.java:209) at com.company.project.App.onCreate(App.java:64) at com.android.tools.fd.runtime.BootstrapApplication.onCreate(BootstrapApplication.java:370) at android.app.Instrumentation.callApplicationOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1024) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleBindApplication(ActivityThread.java:5361) at android.app.ActivityThread.-wrap2(ActivityThread.java) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1528) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:154) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:6077) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:865) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:755)
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
> I have read the following tickets and SO questions: 1) Memory Leak with long lived Realm Objects: 2) Out of memory , sharedgroup error or Unrecoverable error: 3) Out of memory in io_realm_internal_SharedGroup.cpp: 4) Out of memory in io_realm_internal_SharedGroup.cpp: 5) Proper Realm usage patterns/best practices?: 6) Unrecoverable error. mremap(): failed: Out of memory in io_realm_internal_SharedGroup.cpp line 188: 7) io.realm.exceptions.RealmError: Unrecoverable error. mmap() failed: Out of memory in io_realm_internal_SharedGroup.cpp line 115: 8) Realm android application crash: io.realm.exceptions.RealmError: Unrecoverable error. mmap() failed: Out of memory size: 9) Out of memory in io_realm_internal_: 10) Android Realm: Out of memory:
>I feel as though I am properly opening and closing all realm connections, but I am still reaching this error. The device I am testing on has over 2gb of free space still available after the exception is thrown.
#### Code Sample
>All activities open and close realm in onCreate/onDestroy.
``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 2.2.1
Realm sync feature enabled: yes/no - unsure what this means
Android Studio version: 2.2.2
Which Android version and device: Nexus 9 running Android 7.0 (SDK 24).

Issue.Title: insert does not insert all the data, but insertOrUpdate does
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
When an API search is performed only a small portion of the data is returned per model. This data is inserted into a *programs* table via the `.insert()` method to prevent overwriting an existing complete models.
The program model contains simple string/int properties as well as an array of `tags` of a `StringValue` type (the hack to store an array of strings). The `tags` are inserted correctly when using the `.insertOrUpdate` method, but are *not* inserted when using the `.insert()` method.
#### Expected Results
StringValue array should be inserted into the db when calling the realm `.insert()` method.
#### Actual Results
`.insertOrUpdate()` inserts the array of StringValues, but `.insert()` does not
#### Code Sample
``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 2.2.1
Realm sync feature enabled: not sure Android Studio version: 2.2.3
Which Android version and device: 4.2.1, nexus 4

Issue.Title: Sort by locale (, , , etc.)
Issue.Description: Guys, I think sorting by locale in Java should already be here. Is there any workaround for that? It's really frustrating, because I have whole app based on Realm and now I can't properly sort it. Now it's ("a", "b", "c","d", "", "") when it should be ("a","","b","c","","d").

Issue.Title: Stable iterators for RealmCollection
Issue.Description:
### Problem
This has been discussed before
(Internal wiki page)
So #2124 was introduced to solve below problem:
``
* **+** Solves problem 1, 2, 3 * **+** Overhead is very small for `RealmResults` since the `Results::snapshot` is using move constructor to build the `TableView`. * **+** We could have the same behavior for `RealmResults` and `RealmList`, and they are live always. * **+** It is still possible to make `RealmResults`/`RealmList`'s `foreach` iterator stable. But the simple loop won't be stable anymore. * **-** break API change. * **-** Will it be difficult to understand by users?

Issue.Title: Realm 1.2.0 finalizer crash
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
Don't crash the jvm finalizer thread after corrupted realm open() call.
#### Actual Results
Crash.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
1) Create any corrupted realm file 2) Use ShareGroup line 71 constructor
``
Unlike the single param constructor, this one sets context AFTER native call which can fail with exception due to realm corruption. However, even after exception, the SharedGroup object is already created within jvm, now with null context and crashes finalizer since it is used a monitor/synchronized lock.
This only applies to the 1.2.0 branch but since 2.X is not really stable yet (compatibility wise), I think it would be prudent to backport the fix it for the 1.2 branch users out there since the impact is quite severe as there is absolutely no way to recover. Normally, if a realm db is corrupted, the app can recover by copying in a backup, or delete it out right. With this bug, it is impossible to recover.
Fix is moving the context creation to first line like the first constructor in the class or add null protect to finalizer() block.

Issue.Title: Model/Collection level encryption support
Issue.Description:
Would it be possible to support model/document level encryption? i.e encrypting only few models instead of whole db/instance. For a specific use case, for the app in development, I have encountered a need to encrypt not the whole instance but only few models.
I thought of using multiple realm instances (one with encryption enabled and other without), but I found transaction handling between instance when I move items around is bit of a challenge.
Only other option I have is to handle encryption outside of Realm, but that is causing to leak metadata info.

Issue.Title: Remove final modifers from public classes
Issue.Description:
So the question of testability and Mockito keeps coming up in support. Mockito still doesn't support final classes and PowerMock seems to cause problems for people.
Would anyone have big objections if I removed the `final` modifier from our public classes? It would be less pure, but more pragmatic.
Thoughts @realm/java ?
Affected classes:
- Realm - RealmResults - RealmQuery - RealmList - RealmConfiguration - RealmSchema - RealmObjectSchema - DynamicRealm - DynamicRealmObject
- SyncConfiguration - SyncManager - SyncSession - SyncUser - SyncCredentials

Issue.Title: Logout does not remove current user from UserStore
Issue.Description:
Steps to reproduce: 0. Make sure a user is logged in 1. Call `SyncUser.currentUser().logout()` 2. Kill the app manually 3. Restart the app 4. `SyncUser.currentUser()` still returns the user that should have been logged out
This looks like it could be the reason: `SyncUser.logout()` tries to remove the current user from the `UserStore` like this: `` However, at that point `SyncUser.currentUser()` returns `null` because the user's token has already been removed in the line before and thus `isValid()` will return `false`. Therefore, `remove(UserStore.CURRENT_USER_KEY)` is not executed.

Issue.Title: Feature: expose a client identifier on SyncSession
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
[As described here]( my synchronized objects need to have a relationship to the specific client that is working on them. I see no property anywhere in Realm that uniquely identifies a client.
SyncUser can be logged concurrently from multiple clients.
SyncSession.hashCode() might work, but INT32 is too small a hash-space for comfort, and besides, it is non-persistent. On Android, I would expect it to change after the Activity is destroyed (for example) by device rotation.
#### Expected Results
SyncSession (or perhaps SyncConfiguration) exposes a primitive identifier that consistently, uniquely, and persistently identifies the client.

Issue.Title: Overriding hashCode() has effect on copyToRealmOrUpdate(Iterable<E> objects)
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
> What do you want to achieve?
Store a list of Asset objects that have a custom implementation for `equals()` and `hashCode()` in Realm, using `Realm.copyToRealmOrUpdate(Iterable<E> objects)`.
#### Expected Results
I expected all Asset objects to be stored, regardless of the return value for `equals()` and `hashCode()`. The [documentation]( for this says that I can provide a custom implementation for `equals()`, but it does not mention `hashCode()`. [My source]( however says that if you override `equals()` you should also override `hashCode()`, which is why I did.
#### Actual Results
Assets that are evaluated to be equal to a previously processed Asset (through calling `hashCode()`) are not stored in Realm.
#### Steps & Code to Reproduce
> Describe your current debugging efforts.
I have a `List<Asset> assets` with 138 self-created Asset objects. 17 of these have the same mac address (`""`). Only the first one is stored in Realm, the rest seems ignored without a warning log message.
#### Code Sample
``
It stores only the first, because all that follow are evaluated to be equal.
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version: 1.2.0
Realm sync feature enabled: no
Android Studio version: 2.3 Canary 1
Which Android version and device: 6.0.1, OnePlus One

Issue.Title: Delete RealmObject
Lags on long operations on One Plus 3 (OxygenOs) Android device, give ANR.
Issue.Description:
Hello, Firstly, i really like the Realm, and its working great for me on mostly all android devices but i'm getting major lag issues on One Plus 3(OxygenOs, Android version 6.0), its a wide known android mobile device and our app have more than 6 percent users on this device. below is the description:-
> What do you want to achieve?
I have very big JSON which i'm parsing on background thread and saving the data in multiple tables in Realm in the same background thread, Basically i have a pagination Api call which give me result in pair of 20 rows set and my scenario is i hit the Api by using retrofit 2 then parse the data by Gson and then save the data in realm. And this process is going on till the app fetches all the data from server, and i'm hitting the API one by one which means first i hit data with page number one then parse the JSON and then save it into realm and then after successful save Realm operation, i again hit the data API. the whole scenerio is working fine on One Plus 3 if there is very data entries like 20 or 30 but if i have 150 to 1000 row entries then it lags very heavily because in this case, there are more number of API calls and then it lags, i tested it very deeply if there is same issues with my network calls but it works fine if i removed the Realm.
> Actual Results?
This is working fine on all devices but only on OxygenOs devices majorly on One Plus 3 its lags very heavily and give ANR every time, even for small Realm Table operations like update , delete or add any entry in table, my code is working fine on every devices. but only on this devices it lags. Here is the device link if you want to check:-
> Describe your current debugging efforts.
->I debug it with various method by firstly checking the debugger and monitor of Android studio 2.2, -> then i tried with checking some third party library like Pury, which provides execution time of every method and it gives long execution time on table operations methods. -> then finally, i tried with native sqlite by replacing realm, with the same table structure and operations and then its working fine on OxygenOs and mainly on One Plus 3.
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): I'm using the latest version of realm as per on doc in today's date.
Realm sync feature enabled: yes
Android Studio version: 2.2
Which Android version and device: Android version 6.0, OxygenOs and device is One Plus 3,

Issue.Title: Sync integration tests must include authentication server
Issue.Description:
Our Sync integration tests currently only install the sync server:
This is a problem in those situations where we also want to test integration with the authentication server e.g. Permission changes are handled by the auth server.
We need to be able to setup a fully functional ROS installation (sync/auth) and be able to reset it using our http test bridge:
- [ ] Extend Docker file so it installs both sync + auth:
- [ ] Extend http bridge so it also resets the auth server: . It might require setting up some admin user programmatically. I'm not sure if/how this is possible.

Issue.Title: Async reads and writes should not use same thread pool
Issue.Description:
**Use case:** Reported by a user: Starting an app that runs a large number of synchronization jobs on startup (20+). Goal is to have something to show in the UI as fast as possible using async queries, but currently there can be a large delay before data is available.
**Problem:** We only have one Realm thread pool for both async reads and writes. As Realm write transactions are blocking across threads, If more write jobs than available processors exists the thread pool will effectively be serialized and act as a single-threaded pool as Realm Core will block all parallel write jobs running. In the worst case where writes are scheduleded before queries, the queries could be blocked for a long time.
**Solution:** Split the current thread pool into two: 1 for reads and 1 for writes. The one for writes just needs to be a single-threaded pool as multiple threads doesn't make sense. This would mean that async queries always have a chance to run.

Issue.Title: Doc: IntentService should also close Realm in finally block
Issue.Description:
Currently the doc doesn't always enforce the `try { ... } finally { ... }` pattern for brevity.
It should either be in `try - finally`, or just use try-with-resources (`try(Realm realm = Realm.getDefaultInstance) { ... }`).

Issue.Title: Software architecture
Issue.Description:
Hi, my colleagues and i have already asked questions about various organizational aspects of Realm, such as [software processes]( and [elicitation requirements](
Now we want to know: what are the **architectural patterns** followed by Realm?
An architectural pattern that obviously seems to exist is Client-Server Architecture pattern, but we wanted to know if you are using other architectural patterns.
Thanks in advance.

Issue.Title: AVL reports virus for all applications using Realm.io
Issue.Description:
Hello guys,
I want to start with saying that it is NOT your fault and that I know it is a false positive by dumb antivirus software. But I think you should know that and maybe you can even try to figure out why it's happening.
All applications that are using Realm.io library version 2.1.1 and higher are marked as "Trojan/FakeKernel" malicious virus by AVL antivirus software (
I received several reports from my users and starting to get down-rates on Google Play because of this - so I investigated and I figured out that it's because of Relam.io.
Version 2.1.0 is considered safe and clean by AVL and since version 2.1.1, all applications that contains Relm.io are marked as a malicious extremely dangerous virus in AVL.
Any idea what has changed between 2.1.0 and 2.1.1 what can cause this? Any way to fix it? Since I doubt AVL will listen to you.
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 2.1.1
Android Studio version: 2.2
Which Android version and device: ALL

I need to update my app using sync over `Object Server`.. But after set `SyncConfiguration` as `defaultConfiguration`, when I call `Realm.getDefaultInstance()` realm throws this error: ``

Issue.Title: Realm 2.x crashes on native layer executing Realm.compact() method
Issue.Description:
Hi!
Realm.compact() crashes on some devices. In my case such device is Samsung SM-T110 android tablet with AOS 4.2.2 (API 17). It works OK (at least crashless) on any other device I have.
#### Goal
To run Realm.compact()
#### Expected Results
Method compact() works fine as intended
#### Actual Results
Crash on a native layer ``
#### Version of Realm and tooling Realm version(s): 2.0.2-SNAPSHOT, 2.1.1
Realm sync feature enabled: no, but not sure.
Android Studio version: 2.2.2
Which Android version and device: Samsung SM-T110 tablet with AOS 4.2.2 (API 17)

Issue.Title: RealmChangeListener stops receiving updates
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
> RealmChangeListener stops receiving updates to objects added from another thread/realm instance.
#### Expected Results
> RealmChangeListener should continue to receive updates as new objects are added.
#### Actual Results
> RealmChangeListener stops receiving updates after a period of time/multiple calls. In the demo project below the listener stops receiving updates fairly quickly when objects are added on a separate thread, but takes a little longer (still less than 1min) when added on the same thread.

Issue.Title: Support Realm Models from pure Java module?
Issue.Description:
**Context** I have a core module in a large project, its Java only (no Android). The idea is to re-use most logic between Android and iOS by using J2ObjC, etc.
Im facing a quite huge limitation here though, since Realm cannot be used in a pure Java module -- I am forced to define the **actual** model classes in my Android module (and later on, iOS).
To streamline the models, and re-use as much logic as possible; I came up with the solution to use interfaces in the core module -- and just use the "pure model" implementations of those on the Android and iOS side of things.
## CORE (PURE JAVA) ``
## Core + Android + iOS all use the same class.
I would greatly appreciate support for this, and Im certain Im not alone. I hope you can consider it moving forward, and that its possible without too much hassle.
Much love, thanks for the great library!

Issue.Title: Disable the default RealmModule generation if no realm model/module
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
Some developpers might want to create a library that will use Realm, but won't declare any model or module in it. The problem is that if we don't declare any of them, the compilation will failed because the generated Mediator will contains no classes and throw a `getMissingProxyClassException(clazz);` The same issue can happens (I think) if we have a Library that declare the model in Realm + a LibModule, and we use only the LibModule in the application, without declaring any more models.
#### Expected Results
A flag in build.gradle or a check that disable the generation of realm class or module for project that use Realm without declaring any of both.

Issue.Title: Migrate UserStore interface + implementations to ObjectStore
Issue.Description:
The ObjectStore has a default implementation for the UserStore. We should use that instead of the `SharedPrefsUserStore`, but at the same time we also still want to support encrypted User Stores.
- [ ] Implement a UserStore that uses the ObjectStores implementation. This might involve refactoring the UserStore interface - [ ] Consider deprecating/removing `SharedPrefsUserStore` - [ ] Figure out the impact on the current SecureUserStore implementation.

Issue.Title: CompactOnLaunch
Issue.Description:
#### Goal
End users need to know the amount of dirty/recoverable space within the realm file to
- Improve scheduling of compaction() call on a realm - Debug run away concurrent read/writes from different threads causing explosion of the realm file due to the duplicate of space used in multi-versioning.
#### Expected Results
ReclaimableSpace() API which tells us in bytes, or approximate bytes if 100% accuracy cannot be achieved, of recoverable space in the realm file that can be trimmed in compaction.

PullRequest.Title: Implement getInstanceAsync
PullRequest.Description:
Fix #2299 - Add APIs to get Realm instance asynchronously. - Remove some useless methods.
There are some work need to be done before create the first Realm instance in the process, like creating schema table, doing migration, etc.. Those could block the UI thread quite badly. This commit tries to do those initialization work in the background and hold a Realm instance in the background until the 2nd instance created in the caller thread.
A better solution than this would be do initialization in the background and only deliver a column indices cache to caller thread without holding a Realm instance in the background. But that is not possible since from the current database design, we cannot know if the schema changes compared with the last time it was opened.
Also create a SharedGroup in the background and handover it to the caller thread is not ideal as well. That not only requires some design changes in the Object Store RealmCoordinator, but also is a very special use case of SharedGroup which core is not designed for. SharedGroup Leaking during the handover is another flaw for this solution -- we can only rely on the GC to collect the leaked SharedGroup during handover then.
- [x] Check and fix javadoc for `Realm.Callback` `DynamicRealm.Callback`.

Issue.Title: Realm file overwritten on run
Issue.Description: For some reason today when I ran my app using Android Studio (no instant run) my realm file gets overwritten and all the data is deleted. I checked it out and it isn't missing, or empty, it's just been reset to it's 'initial state'. There is no stacktrace, I'm certain I close all my instances and I don't delete on migrations. It's really starting to slow down development as I have to uninstall the app every time, and then login again. Just closing and restarting the app does not change the database, and no shared preferences get deleted. I'm really sorry I can't be more helpful (and I understand that what you don't just want to be tech support reps) but any help would be greatly appreciated. I can give you access to the repo if that would be of assistance.## Possible relevant bits of code:``Apart from this, Realm works properly. This is what is so infuriatingly annoying! ## To reproduce:1. Run application once to install on device. Login. Data downloads. Normal. Close, open, pause all works.2. Make a small change to the codebase so application will install again3. Application reinstalls, and everything in Realm has gone.## (Hopefully) helpful infoRealm versions: 1.2.0Realm sync feature enabled: noAndroid Studio version: 2.2.2 (no instant run)Android version and device: Nexus 6P, Android 7.1.1Target SDK: 25Min SDK: 19

Issue.Description: Realm version(s): 2.0.2Realm sync feature enabled: noAndroid Studio version: 2.2.2Which Android version and device: OnePlus One A0001 Android 5.1.1I am writing a Android Library which contains all the dependencies, so I use local jarsThen, I manually add `android-apt` plugin to simply use `io.realm:realm-transformer`In the library scope `build.gradle` , I use `realm-android-library` and `realm-annotations` jars``

Issue.Title: Trying to delete Realm but somehow an instance of realm is open
Issue.Description: It is only happening in like 1 percent of the production devices.I have an old pre-shipped realm file which I want to replace with the new version of the realm file after copying user data from the old file.``This is on the splash screen and the first time when I am opening the realm instance but when I am deleting the realm file there is an illegalStateException that the realm file is still open.Is there a way to release all instances from realm cache?

Issue.Title: Mediator not generated
Issue.Description: I tried to follow kotlin-example but I can't get it to work.If I use `Realm.getDefaultInstance`, it tell me the object is not part of schema.If I set module manually, I get `ClassNotFoundException` on `Mediator`.I did check issues both here and SO but I can't seem to fix it. I updated everything to the latest version including `kotlin_version = '1.0.4'` and `realm_version = '2.1.1'`. I also tried the `kotlin.incremental=false` trick but problem still persist.The model class extends `RealmObject`, I even added `@RealmClass` in afterward when all else fail but still not working.Here's my repo: I'm running this on `Galaxy Tab A` with `Android 5.0.2`.

Issue.Title: Sync Integration Tests should also install the Auth Server
Issue.Description: Right now our integration tests: only installs the Object Server. This is fine for testing sync protocol interaction, but some recent features depend on the the Auth Server being installed as well (Permissions). We need to find a way to install both the Object Server and Auth Server for integration tests.

Issue.Title: Realm mode class can not extends
Issue.Description: I have a Class Name `User` extends from `RealmObject`, then I have a class name `CurrentUser` extends User,But there happen error when compile with info `Error:(9, 8) Realm model classes must either extend RealmObject or implement RealmModel to be considered a valid model class`.how can I save this two class data into DB by do not copy the parent Class filed into subClass

Issue.Title: Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV) at 0x5bb29ffe (code=2) on API 17 (4.2.2)
Issue.Description: When I try to use Realm realm = Realm.getDefaultInstance(); the app gives that error while it runs well on 4.4 and above

Issue.Title: Enforce TLS if it was used for authentication
Issue.Description: Right now it is possible to e.g login to ROS using ` while using `realm` as the sync protocol.While technical possible to use ` for auth and `realm` for sync, it is counter productive and against security best practises.We should enforce people using `realms` if using ` by throwing an `IllegalArgumentException` if it happens.

Issue.Title: Realm-Transformer crashes if you have a class that ends with `RealmProxy` but isn't an actual proxy generated by Realm
Issue.Description: The transformer attempts to access `superclass` but it is not guaranteed to exist if you yourself create a class that ends with the name `RealmProxy`.

Issue.Description: Feature Request, Thanks

Issue.Title: How to perform an update operation
Issue.Description: How to perform an update operationthe document is unclear.

Issue.Title: Credentials.usernamePassword with multiple options
Issue.Description: Pr. internal discussion on API alignment on Sync API's, we need to supply a `createAccountIfNeeded` or `createUser|useExistingAccount` option.``Thoughts @realm/java ?

Issue.Title: SyncUser.all() should return Map
Issue.Description: Pr. internal discussion on Sync API alignment. This method should now return a read only map with the User identifier as the key.The User identifier is currently used in the Object Store, but no the Java layer.``

Issue.Title: User.currentUser() should throw if multiple users are logged in.
Issue.Description: Pr. internal discussion on Sync API alignment. We decided to let this method throw if multiple users are logged in to avoid confusion.``

Issue.Title: Investigate how Google Play backup/store works
Issue.Description: While adding a section about `writeCopyTo` for the docs I started thinking about Google Play Services Backup/Restore. We should investigate how it actually works in detail. If it takes a backup of an open file or restore it overriding an existing file, it might explain some of the weird Illegal File errors we are seeing from time to time.Also having it documened how it actually works also be beneficial.

Issue.Title: Access encryped realm file failed and CRASH
Issue.Description: Conditions:1. i use realm to record mutil users' info (iOS APP)2. encryped realm when our user logined in.Then, The app may CRASH sometimes For reporting Realm file decryption failed.my question is that WHEN will report this error (wrong key?) and HOW to solved it

Issue.Title: Java examples don't compile due to version.txt mismatch
Issue.Description: The realm-examples gradle script references the root version.txt, which currently contains `2.2.0-SNAPSHOT`. It sets `classpath "io.realm:realm-gradle-plugin:${currentVersion}"`. jcenter does not have any such version of the plugin. This results in the error:``To compile, one must explicitly specify the 2.0.2 version of the plugin.

Issue.Title: [WARNING!] Obfuscation is not working with 2.1.0
Issue.Description: **Beware, don't release to Google Play with Realm 2.1.0** if you want your code to be obfuscated. Realm 2.1.0 won't allow any of your class names to be obfuscated, even on classes that are not RealmObjects.I'm using custom dictionaries for it, but it probably does not matter. I tested this multiple times and my code with 2.0.2 is always correctly obfuscated, code with 2.1.0 is not obfuscated at all. Luckily this happened to me once with another library and I'm checking the resulting apk with an apktool before releasing.

Issue.Title: Hi I am geeting this error java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{com.example.abl.myrealmapplication/com.example.abl.myrealmapplication.activity.MainActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException: No default RealmConfiguration was found. Call setDefaultConfiguration() first
Issue.Description: public class RealmController { private static RealmController instance; private final Realm realm; public RealmController(Application application) { realm = Realm.getDefaultInstance(); } public static RealmController with(Fragment fragment){ if(instance==null){ instance=new RealmController(fragment.getActivity().getApplication()); } return instance; } public static RealmController with(Activity activity){ if(instance==null){ instance=new RealmController(activity.getApplication()); } return instance; } public static RealmController with(Application application){ if(instance==null){ instance=new RealmController(application); } return instance; } public static RealmController getInstance(){ return instance; } public Realm getRealm(){ return realm; } public void refresh(){ realm.refresh(); } public void clearAll(){ realm.beginTransaction(); realm.clear(Book.class); realm.commitTransaction(); } public RealmResults<Book> getBook(){ return realm.where(Book.class).findAll(); } public Book getBook(String id){ return realm.where(Book.class).equalTo("id",id).findFirst(); } public boolean hasBook(){ return !realm.allObjects(Book.class).isEmpty(); } public RealmResults<Book>queryedBooks(){ return realm.where(Book.class).contains("author","Author 0").or().contains("title","Realm").findAll(); } }

Issue.Title: Requirements elicitation
Issue.Description: Good morning,We have already submited an issue with id #3613 about realm software processes, and now we would want to know how the team deals with requirements elicitation. So, regarding this:- How does the team decides on whether to implement a new feature?- Does someone is responsible to decide which functionality will be implemented?- What is the process to analyse and accept a pull request or an issue? - There are a Software Requirements Specification (SRS) document? We would be very pleased and thankfull if you could answer this questions.Thanks in advance.

Issue.Title: APK is 1.5MB bigger on 2.0.2 than on 1.2.0
Issue.Description: #### GoalUsing the newest version of Realm without adding 1.5 MB to APK size. I'm comparing release builds with proguard enabled.#### Expected ResultsAn APK that is not 1.5 MB bigger#### Actual ResultsAn APK that is 1.5 MB bigger#### Steps & Code to ReproduceUpdate from Realm 1.2.0 to 2.0.2#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 2.0.2Realm sync feature enabled: noAndroid Studio version: 2.2.2Relates to #3506

Issue.Title: copyOrUpdate() throws Illegal Argument: This field is not nullable (String)
Issue.Description: #### GoalWe're using Realm in a library project. For synchronization, we're using a SyncAdapter. In the synchronization process, we update a list of Trips. The name of the start address may be `null` locally or it should be updated with `null`.#### Expected ResultsThe `String` field `start_address_name` is updated accordingly.#### Actual ResultsThe crash is pretty rare. We got 6 crashes in the last week with a few hundred synchronizations a day.The crash occurs only after we put everthing in a remote process.Stack Trace:``#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): `2.0.2`Realm sync feature enabled: noAndroid Studio version: `2.2.2`Which Android version and device: `6.0`, `6.0.1` (Samsung, Sony, Huawei)

Issue.Title: equalTo(String, boolean) -> Illegal Argument: ColumnType invalid
Issue.Description: #### GoalWe're using Realm in a library project. For synchronization, we're using a SyncAdapter. In the synchronization process, we got a simple query with a `equalTo(String, boolean)` selection to get all Persons whose flag `modified_offline` is true.#### Expected ResultsGetting every person which is marked as modified offline.#### Actual ResultsIn some rare cases, it crashes and throws an `IllegalArgumentException: Illegal Argument: ColumnType invalid`. We got 4 crashes in the last week with a few hundred synchronizations a day. The code is executed in every synchronization.Stack Trace:``#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version: `2.0.2`Android Studio version: `2.2.2`Which Android version and device: `6.0.1` (Samsung, Sony)

Issue.Title: Rx off thread loading memory leak
Issue.Description: Hello guys, I will be very grateful for any help in understanding this issue.I really enjoy the way I can async subscribe to data changes with Rx, but I have next situation - I need to convert RealmObjects to another objects from my project. Because the count of objects is huge, I want to do this conversion in off thread also and subscribe to all this stuff from Main thread.So I am trying to do something like this:``Here I am trying to subscribe to RealmResults from my own `HandlerThread` with looper, so that way I can manipulate with RealmObjects in off thread. I subscribe, unsubscribe, create and close Realm instance in this thread, `.doOnUnsubscribe` method fired.The code behaves exactly as I want, except all RealmResults are leaking.Full example project is here Realm version: 2.0.2

Issue.Title: Improve control of [possibly flawed] RealmLog default/custom logger
Issue.Description: #### Goal/Expected ResultsMore reasonable control of RealmLog.LOGGERS; mostly the ability to remove the default logger.RealmBase automatically adds during static initialization:Possibly a RealmLog.set(Logger logger) or a RealmLog.clear() would be sufficient.#### Actual ResultsFirst of all, RealmBase's "BuildConfig.DEBUG ? DebugAndroidLogger : ReleaseAndroidLogger" logic is based off of "com.getkeepsafe.relinker.BuildConfig".This logic seems like a bug...two actually.1) The logic should probably be based off of "io.realm.BuildConfig".2) Libraries by default build as Release, and I am assuming Realm is, so this will always evaluate to ReleaseAndroidLogger.Second of all, RealmLog provides no way to remove this logger.The result is that adding a custom logger ends up showing some duplicate messages.#### Steps & Code to Reproduce``#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1.1Android Studio version: 2.1.3Which Android version and device: N/A

Issue.Title: weird behavior of .findAllAsync().asObservable()
Issue.Description: Hello, I'm querying a table that could be empty with this:`realm.where(MyClass.class) .findAllAsync() .asObservable() .filter(RealmResults::isLoaded)`The observable never completes if the table is empty, no empty observable, no error, no nothing. As soon I insert the first row into MyClass the observable emits this value and finally completes.The thing is, it should emit an empty observable if no data were found immediately and complete. Why does it have to wait for a row to be there? :SDon't take me wrong, but realm's rxjava is not what i expected (I won't use the word "bad", I'm just dissapoined . I can't even apply my own schedulers to fetch data because exception is thrown) and i guess i'll stick with the traditional way and ditch away the rxjava support: Creating an observable, fetching data synchronous and put them onNext and apply my schedulers :S

Issue.Title: Testing `Realm.setAutoRefresh()`

Issue.Title: Increase encryption key size to at least 2048 bit
Issue.Description: #### GoalRealm supports 512 bit key size for encryption which is too low for financial applications and personal data.#### Expected ResultsRealm should increase supported key size to at least 2048 bit for increased security.

Issue.Title: 'com.intellij:annotations' lib included as generated code, causing DEX conflicts
Issue.Description: #### GoalBuild an application that depends on Realm and an `aar` dependency that includes `com.intellij:annotations` as a dependency.#### Expected ResultsThe application builds successfully.#### Actual ResultsWhen assembling the application, I get this error.``This solution works, but is not ideal. If the annotations module gets an update that dependent libraries (or even my app) require, I won't be able to get it until I update to a version of realm that supplies the updated annotations library (if one even exists). I recommend adding `compile 'com.intellij:annotations:12.0` to the project through the `realm-gradle-plugin`, instead of generating a copy of the intellij library in `build/intermediates/`.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s):realm-gradle-plugin 1.1.0

Issue.Title: Migrate to OpenSSL 1.0.2
Issue.Description: According to support of OpenSSL 1.0.1 will end 31st December 2016. We should switch to OpenSSL 1.0.2 or later. Or we could explore if [LibreSSL]( or [BoringSSL]( are better alternatives.

Issue.Title: RealmChangeListener never fired if modification is made from another process
Issue.Description: #### GoalI want to be notified of a data edition even if it's made in another process#### Expected ResultsI get notified#### Actual ResultsI never get notified, event after commit and close realm from the process#### Steps & Code to Reproduce- Create a service in another process and an activity in the default process, and add a single item in the realm- Register a RealmChangeListener in the activity to this realm- Edit this item in the realm from the process. Commit and close the realm, whatever- RealmChangeListener never fire- From the activity, edit the item, the RealmChangeListener is fired#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2Which Android version and device: Samsung Galaxy Tab A, Android 6.0.1

Issue.Title: Update realm from another process works only after it's been closed.
Issue.Description: #### GoalUpdating the data in the realm from a service in another process and see the result from the activity in the default process#### Expected ResultsI can retrieve the new data as soon as commit is called in the service#### Actual ResultsThe realm in the service from another process has to be closed for the activity to see the new values.#### Steps & Code to Reproduce- Create a service in another process and an activity in the default process, and add a single item in the realm- Edit this item in the realm from the process. Commit but don't close the realm.- Notify the activity by Broadcast- From the activity, access the object.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2Which Android version and device: Samsung Galaxy Tab A, Android 6.0.1

Issue.Title: count() seems to have some cache, multiple process issue
Issue.Description: #### GoalCounting the number of item in an activity after deleting instance from another process`realm.where(MyModel.class).count();`#### Expected ResultsGetting the new count() value#### Actual ResultsWe get the value before the deletion from the other process#### Steps & Code to Reproduce- Create a service in another process and an activity in the default process- Open a realm and count() the number of realm object in the activity- deleteAllObject form the service, commit and close the database- send a broadcast received by the application and count() again in the same realm#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2Which Android version and device: Samsung Galaxy Tab A, Android 6.0.1

Issue.Title: cannot find symbol variable AyatTextRealmProxy
Add .equalTo(String fieldName, byte[] value) to RealmQuery

For example:``If this is something which I can help out with, I'd definitely be willing to (though I might need a few pointers as to where to look).Thanks!

Issue.Title: Remove ARM support
Issue.Description: With the upcoming integration of the Object Store, ARM will no longer be supported.Google moved to ARMv7a support as well as practically no devices support this anymore, so it should be safe to do so.It will also reduce the overall size of the AAR distribution package. Note, this is a breaking change so should only happen as part of 2.0

Issue.Title: Type HashMap<String, String> of field is not supported
Issue.Description: Hi!I've been poking around realm library as an internal storage for data in android and it works great. Lately I've been wondering whether or not you could replace shared app preferences (later: SP) with this particular storage as in my experience shared preferences tend to accept data only once and never let you to either clear or edit them. I am aware that if database is in app's internal storage, it can only be accessed by that particular app.So far I've been using SP to store encoded cookies from server, which acted as a hash map. Meanwhile migrating to realm I've come to an issue that field type `java.util.HashMap<java.util.String, java.util.String>` is not supported. How come? Do all fields need to extend RealmObject or be primitive?

Issue.Title: Allow 0-length values array on RealmQuery.in()
Issue.Description: Allow 0-length values array on RealmQuery.in() > cmelchior: Should we allow the 0-length values array? It would basically default to the query always returning the empty set, but I would imagine that this values array in most cases will be generated in a loop based on some other input, so I think that this array in a lot of cases will actually be empty, making it a hassle for the user to work around.> > bdash: In Cocoa we have [`TrueExpression` and `FalseExpression`]( that we use for cases like [handling an `or` group containing zero elements](from [previous discussion](

Issue.Title: Document deleteFromRealm() and filesize
Issue.Description: Add the following to the website docs:---`deleteFromRealm()` will delete the actual objects on disk, but due tohow Realm works you will not see any difference in the filesize of theRealm file. Instead there will be "empty" space inside the Realm filethat will be reused when you add new objects.Example:1) You have a 5 MB Realm file2) You delete 2 MB worth of data. The Realm file will still be 5 MB3) You add 3 MB worth of data. The Realm file will now be 6 MB asthe empty space was used first.If you want to remove this "empty" space, you can call## `Realm.compactRealm()` which will give you smallest file on disk.

Issue.Title: HOW Realm works and the best implementation in a project
Issue.Description: > First of all, I want to say thank you guys for building a awesome project!> While implementation and deliver app to end users, we faced some issues which cause by Realm library, so I'd like to ask something to have deeper understanding about how realm works, since we will find out which one is the best implementation.## **Questions 1**:Please let me know what is different between two ways of implementation as below (about get realm instance). I want to know which one is faster, lighter in memory and what is your recommend of Realm guys#### Set and Get Realm as Default (with specific config)``## **Questions 2** :In my application, now we are consider between 2 ways of implementation.**1:** We create a new Realm instance every time when we need to do something with Database (in both of worker thread and UI thread) and close it when task get done.**2:** We create only one instance of Realm and let it live along with application, when quit application we close instance above.- Please explain me the advantage and disadvantage of each one and which ways is recommended (My application using Service to handle database and network connection)- If I have 2 heavy tasks (take a long time to complete it's transaction), what is difference between execute 2 task by one Realm instance and execute 2 task on 2 Realm instances in 2 separate thread (I mean one thread have one Realm instances and instance will executes one in 2 tasks above), and which one if safer and faster. - what will happen if there is a problem while executing a transaction (example not responding or throws some exception)> Thanks for helping

Issue.Title: Add quotes around field names in RealmProxy exceptions
Issue.Description: **Feature Request**#### GoalRead an exception regarding a field and determing which field is being referred to. The field's name is `code`.#### Expected ResultsImmediate recognition that the problematic field is `code`.#### Actual ResultsTemporary confusion about message.It is arguable that `code` is a bad name for a field, but I'm sure there are others that are just as problematic.I ask that you simply change the exception string from:``This is the error I came across, but you may want to go through other generated error messages to see if there is a similar issue.

Issue.Title: @PrimaryKey is not handled correctly when using insert()
Issue.Description: #### Steps & Code to Reproduce``#### Expected log output:> D/PrimaryKeyActivity: Number of wheels with id 1 before inserting: 0> D/PrimaryKeyActivity: Number of wheels with id 1 after inserting: 1#### Actiual log output:> D/PrimaryKeyActivity: Number of wheels with id 1 before inserting: 0> D/PrimaryKeyActivity: Number of wheels with id 1 after inserting: **2**As you can see, we have two objects with the same primary key.Note that `insertOrUpdate()` and `copyToRealm()` work correctly.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2Which Android version and device: Android 4.2.2 on Samsung GT-I9105

Issue.Title: Possible to automatically generate wrapping class for directly accessing fields instead of String?
Issue.Description: #### GoalAutomatically generate wrapping classes upon building for fields so in query we can just access fields in wrapping classes.This can increase reliability, reduce typo and unpredictable run time crashes.DBFlow has this feature really like it.#### Expected ResultsEx. I have a model theme using DBFlow. It generates a class Theme_Table and contains static field id.``# ### Updated:I noticed that in fact Realm already uses Gradle Transform API to generate same classes similarly.Say if you have a class called `Theme` after built, you can see `ThemeRealmProxy.ThemeColumnInfo` class was generated and it contains all declared columns, and a field inside called `private final ThemeColumnInfo columnInfo`. However, we cannot access them because they are not public.Since Realm already has the same things I wonder can Realm just provides access to them?I would expect something like:`realm.where(Theme.class).equalTo(ThemeRealmProxy.ThemeColumnInfo.name , "default").findFirst()`

Issue.Title: Static Fields completely ignored.
Issue.Description: #### Goal> Make a RealmObject class with a static field#### Expected Results> Be able to use static fields with Realm. I believe #934 was supposed to add support for this.#### Actual Results> Static fields are not recognized as persistable. You can see this in [ClassMetaData]( categorizeClassElements() function. #### Steps & Code to Reproduce> A RealmObject class with one static field will throw a "must have at least 1 persistable field" error. Adding non static fields allows compilation.#### Code Sample``#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1

Issue.Title: Making sense of 'Encrypted interprocess sharing is currently unsupported'
Issue.Description: ``Crashlytics reports this kind of crash for around 1,5% of about 50k users so far and I can't figure out what causes it, neither reproduce it on any of our test devices or emulator.**Things to consider:**- `getDefaultInstance()` that causes the crash is always called inside `onCreate()` method of our Application class. That's where Realm's default configuration gets set and default instance is obtained.- Our manifest file doesn't define any remote processes, like `process:remote`- If a third party library created a remote process (like the case with #1477 ), we would expect the crash to always happen? (I also try to catch it with RealmIOException, but that doesn't seem to do anything for any reason)- Crash always spikes on the first days following the update and drops significantly after, indicating that only users who updated get affected.- Considering the sheer amount of crashes and users affected, we get no complaint emails reporting this.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2Which Android version and device: all supported (4.0.3+)

Issue.Title: Realm needs more documentation on Stack Overflow
Issue.Description: #### Goal> What do you want to achieve?Have documentation on Stack Overflow#### Expected ResultsHave documentation on Stack Overflow#### Actual ResultsThere is no documentation on Stack Overflow yet, and I'm not sure if I should start creating it from scratch. After all, you guys have one `realm` tag, and that ought to contain all branches of Realm.How are you planning to create the branches `realm-java`, `realm-swift`, `realm-xamarin`, `realm-js`, `realm-objectivec`?

Issue.Description: I have created a project to replicate the issue I am having. [In the `onChange` listener the RealmObject's `isLoaded()` method is returning a true value, but when I then try to bind the data an IllegalStateException is thrown telling me that I should first check it is loaded.If you run the linked android project the bug will only be seen on the first launch, after that a row will exist in the db thereby avoiding the issue.#### Expected Results`isLoaded` should initially return false, until the IntentService inserts the data.#### Actual Results`isLoaded()` returns `true` before any data exists in the db, causing a crash``#### Steps & Code to ReproduceRun the linked app. The first time the app is run the above crash will occur, after that the app will work as intended.#### Code SampleSee [#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2Which Android version and device: Nexus5 emulator (android 6.0), Nexus 7 device (android 6.0)

Issue.Description: My app runs several background jobs (running in IntentService) to sync the data with server periodically. Once got the http response, the app save those data into realm.Some of my users (small number) are experiencing crash when try to open the realm instance.Sorry, since I am not able to reproduce the crash by myself, I can only show the logs from real users. which their app has been obfuscated.``What might cause this ? It is because those periodic jobs are sharing the same interval (5 mins), so there are mightbe a race condition when serval jobs want to write to realm at same time ?I have been upgraded realm from `1.0.0` to `1.1.0`, but did not fix this issue.

Issue.Title: Realm messes up the order of actions in transaction (possibly)
Issue.Description: #### GoalMy application creates a la ERP documents with rows of data (to post it to ERP later on).I create/modify document in a single transaction.To make it simple (and faster) i do not check each row for changes but clear them all (first) and (then) save changed set ( i believe most document oriented systems work this way).I store data in a relational way with rows stored separated having document id as "foreign key".#### Expected Resultsedited document contains changed rows of data after transaction is committed.#### Actual ResultsThere is no exception raised but in result sometimes i receive as a result documents containing no rows, like if first rows have been added and then erased.#### Steps & Code to ReproduceI can't debug it deeply as committing transaction proceeds to native methods which are neither de-compiled nor debuggable (or i don't know how).#### Code SampleOperation - is a document, actions - are document rows, i renamed them as i was porting another authors app to Realm from ORMLite and so i don't get messed with different classes by the same names.``hope methods name speak themselves so you don't need any nested code.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): ?classpath 'io.realm:realm-gradle-plugin:1.1.0'Android Studio version: ?AS 2.1.2Which Android version and device: ?plenty of them, mostly with Android API 16-17

Issue.Title: Cannot wait for changes in IntentService
Issue.Description: #### Goal> What do you want to achieve?Wait for changes on a background thread created by an IntentService#### Expected ResultsBe able to wait for change and update#### Actual ResultsCannot wait for changes on a looper thread#### Steps & Code to ReproduceThe code in [BaseRealm]( explicitly states that if you have a looper, then you cannot wait for change, even though `RealmChangeListener`s don't work on IntentServices.#### Code SampleI'm asking because of [this SO question](#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2Which Android version and device: 6.0.1

Issue.Description: This kind of crash happened to @KynoYang a few times, but the crash logs are not exact the same:Crash 1``From the log we can see the first exception was thrown in the java, but the 2nd one was thrown from native code. This is abnormal. Since the both of them went through the same calling routine that the 2nd one did the java side type checking as well -- But it threw later.It might indicate that we have a corrupted pointer that caused by a concurrency problem.PS.: There are also a few other crashes from @KynoYang which indicate the similar problem. But those two are quite typical.Might be fixed by . We need to monitor this after `v1.1.1` release.

Issue.Description: #### GoalImplement a schema migration to add a new field to a schema in which that field should not exist.#### Expected ResultsThe migration succeeds.#### Actual ResultsThe app is finding that the field already exists and throwing `RealmMigrationNeededException`.#### Steps & Code to ReproduceThis is our first attempt at a schema migration. As we have iterated around in development, we have added a field to a schema in one `git` branch and not added it in another. I've tested multiple branches on my device. In this scenario, I'm working with our `master` branch (unreleased), which has a migration from schema version 0 to 1. (Before this, we were using `.deleteRealmIfMigrationNeeded()`, but we also did not change the schema during that time.)The migration in `master` adds a new field `id_tmp` to the model `MyModel`, removes the primary key field `id`, renames `id_tmp` to `id`, and adds `id` as a primary key. There is no mention of a new nullable `String` field `newField` on `MyModel` that is created in another branch, `add-new-field`, which I want to merge to `master`. On `add-new-field`, we simply extended the migration in `master` with `.addField("newField")`.When running `master` (debug flavor) on my device, the migration complains that the field count for `MyModel` is wrong (expected 7 but was 8). I print the fields with the following at the beginning of the `migrate(DynamicRealm realm, long oldVersion, long newVersion)` method, and, surprise, field `newField` shows up in the list:``The migration finishes, and the exception is thrown at the first use of the `Realm` instance.I would like to be able to do the following:1. Run `master` without getting the `RealmMigrationNeededException` about a field that should not exist.2. Run `add-new-field` (after uninstalling the app and starting fresh) to test it and eventually merge it to `master`.Thinking that maybe the app data is not deleted, I do:1. Uninstall any existing app on device.2. Install `master` on device and verify that the app data is empty.3. Run `master` on device.But I still get the same problem.Thinking that maybe some Realm build files are not getting regenerated, I do:1. Build Clean Project in Android Studio.2. Ensure that `.../app/build/generated/source/apt/debug/io/realm` (where I see `io.realm.MyModelRealmProxy` and `io.realm.MyModelRealmProxyInterface`) is deleted.3. Install `master` on device and verify that the app data is empty.4. Run `master` on device.But I still get the same problem.#### VersionsRealm version(s): 1.0.1 (upgraded from 1.0.0 on `master` as part of primary key migration)Android Studio version: 2.1.2Device: Nexus 5xAndroid version on device: 6.0.1

Issue.Title: RealmList returns RealmModel instead of RealmObject. How to adapt this change?

Issue.Title: Documentation is unclear about when migrations are run
Issue.Description: #### GoalLearn when migrations are run.#### Expected ResultsReading the [Migrations section]( of the documentation, I expect to find a statement mentioning when migrations are run.#### Actual ResultsI find the following statement:> Using this, the migration code will be run automatically if needed.I don't mean to be pedantic, but this statement is a bit ambiguous and potentially misleading. First, what is automatic about running the migration code? Second, _is_ the code run only if needed? From my experiments, it seemed like `RealmMigration.migrate()` was being run every time I built the `RealmConfiguration`.I could be wrong about this, but I think it's the pattern described in the [`RealmMigration` API docs]( that provides the if needed aspect of the above statement. And I don't think there's anything automatic about running the `migrate()` method.The quoted statement could lead me to think I don't have to do any work for migration. But, in reality, I have to do _all_ of the work to implement the migration.#### SuggestionI would change the quoted statement to something more precise and less misleading. For example:> Using this, you can write a schema migration from any previous version to the latest.I would also add a link to the [`RealmMigration` API reference]( since that provides a useful description of the migration code pattern.

Issue.Title: Question about RxJava, FlatMap and RealmResults.asObservable
Issue.Description: #### Goal> What do you want to achieve?#### Expected Results> Filter a RecyclerView based on an EditText's input using RxAndroid and RxBinding and Realm's Rx support. The input text should be searched for once, and the RecyclerView updated once.#### Actual ResultsRealm updates occurring for every single character entered previously, meaning first character makes 2 events, 2 characters make 3 events, deleting a character makes 4 events, deleting second character makes 5 events; and the Results returned in these events have erratic sizes#### Code SampleI made a repository on Github, and [here were the offending lines]( I've already fixed it, I had to use `map()` instead of `flatMap()`, as inThis works``However I have zero clue what happened, other than that `asObservable()` created new subscriptions with `asObservable()`, or at least so I guess. Even then, what happened didn't really make sense. It's as if after creating new observable for `flatMap()`, the old RealmResults were still updating with old query parameter.What happens here if I use `flatMap()` instead of `map()`? Why does it break so badly?**EDIT:** Interesting fact, it works with `switchMap()` instead of `flatMap()`.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1.0Android Studio version: 2.1.1 (irrelevant)Which Android version and device: 6.0.1 (irrelevant) Nexus 5X

Issue.Title: Disable auto updating of RealmObjects? RecyclerView order changing
Issue.Description: #### Goal> What do you want to achieve?> To be able to have consistent data across various activities. To stop my RecyclerView from updating and moving items into the wrong order.#### Expected Results> Load Activity with RecyclerView --> Tap on item --> Open new activity --> Tap on button --> Open new activity, and an api call is made to get the updated json for the item i tapped on --> Press back button to get to RecyclerView and the list is still in the same order.#### Actual ResultsFollow the above user journey, and when I go back to the main screen with my RecyclverView the item I tapped on has now jumped to the top of the list. If I do it again with a different item in the list, the item I tapped on jumps up to position 2, and if I do it again, position 3, etc etc. I think this is because the data for that object has been updated.I do NOT use a realm change listener and this still happens. Refreshing my RecyclverView (pull to refresh) re-orders the list back into the correct order.Is there a way for me to get an RealmResults<object> and not have it auto update?#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2Which Android version and device: Nexus 5 Android M.

Issue.Title: Query Realm for data that is NOT in array?
Issue.Description: #### Goal> What do you want to achieve?To be able to pass in an ArrayList<Integer> of ids and to query realm with those ids, and collect all data that does NOT have that id.#### Actual ResultsWith what I have tried, I am getting every object in my query, even those that match the ids in my `ArrayList`.Is there a solution to this? This is what I have tried:``So for a specific user I want to delete all of the Objects where the ids do not match any of those in the array.Wondering if you guys have any potential solutions? I have thought about passing in the Objects itself then deleting everything in the model and just adding the Object ArrayList I have back in, but that seems like an unnecessary transaction.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.1.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2

Issue.Title: Integrate Object Store
Issue.Description:
- [x] Base PR for making build work. See #3102 - Enable cmake with our build system. - Enable cmake on CI. - Use git ~~subtree~~ submodule to integrate OS repo. - Use clang to compile since gcc 4.9 has problems with OS compiling. - Removing `realm-jni` won't be part of this to avoid conflicts. They can be remove after this merged to master. - [x] Integrate SharedRealm from OS. See #3031 - Replace `SharedGroup`/`Group` by `SharedRealm`. - More details see #3031. - [ ] Integrate `Property`/`Schema`/`ObjectSchema`. (#3066) - [x] Integrate OS notification (#3370) - [x] Integrate `Results` for the future fine grained notification. (#3834) - [x] Clean up finalizers? It is a good time to start it right now. (#3144)
Reviewing and merging #3102 is the basis of the integration.

Issue.Title: java.lang.IllegalStateException: when use findAll().asObservable() with subscribeOn(Schedulers.io()). Similar to #2607
Issue.Code: java return Observable.defer(() -> Observable.just(Realm.getInstance(realmConfiguration))) .flatMap(realm -> realm.where(clazz) .findAll() .asObservable() .filter(RealmResults::isLoaded) .map(sort) .map(realm::copyFromRealm) .doOnUnsubscribe(realm::close) ); `
Issue.Description: I'm getting this exception( Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: You can't register a listener from a non-Looper thread) when executing this code``My use case is to fetch data from Realm and then make NetworkRequest all this with `subscribeOn(Schedulers.io())`. What is the problem here?

Issue.Title: "This Realm instance has already been closed, making it unusable." - Even when copying object?
Issue.Description: #### Goal> What do you want to achieve?> To be able to access the data in an object after calling realm.close.#### Expected Results> To get an object out of the Realm data store and use it's data after closing realm, by copying the object first.#### Actual Results> RuntimeException: This Realm instance has already been closed, making it unusable.#### Steps & Code to ReproduceCode I am using:``I am currently under the impression that copying the object first gives me the ability to use that object freely, instead of it being just a reference to the realm backing store. I've got various helper methods to make queries to Realm for me, where I open a realm then close it in one go then return the data. Is this incorrect? By copying the object shouldn't there be no issue?Interesting to hear your thoughts on the subject and what the correct procedure should be. Issue.Title: Parsing lots of data to Realm, causes crashes and null objects.
Issue.Description: #### Goal> What do you want to achieve?> I have a big json file when a user first logs into my app, grabbing all their data, and I want to parsed into multiple RealmObjects. I'm having issues where the data is not being parsed inside an `AsyncTask`, and if I remove the `AsyncTask` the app crashes. Possibly because parsing has not finished and I've already moved onto loading the main activity in my app to use the object? This is all quite hard to explain because I'm not sure if this is an issue with `Realm` or if I need help in figuring out a good structure for parsing that realm likes.#### Expected Results> User logs in. Api call, data is retrieved and parsed. At the same time the user is going through the process of loading the main activity where I create a navigation drawer. Everything should load fine.#### Actual Results> Two outcomes depending on how my code is set up.**Outcome 1:** My main entry point for parsing the user data:``So I remove the `AsyncTask` because it looks like the data was being skipped anyway. However this causes my app to crash. Now when I load my main activity (where I have a navigation drawer created) the user object is totally null. I can't get the user's first name or anything.#### Other commentsI just want to understand why this is happening. By using the `AsyncTask`, it's as if the data is ignored, and when I put breakpoints there, the breakpoints are in fact not hit. So I find it very strange. Is there something with `Realm` I should follow when parsing? Does `Realm` not work with AsyncTasks? One other weird thing is that I have a smaller API call that I will be moving over to at a later date(I want to get `Realm` working with my app first) and I gave it a try, and it worked. It doesn't contain some of the bigger arrays, like payments, but it still has some, so I'm wondering if `Realm` just can't handle lots of data at once?I would love to be able to solve this but I feel a bit stuck at the moment. My code is identical to when I was parsing to an `SQLite` database (without AsyncTask) and there were no crashes or missing data. Anyway would just love to hear the input of others who have spent more time on `Realm`. Thanks.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.0.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2Which Android version and device: Nexus 5, Nexus 6P, Marshmallow, Android N DP4. Not device specific.FYI this might be slightly related to my previous issue: however I tried the suggestion there and I'm still getting issues. Back then I didn't really solve my issue, I just moved to using the small api which I should not have done.
