Issue.Title: Align RealmObject.isValid() with Cocoa/.NET
Issue.Description: See Right now we return `false` for unmanaged objects, both Cocoa and .NET return `true` in the same case.This has the advantage that you can use `isValid()` to determine if you can use the data from the RealmObject.Java has some extra considerations though as we also have to consider the loaded state. Right now we return `false` if the object isn't loaded yet. That makes sense to me I think.In any case, any change to these semantics are a breaking change, thus should only be part of 2.0

Issue.Title: Async API's: Pin version during handover
Issue.Description: With Realm Core 1.2 it is now possible to pin the version used during a handover.This means that it is safe to assume on the receiving end that the version is reachable and will massively reduce the number of race conditions and errors we need to handle in the async API's.Especially this means that a `BadVersionException` should not happen and we should cleanup the code appropriately.

Issue.Title: DynamicRealmObject.setObject() seg faults with invalid field name
Issue.Description: ``We don't check if the column name exists for Object and just parse -1 on to `getLinkTarget` which seg faults.Right now DynamicRealmObject doesn't use `RealmObjectSchema` for these kinds of look-ups. Ideally all schema access should go through this class to enforce any additional rules we might have, but that will require us being aware if the schema is being invalidated by core so we can can recalculate cached information. Such a callback is already available and needed for interprocess support anyway.

Issue.Title: RealmThreadPoolExecutor.java may have non-optimal default settings
Issue.Description: 1) The core size and max pool size are both the same at 2 x cpu cores + 1. This is fine but under the assumption that no other thread pools/executors exist for the android project which is highly unlikely. I would say the value should be `Math.Max(2, cpucores / 2 + 1)`. 2) Each thread in android allocates a 1MB stack. So less threads is good but the current pool, if there is a lot of blocking async queries, uses up to 2 x cpu core + 1 threads and never release them since coreSize and maxPoolSize is the same. For 2016 android where the mean cores is approaching 8 which means 17 threads could lead to lots of oom issues during critical times when there is a lot of blocking async transactions.Suggestion:1) Reduce coreSize to 0. Allow all threads to idle killable. 1 is also fine to avoid lots of thread creations over span of app life cycle. 2) Reduce maxPoolSize to something like = `Math.Max(2, cpucores / 2 + 1)`.~~3) Increase queue size since we are not allowing that many concurrent async trans/queries~~4) Set keepAlive idle time from 0 to 60s.These are just my suggestions. Some real testing may be needed to see what the actual better values are compared to current.``

Issue.Title: Auto initialization by ContentProvider
Issue.Description: Having a `ContentProvider` for Realm initialization enables us to obtain `Context` without user's explicit initialization.There are two options for initialization code.1) Only setting default configuration by using the context.2) Keep a reference of the `Context` for further construction of RealmConfiguration.- 1) enables for users to get default Realm instance without setting default configuration. No API changes.- 2) enables for users to create `RealmConfiguration.Builder` instance without `Context`. In public API, default constructor of `RealmConfiguration.Builder` will be added and the constructors that accept `Context` as argument will be removed (it requires to bump version to `2.0`). This provides better API compatibility to JVM version of Realm-java (it's not existing though).There are some concerns.- Happening the initialization of `ContentProvider` is not officially documented (it means that it's an implementation detail and has a chance to be changed.).- Need to accept some overhead for initialization.- No way to control the order of initializations of other `ContentProvider`s (at least, Firebase crash reporting uses this techniqe).- App's `build.gradle` must have `applicationId` directive.- Keeping a reference to application context is not good for InstantRun.

Issue.Title: Illegal State: Table is no longer valid to operate on; because of realm.close() ?
Issue.Description: #### Goal> Create a relationship between two objects.#### Expected Results> The relationship to be working.#### Actual Results> One object cannot be added to another if I call `realm.close()` after I make a query. Everything works fine when I do NOT call `realm.close()`#### Steps & Code to ReproduceI have a CreditCard object and a Payment object. A CreditCard can have many payments. As a result in my CreditCard object I have the following:`public RealmList<Payment> payments;`I make an API call to get the a credit card. While I'm parsing the JSON I make a query to get all associated payments for that card like this:``This throws the exception I raised in the title of this ticket. If I do NOT call `realm.close()`here, everything works fine and the relationship is set. In general calling `realm.close()` seems to cause a lot of problems for me. Shouldn't the RealmList be accessible? Or is that just a reference like RealmResults as well? Would be good to know how to solve this because it's a real blocker.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.0.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2Which Android version and device: Nexus 5 Marshmallow

Issue.Title: Out of memory on commitTransaction
Issue.Description: Here's the stack trace I'm getting:> Fatal Exception: io.realm.exceptions.RealmError: Unrecoverable error. mmap() failed: Out of memory size: 402653184 in io_realm_internal_SharedGroup.cpp line 188> at io.realm.internal.SharedGroup.nativeCommitAndContinueAsRead(SharedGroup.java)> at io.realm.internal.SharedGroup.commitAndContinueAsRead(SharedGroup.java:95)> at io.realm.internal.ImplicitTransaction.commitAndContinueAsRead(ImplicitTransaction.java:62)> at io.realm.internal.SharedGroupManager.commitAndContinueAsRead(SharedGroupManager.java:118)> at io.realm.BaseRealm.commitTransaction(BaseRealm.java:340)> at io.realm.BaseRealm.commitTransaction(BaseRealm.java:327)> at io.realm.Realm.commitTransaction(Realm.java:120)> at myapp.services.ToDoIntentService.getTasks(ToDoIntentService.java:350)> at myapp.services.ToDoIntentService.doWork(ToDoIntentService.java:70)> at myapp.services.RealmBackgroundIntentService.onHandleIntent(RealmBackgroundIntentService.java:56)> at android.app.IntentService$ServiceHandler.handleMessage(IntentService.java:65)> at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102)> at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:135)> at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:61)I have a class that I use to monitor what classes have opened a realm, and if they've closed it or not. I use this exclusively over Realm.getDefaultInstance()/close(). I've had lots of problems with fragments not shutting down in a timely fashion and so not closing their realm instances.``Unfortunately with the way IntentServices work, at least with this crash, I don't have any way to determine where it's being called.For most users the app's data sits at 1-2MB. I'm checking with the user that experienced this crash to find out what their Data size is.In everything I've seen with my RealmMonitor, all my RealmBackgroundIntentServices open and close their realms as expected. All my Activities open and close their realms as expected. All my fragments open their realms as expected, and eventually close them, as expected.What could be going on here?#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.0.0Android Studio version: 2.1Which Android version and device: 5.1.1, Nexus 7 (2nd gen)

Issue.Title: Synchronous executeTransaction() with callbacks
Issue.Code:
void executeTransaction(Realm.Transaction transaction) Executes a given transaction on the Realm.
RealmAsyncTask executeTransactionAsync(Realm.Transaction transaction) Similar to executeTransaction(Transaction) but runs asynchronously on a worker thread.
RealmAsyncTask executeTransactionAsync(Realm.Transaction transaction, Realm.Transaction.OnError onError)
Similar to executeTransactionAsync(Transaction), but also accepts an OnError callback. RealmAsyncTask executeTransactionAsync(Realm.Transaction transaction, Realm.Transaction.OnSuccess onSuccess) Similar to executeTransactionAsync(Transaction), but also accepts an OnSuccess callback.
RealmAsyncTask executeTransactionAsync(Realm.Transaction transaction, Realm.Transaction.OnSuccess onSuccess, Realm.Transaction.OnError onError) Similar to executeTransactionAsync(Transaction), but also accepts an OnSuccess and OnError callbacks.
Which means there is no such thing as
java void executeTransaction(Realm.Transaction transaction, Realm.Transaction.OnSuccess onSuccess) void executeTransaction(Realm.Transaction transaction, Realm.Transaction.OnError onError) void executeTransaction(Realm.Transaction transaction, Realm.Transaction.OnSuccess onSuccess, Realm.Transaction.OnError onError) `
Issue.Description: > **Feature Request**: Just fill in the first two sections below.#### GoalReceive a callback on success/error when a _synchronous_ transaction is successfully completed by Realm#### Expected ResultsSuccess/error is called#### Actual ResultsSince > RealmObject and RealmResults are always updated on the next event loop.you would need to receive a looper event to know that your transaction has successfully been completed and the results are up to date. However, the API does not allow synchronous transactions with callbacks.``But via change listeners, you can't be certain what transaction's success you're listening to, just that you've modified the underlying table on some thread.Of course, maybe writing to the Realm synchronously on the UI thread is strongly discouraged.Realm version(s): 1.0.1

Issue.Title: Are Realm insertions known to be slow? App crashes when trying to retrieve recently parsed data.
Issue.Description: #### Goal> What do you want to achieve?To use a RealmObject immediately after it has been saved (or thought to be saved I guess).#### Expected ResultsData should be accessible right away.#### Actual ResultsApp crashes with NullPointerExceptions because data does not exist. Restarting the app and everything works fine.``I don't like how temperamental it is. So all in all I'm wondering, does Realm take longer than expected to insert data? Maybe different users with different amounts of data is causing it to be temperamental. Is this why I can't use my user object immediately? I'd like to understand a bit more about how this all works. Let me know if you need anything else to get a better picture.#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.0.0Android Studio version: 2.1.2Which Android version and device: Nexus 5, Marshmallow. Nexus 6P Android N DP4. Not specific to device.

Issue.Title: Add method "getRealm()" to RealmObject
Issue.Description: It would be nice if it would be possible to retrieve realm instance from attached object, instead of relying always on Realm.getInstance(). I know those instances are cached - so it's not about performance, but I tend to separate my business logic from UI code, and also use fragments etc (so even while I do open and close realm in activity lifecycle, I don't have realm reference accessible everywhere), so in each business method (for example "statusManager.updateStatus(realmObjectX, newStatus)") where I want to do any operation on realm objects I need to obtain realm instance and close it. Brief examination of RealmObject makes me believe there's some internal method that does it, so it seems doable, although of course I'm not aware of all implications :)

Issue.Title: Implementing Parcelable with Realm and Retrofit

Although i had to remove the parcelable interface from my model because it doesn't recognize RealmList . Issue.Title: cancelTransaction() causes REALM_CHANGED/LOCAL_COMMIT missed.
Issue.Description: In normal cases pair `Realm.beginTransaction()`/`Realm.commitTransaction()` will trigger realm updates for local thread from `Realm.commitTransaction()`.But for `Realm.beginTransaction()`/`Realm.cancelTransaction()`, the update event won't be sent anymore. This is not correct and will cause some strange issues since `beginTransaction()` will do advance read and update the local realm instance.

PullRequest.Title: Integrate OS Results & Async query
PullRequest.Description:
TODO: - [x] Check the query's ownership. OS `Results` moves the param `Query` when construct. But in java the `RealmQuery` still need it. Consider clone it before create `Results`. - [x] `RealmResults` in looper thread. - [x] `RealmResults` in non-looper thread. - [x] Behaviour of `RealmResults`'s iteration when deletion happens. (#3883) - [x] Kill `TableOrView`, yeah. - [x] `NotificationToken` destructor's thread safety. - [x] To support `distinctAsync()`. This needs to be added in the OS side, maybe create a mode `Results.Mode.distinct()` in OS `Results`? Relevant PR - [x] Support `findFirstAsync()`. - [x] Check if the `distinct()` returns a new `RealmResults` object, and should it return a new object. - [x] `ProxyState` is public because of `RealmObjectProxy` is in the internal package.- (Do it later #4044) - [x] Figure out how to deliver async transaction callbacks. - [ ] Check the exception thrown problem in the external_commit_helper thread. - [x] Memory with `SortDescriptor` - [x] Aggregates (
TODOs moved from #3372
- [x] Use `Results` from ObejctStore - [x] Just use async query from OS? Maybe remove FIXME in `RealmNotifier`? - [x] Move `HandlerControler` and `AndroidNotifier` to `io.realm.internal` - [x] FIXME in `AndroidNotifier`, simplify the calling routing? - [x] Check the use case in `Realm.where(AllTypes.class).findAllAsync().where().findAllAsync()`. It is useful to build async queries for
## Behaviour changes:
### See for more details
- [x] For a local commit, Realm change listener will be called before the `beginTransaction()` returns or `commitTransaction()` returns. Is it acceptable?
## Things don't impact review but have to be solved before MERGE - [ ] Close realm inside `did_change` callbacks - [x] Update core to `v2.3.1` to solve the linkview base query handover. - [ ] CHECK THE OBJECT STORE SUBMODULE VERSION IN THIS PR!!! - [ ] Async and db size

Issue.Title: RealmConfiguration.allowWritesOnUiThread()
Issue.Description: After a discussion in #2952, we came to the conclusion that given how async queries work, it is impossible to mix synchronous writes on the UI thread and async queries and still guarantee a consistent view for all RealmResults: Before we changed `syncIfNeeded` to only happen on Looper threads the problem also existed, but instead manifested itself as all async queries would convert to run directly on the UI instead, which broke the API contract given by `findAllAsync()`After we changed it, the problem became worse though as now async RealmResults would `advance_read` (due to the commit), but detached row accessors might appear due to us not calling `syncIfNeeded`. This could result in unexpected crashes.This race condition is impossible to avoid, so I suggest the following changes:#2952 will introduce a log warning if you mix those async queries and sync writes. This will be shipped in 1.0.1In 1.1.0 or later, we introduce a new `RealmConfiguration.allowWritesOnUiThread()` option. The default value is `true` to avoid breaking changes, but it will make it possible for people to it on and fix their code.In 2.0 we change the default value from `true` to `false`, so the default behaviour is that writes on the UI thread is not allowed.

Issue.Title: Firebase like APIs
Issue.Description: I've played a bit with **Firebase Realtime Database** and I have to say, their APIs are awesome.**Reading** works in two way: listen for changes in the object (receiving the whole object in the callback) or listen for changes in the object child (receiving an added/removed/changed callback for a child of the object). The first way is useful for when you read data of an object (I used it with Views that know the url of their attribute and read directly from the Snapshot), the second one is perfect for RecyclerView, to notify the adapter with events from the database.You don't have a query API that returns the object, the listener is called immediately after you run the query (and every time something happens to the object). Callbacks return a DataSnapshot, a snapshot of the data of when the change happened. You can navigate the snapshot (or any other reference) by using urls, like:``It also works with POJOs to define the objects and just read/write them (it serialize/deserialize a JSON, ala Realm).This is just a very quick explanation to show you the basic idea.**Would it be possibile to create something like this with Realm?**

Issue.Title: Outofmemory with IntentService.
Issue.Description: Hi Realm team, First of all thank you guys for making this beautiful ORM +1: I am developing an application which need to sync local data to server. while i am using IntentService to perform background task and everything runs great but something realm getting crashed because of memory leak. PullRequest.Title: Chained distinct/distintAsync calls does not yield expected results
PullRequest.Description: The idea is to interweave different values in 2's multiplier and 3's multiplier in a way thatthe outcome is different if the order of distinct\* operations alternates.An example is illustrated below.``Suppose we are to execute `realm.where(Foo.class).findAll().distinct("indexedString").distinct("indexedLong")`, the outcome might be O1(A, 1) and the total count should be one (1) since distinct takes the first element when two elements are identical.In case of `realm.where(Foo.class).findAll().distinct("indexedLong").distinct("indexedString")`, the outcome would be O1(A,1) and O2(B,2) and the total count should two (2). Similar outcome is expected to chained `distinctAsync()`.

Issue.Title: RealmChangeListener on RealmResults called even when data inside given collection is not modified.
Issue.Description: #### GoalI want to receive events only when a given `RealmObject` or a `RealmResults Collection` is altered.#### Expected ResultsA `RealmChangeListener` docs says:> Register against a `RealmResults` or `RealmObject` **to only get notified about changes to them**.#### Actual ResultsI got a notification on an every Realm change, just like in case of registering a `RealmChangeListener` against a `Realm`.#### Steps & Code to ReproduceJust add a `RealmChangeListener` to `RealmResults`, put logging there, and perform some changes not-connected with mentioned collection.#### Code Sample``#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.0.0Android Studio version: 2.1.1Which Android version and device: Any, especially x86_64 emulator with Android 6.0 and Samsung SM-G531F with Android 5.1.1

Issue.Title: Realm not copying database from assets
Issue.Description: #### Goal> What do you want to achieve?> Copy a pre-filled database from assets by using .assetFile(context, "default.realm")#### Expected Results> Database gets copied and contains all the data#### Actual Results> Copied database is only 4kb in size, while the original database in the assets folder is 123kb in size.> Using realm.isEmpty() returns true, which it should not. The Realm Browser for OS X correctly shows all the data in the database. Using realm.where() always returns an empty result.#### Steps & Code to Reproduce> RealmConfiguration config = new RealmConfiguration.Builder(context)> .name("default.realm")> .schemaVersion(1)> .assetFile(context, "default.realm")> .deleteRealmIfMigrationNeeded()> .build();> > Realm realm = Realm.getInstance(config);> realm.isEmpty() // => trueUsing this code, realm.isEmpty() always prints true#### Version of Realm and toolingRealm version(s): 1.0.0Android Studio version: 2.2 Preview 2Which Android version and device: CM 13 Android 6.0.1 Galaxy S5 klte

Issue.Title: RealmResults<Foo> change listener not called after adding new Foo objects to Realm.
Issue.Description: Hey, guys, currently I am enjoying 0.84.2 version of Realm. And I must say, RealmResults ChangeListener, is kinda confusing. Let's take RealmResults<Foo> for example. It works as expected whenever:1) I do async find from Realm(listener gets notified when the query completes)2) I update existing object in Foo.class tableBut it doesn't get called after I put new new objects of type Foo to Realm.As your documentation states:"This listener will be called every time the RealmResults is updated to reflect the latest changes in the Realm (usually after a commit)".So is it a bug or I am missing something?Thanks in advance.

Issue.Title: Unexpected adapter view refresh after onPause()
Issue.Code: ===>: TaskSentDetailFragment::onPause() ===>: TaskSentListFragment::onActivityCreated() //Will trigger the communication to Server ===>: TaskSentListFragment::onResume() ===>: onGetSentTasks // Server has replied, update the Realm DB ===>:java.lang.IllegalStateException: Illegal State: Object is no longer valid to operate on. Was it deleted by another thread? `
Issue.Description: Hi all,I'm getting this exception `java.lang.IllegalStateException: Illegal State: Object is no longer valid to operate on Was it deleted by another thread?"`. The exception is thrown from a `Adapter::getGroupCount()` method. Which doesn't make sense to me is fragment's `onPause()` method has already been invoked.The whole sequence is as following: There are 5 steps as following. What's worthy mentioning is in step 2, a server request is made, and in step 4 the server replies a response, and we save the data into the Realm DB, which cause the exception. Again, what I don't understand, is the TaskSentDetailFragment is already in "onPause" state. Which its adapter is still being invoked. Is there some way to bypass this ``

Issue.Title: RealmConfiguration.getSchemaMediator is public
Issue.Description: It seems we by mistake left `RealmConfiguration.getSchemaMediator` public.We should revert that to package private.That said, there might still be use-cases where people want to know the classes part of the RealmConfiguration, so we should expose something like``One example of use case here:

Issue.Title: Force clear Realm file
Issue.Description: In our app, we're clearing our Realm file when the user chooses to sign out of the account. Now, in the present format, Realm does not allow clearing of the file until all Realms instances are closed.This has become a problem for us because there are several classes which are maintaining their own Realm instances (all on the UI thread). Is there a way to force clear everything in Realm?

If I add the relationships in another transaction it works, but is this really necessary? It would be great to only iterate once over all my objects to update them.Best regards,Ben

Issue.Title: Newly opened Realm is not up-to-date
Issue.Description: ### GoalsI have a Realm open in an activity. I update a Realm object to set a boolean (`setEdited(true)`) and commit the transaction. Immediately following that, I begin a background operation to sync this change with a web service. The background operation opens its own Realm (`Realm.getDefaultInstance()`) and gets the updated object using its string ID. However, in this background operation, the boolean field has not been updated - its value is still `false`. I would expect the value to reflect the most recent change to the data. If I manually call `realm.refresh()` after opening the background Realm, then it works as expected.### Expected resultsThe value is up-to-date in the newly opened Realm.### Actual resultsThe value is out-of-date.### Version of Realm/Android Studio/OSRealm: 0.8.4Android Studio: 1.5 BetaOS: Mac OS X 10.11

Issue.Title: lessThan with negative id's not working as expected
Issue.Description: I am working with RealmObjects where i use negative id's (as long as they are not synced to the server).So, when i synchronize with the server, i can get all negative id's, synchronize those objects and when synchronized, update the id.But, when i perform a lessThan query on a RealmResult, there are less objects returned than expected.When i use between (with f.e. values -10000, 0), it is working and i am getting all the objects returned that i expect.So it looks like the behaviour of lessThan with negative number is not working the way i would expect it to be, Is this a bug or is there a good explanation for this?I created a small android studio project, with a TestApplication where this test is setup, which fails (only 2 of the 10 objects are retreived). Project is on github: I am testing with a Samsung Galaxy S6, Android version 5.1.1

Issue.Title: Add gotcha to doc: Never loop over RealmResults and update its items
Issue.Description: So I spent quite some time wondering why some items weren't getting updated while looping over a `RealmResults`. The code is something similar to this:``On first look, this code looks perfectly fine. However, I was just unable to understand why some items were getting skipped. And I soon realized why because `RealmResults` is a live list! Damn. Updating items in the results was causing the `RealmResults` to auto-update its content. The indices were not consistent!Looping using an interator results in an exception being thrown, which makes sense. But this code will never raise any exception and the dev. might never understand what and why is it going wrong.Maybe you can mention this that it should never be updated while looping, even when using a fori loop. :sweat_smile:

Issue.Title: Nested recursive list not being saved
Issue.Description: Hey guys,First off, love Realm, and have been using it without issues for the past 8-10 months - this is the first issue I have with it that has stumped me a bit.I have a Category data model that can have a list of Categories, or a list of Items. The Items in turn can have a list of Items as well (so they're recursive, but not self-referential, as in there aren't any loops). One of these Item classes deep in the hierarchy is losing its Items list.The json is read out properly - if I do a count on said Item object's Item list, it shows 9, as it should. I then pop it into Realm, and when I try grabbing it again, the list is empty. The hierarchy is as follows: `[wrapper object (also in Realm)] -> Clients list -> Category list -> Category list -> Items list -> Items list`The last Items list is empty. I wonder if it's something to do with the recursive nature of it? I don't really know where it's going wrong. I tried grabbing just the penultimate Item object from realm, and grabbing the wrapper object and drilling down into the hierarchy, but the list is empty in both cases.If you need any more info, give me a shout. I can send data models and sample json if you need it. Any pointers would be greatly appreciated!

Issue.Title: Should have a check if value is a valid managed object or not in setter of link/link list.
Issue.Description: relatd to #1745

Issue.Title: RealmResults change listeners break sync queries
Issue.Description: I have been working on re-architecting my app to make use of async queries. Unfortunately it seems like using any kind of change listener on realm results breaks sync queries in a subtle way.For my sync queries, I'm pulling from an api, updating realm in another thread, passing the ids back and then loading the realm objects on the main thread from those ids. If there are no realm result change listeners registered elsewhere, this works fine. As soon as one is introduced, however, my queries on the main thread of those ids find no objects. There seems to be some kind of timing issue going on because if I put a breakpoint at the end of the transaction and leave it for a second, it all works fine. Any idea what would be causing this timing issue with stale data?Below is the code for my sync queries using Rx (some cruft chopped out for brevity)``RealmMap just handles mapping the int[] to a proper list of items.Code for the async queries is as basic as any example. Just a simple query with a listener attached. I've verified it is definitely the listener and not the async query itself because if I just remove the listener it works fine again.

Issue.Title: Support listening to changes on Non-looper threads
Issue.Description: All our change listeners depend on the UI thread to function. This means it can be tricky to tell background threads when to update the realm instances to the latest version. Also right now we don't warn people if they register an listener on a non-looper thread. This means there are a number of choices we can makea) Throw exception when using listener on non-looper threads. ?b) Allow listeners and find some other way of triggering them?Would a pattern like the below make sense? It would effectively let people create their own event queue just for Realm events:``

Issue.Title: Trying to catch a dead lock
Issue.Description: Hi there,I'm trying to locate a dead-lock which is happening somewhere inside Realm.By logging I found that I get an infinite ANR in `onCreate()` of the MainActivity on the line `Realm.getDefaultInstance()`. Another place where it hangs is a worker thread on the line `Realm.close()`.Here is how the worker thread body looks like (without the domain details):``Here is the sequence of actions accordingly to logs:1. Application.onCreate() called and starts the worker thread2. Worker thread is going through the items3. MainActivity.onCreate() called and it hangs on Realm.getDefaultInstance()4. Exception thrown in the worker thread, and it hangs on realm.close()5. Infinite ANR in MainActivityIt's very hard to locate the problem because it's not 100% reproducible and time-dependent. If I remove transaction, or there is no exception then the dead-lock doesn't happen (could be just due to timing). Also, I have another running worker thread in background which uses realm. But it successfully finishes and doesn't hang on `realm.close()`. I tried to reproduce it in a small project, but it didn't work out.I hope this description could lead you to some ideas what could go wrong, or what I can check to locate the exact problem.

I have checked the realmResults after the "filter" phase on the publishResults method and it is filtered, but the list on the UI still contains all the items of the original realmResults.What I am missing here?Thank youGabriel

Referenced from io.realm.processor.RealmProxyClassGenerator.Priority: 6 / 10Category: CorrectnessSeverity: ErrorExplanation: Finds API accesses to APIs that are not supported in Android.This check scans through libraries looking for calls to APIs that are not included in Android.When you create Android projects, the classpath is set up such that you can only access classes in the API packages that are included in Android. However, if you add other projects to your libs/ folder, there is no guarantee that those .jar files were built with an Android specific classpath, and in particular, they could be accessing unsupported APIs such as java.applet.This check scans through library jars and looks for references to API packages that are not included in Android and flags these. This is only an error if your code calls one of the library classes which wind up referencing the unsupported package.More info:To suppress this error, use the issue id "InvalidPackage" as explained in the Suppressing Warnings and Errors section.

Issue.Title: RealmList<Integer / String / ...>
Issue.Description:
Dear realm-Team,
I'm really impressed by Realm and I do like the way you're providing support and solutions on github, SO and gGroups! I like working with Realm - however there are three really big drawbacks for me:
1) No model-instantiation by `= new ...` - I know you're on it. I can't wait for this! Do we have to wait for the "whole" JSON-Upgrade or will there be an earlier release providing this feature?
2) No model-passing across threads. That's hindering all the great benefits of EventBus and Android Priority Job Queue. But I read that it will be possible in the further versions and I'm looking forward on this.
3) **The reason for this issue:** In my model class I'm allowed to have primitive fields as well as object fields of objects that extend `RealmObject`. But I'm not allowed to have a field type like `RealmList<Integer>` or `RealmList<String>`. However it is possible to work around this by
``
It works but it's _really_ ugly and should be unnecessary in my opinion. Is there any improvement planned regarding this?
Thanks again for your great work - I'm glad Realm helps me developing my app!
---
Related PRs: - [ ] API design (#4165) - [ ] Implementation (#5031)

PullRequest.Title: RFC: Primitive List API
PullRequest.Description:
With work in Core slowly picking up speed regarding Primitive List support, we need to start thinking about how the public API is going to look like. Also, so it can guide the underlying implementation.
This document tries to flesh out the various proposals that have been discusse so we can get feedback on the direction as well as guide Cores design decisions.
Thoughts @realm/java ?
References #575

PullRequest.Title: Support Primitive List feature
PullRequest.Description:
This PR implements #4165 and fixes #575.
TODO: **Required:** - [x] Add, modify APIs (@zaki50) #5145 - [x] Loosen type restriction on `RealmList<RealmModel>` to `RealmList<Object>` (@zaki50) #5145 - [x] Loosen type restriction on `RealmResults<RealmModel>` to `RealmResults<Object>` (@zaki50) #5145 - [x] Implement type parameter check in annotation processor (@zaki50) #5168 - [x] Implement Schema related feature used on initialization (@zaki50) #5209 (part 7) - [x] Implement proxy's getters/setters logic in annotation processor (@zaki50) #5210 (part 8) - [x] Implement support for primitives in `RealmList` (Java side, @zaki50) #5213 (part 9) - [x] Wire with Core/Object Store (@beeender) #5208 (part 6), #5216 (part10) - [x] Fix for change listener (@beeender) #5259 (part 13) - [x] Fix a bug introduced in this feature branch (@zaki50) #5266 - [x] If we merge feature branch without optional feature, we need to add a code to throw an exception to some methods which does not support primitive list (ex. `createSnapshot()`) (@zaki50) #5336 (part 15)
**Optional/In prioritized order:** - [x] `copyToRealm/copyOrUpdate` (@zaki50) #5210 (part 8) - [x] `insert/insertOrUpdate` (@zaki50) #5210 (part 8) - [x] `copyFromRealm` (@zaki50) #5210 (part 8) - [ ] APIs for migration (mainly methods in `RealmObjectSchema`) (@cmelchior) #5329 - [ ] `OrderedRealmCollectionImpl`, `OrderedRealmCollectionSnapshot` (@zaki50) #5220 (part11) - [ ] Dynamic API (@zaki50) #5221 (part 12) - [ ] Query APIs for list elements - [ ] Query APIs for object (by using primitive list value) - [ ] Implement support for primitives in `RealmResults` (@zaki50) #5220 (part11) - [ ] JSON APIs

Issue.Title: Realm JSON API
Issue.Description: This issue is work-in-progress and describe the vision and proposed API's for working with JSON and Realm on Android. It was moved from the Wiki to here to ease discussion.The current prototype can be found here: ## VisionRealm should understand JSON so well that ~80% of all use-cases can be supported without needing 3rd party tools. For the last 20% people should either do it by hand or using GSON/Jackson.The primary use case is dumping data from the network into Realm, this should be as easy as possible.## Requirements**High priority**- Map between JSON naming and RealmObject naming.- Select JSON nodes from a nested structure.- Map many different date formats.- Ignore JSON properties even though they exist in the model class.- Handle different casing rules.- Serialize RealmObject back to JSON (Core already has some native support for this?)**Low priority**- Select a single array node from a nested structure- Value transformations: - Combine two strings with custom separator - Add two numbers together - Subtract two numbers - Others?## 3rd party toolsThe primary JSON libraries are GSON and Jackson. The primary blocker for not supporting them is that people are not able to add standalone objects to Realm. Once we fix this, I don't see any reason for not supporting both very easily.## APIThe proposed API consists of 2 ways of configuring the JSON mapping: Through annotations and/or through a RealmJSONMapper class. Annotations should cover most use cases while RealmJSONMapper should only be needed for special requirements.This is the same approach that GSON has.I will discuss the API from an example. So code first, explanations later:**Input JSON**``## Naming PolicyThe default casing rule should either be STRICT or LOWERCASE ie, either json names and field names has to match or the comparison is done after lowercasing both. I would suggest LOWERCASE as that is the most forgiving.GSON has a lot more options in a special class called FieldNamingPolicy. We should add something something similar in the RealmJSONMapper. I have called our NameComparisonPolicy as that seemed more appropriate.## Mapping namesMapping between JSON names and Java names should just follow our default naming policy, unless overriden by a @SerializedName annotation.This allow for fine grained control of different naming schemes.@SerializedName is also used by GSON.## Parsing datesWe want to support two types of dates: longs and Strings that can be parsed by a date specification.Dates of type long are supported implicitly (ie. we do the conversion automatically). String dates are supported through the @SerializedDateFormat annotation.We should allow all the same arguments as those specified here: @SerializedDateFormat is not used by GSON, but the similar name should hopefully make sense for people.## Extracting child nodesUsed to extract a different node in the JSON hierarchy. This is useful if incoming JSON is not formatted nicely. I have seen JSON like my example in the wild, and by having this, people don't have to create unnecessary model classes, like they do with GSON currently.The name @NodePath is a bit arbitrary and could probably use some iterations. Feedback welcome. Perhaps it could be combined with @SerializedName in order to reduce the number of annotations.## Ignore JSON fieldsCould be a useful feature. I havn't seen a use case though. @Ignore annotation also prevents importing the JSON value. @IgnoreNode should feel similar to @NodePath but it is still a bit arbitrary. ## RealmJSONMapperShould use the Builder pattern to build all the mapping rules used. Behind the scenes we should probably convert annotations to this as well, but by exposing it we can hide all kind of crazy options without polluting the rest of the API.Names differ a bit from the annotations but I feel they flow better that way. Feedback on style/naming very welcome.## Some discussion points- Is it JSON or Json in API names?- createAll vs. createObjects: createAll is similar to addAll from Lists in Java. I feel that createObject and createObjects are to similar, but input on this would be appreciated.- Support for child JSONMappers on sub nodes? Ie. should it be possible to set a another Mapper class on any one childNode? Probably low priority.- Any other requirements. iOS has had time to gather more feedback about their current solution?

Issue.Title: No way to specify sort order in a query
Issue.Description: It would be useful to be able to specify a sort order for results in a query, similar to ORDER BY in SQL.This would be particularly useful when using an autoupdating RealmBaseAdapter. Currently, when new objects are added to the realm, they are automatically added to the end of a ListView backed by a RealmBaseAdapter. However, my use case requires that objects are displayed from most recent to oldest. So instead of using autoupdate, I have to listen for a change notification, remove the existing objects from the adapter, and then add all objects to the adapter so as to get the correct order. This jumps the ListView to the top, which is not ideal.

Issue.Title: LIMIT
Issue.Description: It would be very useful to be able to specify the maximum number of objects to return in a query, similar to LIMIT in SQL. Otherwise the RealmResults list must be manually trimmed with subList.

Issue.Title: Design of Realm-Android.
Issue.Description: Hi developers of Realm-Android.I would like to start with a word of gratitude for your effort on creating database which can become great alternative to poor and very limited SQLite implementation on Android :+1:. Due to fact that this project is in very early stage and still does not support polymorphism, indexes on primitive data types, support for some basic objective types (like Number subclasses) nor null values for objective types, I have started to read realm-java source code in order to help a bit with its development ;). As a part of learning curve, I have a question related to the db and library designs:Could you please share with my rationale about forcing RealmObject as a base class for the user-defined classes? As far as I understand what is going on under the hood, all of the RealmObject direct subclasses are parser and for each such a object an *RealmProxy subclass is generated at runtime. Since simple interfaces can also support annotations, I believe it would be easier to create *RealmProxy objects from interfaces instead of RealmObject class. Also, as my understanding of java goes, your current approach makes it impossible to implement Polymorphism of objects stored in database.PS: Please take a look at - I think that approach taken by its developers would nicely apply to the ease-of-use you guys are trying to achieve. Though it would require a realm-java to be set of 2 components: compiler library (as lombok) and db library shiped with each and every app that uses the Realm-Java.

Issue.Title: bug:Failed adding to JNI pinned array ref table (1024 entries)

Issue.Title: Create an Android library depending on Realm
Issue.Description: Hello Realm,First of all, let me say that I find that you're doing a great work with Realm, which is really an elegant solution for database management. So keep up the good work!I'm facing an issue, which is most a question regarding a limitation I found on Realm.I'm trying to build an Android library integrating Realm, so that several Android applications can use a common data model system, thanks to this library.The use case I want to achieve is that the developer of the application can have its own Realm database and can integrate the library which will deal with the common data model system at the same time.Unfortunately, when trying to do so, I encounter the following error:UNEXPECTED TOP-LEVEL EXCEPTION:com.android.dex.DexException: Multiple dex files define Lio/realm/ValidationList; My understanding is that Realm creates this ValidationList class according to the classes that extend RealmObject inside the project, and so there is a ValidationList class created for the library and another one created for the application, which result in this Multiple dex files define error.I also understand that the ValidationList has to be created at a unique location, inside the io.realm package.So, my question is: is this a known limitation for Realm? Can we consider the use case feasible in a future version of Realm?Once again, congratulations for the work done so far with Realm: it's very easy to understand and use!Thanks,Gauthier

Issue.Title: Error generating ProxyRealm classes
Issue.Description: Good morning,I think I found a bug concerning ProxyRealm classes generation.I have three distinct entities called A, B, C and D. Such entities have this relationship diagramA -1:1- BA -1:N- CC -1:N- DA and B are located in the same java package.C and D are located in the same java package, but different from A and B.On compilation time I receive that AProxyRealm class cannot find C class. However, if I move C and D to the same package as A and B compiles with no issues. Not sure if it is a limitation or a known bug.C and D are modeled as private RealmList<C> method inside A and C respectively.I hope I made myself clear.Thanks for an already great work.

Issue.Title: Support KotlinLang

Issue.Title: Deleted items still present in query results
Issue.Description: I've encountered a data consistency issue when deleting on a background thread from a different context. I have a list of items, and clicking on an item will open a secondary activity. If the item is deleted on a background thread on this secondary activity, it will still show on the list back in the first activity. The list data is reloaded inside `onResume`, and the list activity registers with realm for change events. Even if the data is reloaded explicitly, the deleted item is still present in the result set.The deleted item will only be removed from the result set if you either do a write operation (insert a new element into the list) or restart the app. Simply sending the app to the background and resuming it again doesn't solve the issue. The app needs to be force stopped and then restarted. Deleting the item from a background thread on the list activity will remove the item from the list. Deleting the item on the main thread from the secondary activity will also remove the item from the list. Deleting the item on a background thread on the secondary activity will _not_ remove the item from the list.I've modified my sample realm project to replicate the issue:Once compiled, the app is named "Realm.io." It's very simple to reproduce the issue. Just click on `Add Item` menu option to add an item. Click on the item to open the secondary activity and click on the `Delete!` button. Once the secondary activity finishes, the first activity will still show the deleted item on the list. If you click on `Add Item` once again, the deleted item will be removed and a new item will be inserted on the list. The deleted item can also be removed by pushing the app to the background, swiping it away from the recent apps list and starting it over.

Issue.Title: Allow access to the Eclipse setup tab page from China (with no access to youtube)
Issue.Description: The page looks beautiful, but when I click the "Eclipse" tab on the setup section, nothing happens. I tried IE 11, Firefox 34.0, all the same. Please fix this. It's very lame.

Issue.Title: Queries on RealmList Failing; Not Implemented
Issue.Description: I have a model with a many-to-many relationship, so it has a RealmList. I tried to do `model.getTransactions().where()`, but I got a null pointer exception. Curious, I looked in the source code and found that [RealmList.where()]( is not implemented.The [documentation]( says this is supposed to work.Would it be possible for someone to update documentation to match the code, or vice versa? It's frustrating when the documented behavior is different than the actual behavior.

Issue.Title: Loading Realm Objects on the UI Thread
Issue.Description: In [Using Realm Across Threads]( the documentation states that,> "The only rule to using Realm across threads is to remember that Realm, RealmObject or RealmResults instances cannot be passed across threads."In Android (and any other GUI application) it's a big no-no to load/query data on the UI thread. When using SQLite, the convention is to create an AsyncTask in your Activity that populates the UI elements with data from the SQLite database.With Realm, the documentation actively advises against passing results to from a background thread to a UI thread (as it's considered "across" a thread). I have seen the [RealmConcurrencyExample]( but unfortunately it uses two background (non-UI threads). In [RealmGridViewExample]( the query to the Realm database is made on the UI thread.My questions about this are:- Is loading Realm data on the UI thread okay? Are there any disadvantages to doing so?- If it's not okay to load Realm data on the UI thread, how should I populate my UI elements with Realm data when potentially large queries are involved?- Would it be possible to update the documentation to explain to developers whether it's okay to load on the UI thread? I would think many other Android developers would be concerned about executing a Realm call on the UI thread without knowing the ramifications.By the way, you guys have a great product here. I can't wait to see how it grows.

Issue.Title: [Feature Request] Project Lombok integration?
Issue.Description: Hi to all,first of all, great job. I tried to make cooperate Lombok ( and Realm.io together, but the compilation stops when the processor analyzes the annotation (@Getter/@Setter) in classes that integrate Lombok's style. It would be nice if the two libraries could coexist. You would have a cleaner code.

Issue.Title: Enable different operations for Table and View columns

Since different operations for Table and View columns are required, appropriate table-specific and view-specific sub-classes (XyzTableColumn and XyzViewColumn) should be used instead.

Issue.Title: The "field sorter" work-around doesn't work for classes outside the sources input/output directory.
Issue.Description: The "field sorter" work-around needs to find the Java source files, to be able to read the field order from there.So far, the generated sources folder was configured to be the same as the originating sources folder (e.g. "src/main/java" or "src") and it was used to search the Java source file for the model. But if the model class is in other package (e.g. "src/test/java", the field sorter searches for the model Java file in the configured output folder (e.g. "src/main/java"), so it cannot find it. Thus, to support additional source folders, the annotation processor needs additional configuration, e.g. path="src/test/java".When such feature is implemented, it will give flexibility to specify more source paths, e.g. path="src/main/java:src/test/java", giving additional flexibility to specify any input folders for the "model" sources and any output folder for the generated sources.

Issue.Title: Separate model is required for the tests
Some public methods in the low-level API are not yet used by the high-level wrapper.
Generating code from empty model class produced incorrect code
Issue.Description: When a source code is generated from empty model class (without fields), the produced source code for the table doesn't compile. Such situations should be properly handled.

Issue.Title: Remove all generated code from the repository
Requiring lowercase class names when declaring tables
Issue.Description: Currently, classes that are used to declare tables must have uncapitalized names. This is because the code generator generates a cursor class with the same name except that in this case it is capitalized.I don't like having to write classes with lower case names, and I fear that a lot of Java programmers are going to hate us for it.I suggest that we either:- Rename the cursor class from Employee to EmployeeCursor or EmployeeRow, and thereby allowing for the declaration class to be renamed from 'employee' to Employee.- Rename the declaration class from 'employee' to EmployeeRow, or EmployeeDecl, or EmployeeSpec.In the latter case, the code generator would then strip off the suffix. It might even be made to recognize and strip off any of the three mentioned suffices. Since the declaration table is not actually used for anything, currently, the prettyness of its name should not matter too much.On the other hand, the declaration class could be made to have some useful purposes, for example, we might want to allow something like the following (this assumes that the declaration class is renamed to 'Employee' and the cursor class is renamed to 'EmployeeRow'):``

Issue.Title: FieldSorter in code generator fails
Issue.Code:
warning: The file doesn't exist: /tmp/temp.pEPW/my.java Note: Scanning source path '/tmp/temp.pEPW' for table spec 'hilbert' error: Table spec retrieval failed! error: Field sorting failed, couldn't find table spec: hilbert
This causes the generator to abort.
When I comment out the invocation, everything works perfectly (assuming a few other reported issues are fixed as suggested).
The following comment suggests that the FieldSorter is a temporary "work around", so maybe we should fix the core problem and get rid of it.
// sort the fields, due to unresolved bug in Eclipse APT fieldSorter.sortFields(fields, model, sourcesPath); `

Issue.Title: Why a separate step to transform code genrator templates?
Issue.Description: Apparently, there is a separate step in the build process that transforms the templates of the code generator from individual files into strings inside a Java class.Why did we do that?In my opinion, it serves only to complicate the build process.Why don't we simply include the template files inside the JAR file? One would then have to use getResource() or getResourceAsStream() on Class or ClassLoader.

Issue.Title: Should our code generator be part of tightdb.jar?

When the customer deploys the code, they still need to include tightdb.jar, but there is no longer any need for the generator.I suggest we produce two JARs:tightdb.jartightdb-codegen.jar

Issue.Title: Code generator constructs invalid names for source files.
Issue.Description: AbstractAnnotationProcessor.writeToSourceFile(), joins a package name with a class name using a "/" rather than a ".". This causes the generator to produce an invalid name for the generated source file, which in turn causes the generator to abort.

Issue.Title: Code generation fails when there is no package
Issue.Description: CodeGenProcessor.calculatePackageName() and/or its caller processAnnotatedElements() assumes that the customers code lives in a Java package. When it does not, the generator fails.

Issue.Title: Version warning from annotation processor
Issue.Description: I get a warning when the annotation processor runs because it declares that it does not understand Java source format beyond version 6. In com/tightdb/generator/CodeGenProcessor.java:@SupportedSourceVersion(SourceVersion.RELEASE_6)should probably be changed to@SupportedSourceVersion(SourceVersion.RELEASE_7)Of course, we can only make this change if our processor actually understands version 7 syntax properly. If not, we must update the processor.

Issue.Title: Anonymous variadic macros are not part of C++03
Issue.Description: tightdb_java2/tightdb_jni/src/util.hpp defines an anonymous variadic macro. Since they are not part of C++03, we should not use them.Note: Anonymous variadic macros were introduced in C99 as well as C++11.

Issue.Title: Implement table and view iterator [1-2h]
Issue.Description: Implement table and view iterator.

Issue.Title: Design and implement rowset column aggregation and manipulation [2-3h]
Issue.Description: Design and implement the aggregation and manipulation operations for all the table-or-view-specific column types, e.g. getAll(), setAll(), etc.

Issue.Title: Improve type-safety of table and view columns [1-2h]
Issue.Description: Introduce table-or-view-specific column for all column types, to provide column operations for a list of records - aggregation, projection, etc. and disable cursor-specific operations. For example, the get() operation should return a list of values, instead only one.

Issue.Title: Improve type-safety of cursor columns [1-2h]
Issue.Description: Improve the type-safety of the cursor column operations, by introducing cursor-specific columns for all the column types. Such columns will allow only column operations for a single cursor, so the following statement won't be possible:persons.at(2).firstName.min("X")

Issue.Title: Improve type-safety of query columns [1-2h]
Issue.Description: Improve the type-safety of the query mechanism, by introducing query-only columns for all the column types. Such columns will allow query construction, but not aggregation or projection, so the following statement won't be possible:persons.firstName.is("X").or().salary.set(1234);

Issue.Title: Replace the improvised with real types from v1.1 [0.5-1h]
Issue.Description: Replace the improvised column types with the real types from Core JNI API v1.1.

Issue.Title: Write JavaDocs for the public API classes
Issue.Description: Write JavaDocs for the public API classes.

Issue.Title: Migrate to Core JNI API v1.1 [0.5-1h]
Issue.Description: Migrate (table declaration etc.) to v1.1 of the Core JNI API:- hand-written example,- code generator.

Issue.Title: Implement code generation for column list retrieval [0.5-1h]
Issue.Description: Implement code generation for column list retrieval.

Issue.Title: Implement the code generation for view and query [3-5h]
Issue.Description: Implement the view and query library for advanced operations (search & aggregation).

Issue.Title: Implement the view and query library [8-12h]
Issue.Description: Implement the view and query library for advanced operations (search & aggregation).

Issue.Title: Implement code generation for nested tables [2-3h]
Issue.Description: Implement code generation for nested tables (basic operations).

Issue.Title: Complete the library for nested tables [3-5h]
Issue.Description: Complete the design and implement the library for nested tables.

Issue.Title: Implement code generation for the other columns types [2-3h]
Issue.Description: implement code generation for the other columns types (boolean, date, binary, mixed)

Issue.Title: Complete the library for the other columns types [3-4h]
Issue.Description: Complete the design and implement the library for the other columns types (boolean, date, binary, mixed)
